U6k9DueugRk3fSyfhD2HPg.text: Had lunch at this place on weekday. The sushi was fresh and flavorful. I recommend this place and I will return here. Vegas has everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iMc7ghhIj2aT09i9gF__5g.text: This place is awesome!  We went on a Saturday evening (10pm). It wasn't packed and we were seated at the bar right away. The chef there was super friendly and told us what was fresh for the day and what the best sellers were.   The ayce option is great- their yellowtail, fatty salmon, and eel were the best in my opinion. We also get one order of uni and sweet shrimp per order. Those were really fresh.  One thing that separates this place from others- service. The owner was there at 10pm on a Saturday. She seems really dedicated to the business and actually didn't leave until She made sure everyone's water was refilled even though she had told her team she was going home 10 minutes earlier. That's dedication!  Next time I'm back in Vegas I'll make sure to come back. It's only about a mile off strip.

N2fF8TeGg99MHb2cA_2Uug.text: Well let me just say first that I would have like to give sushi way 4 stars based on the food, but it had to many other hang ups keeping me from giving it the 4 star rating. My wife, family, and I love to eat sushi. We usually find ourselfs in vegas 1 to 2 times a year. When we come to Vegas we usually eat sushi at least 2 times during our stay. We usually look look on Yelp for new AYCE sushi restaurants. This trip we tried island sushi, and sushi way. Island sushi was a great experience. When I found sushi way it had limited reviews, but the pictures looked great. We decided to go ahead and give it a try. When we sat we were the only customers there. We put in our order very quickly. The appetizers came out pretty quick,and were very tasty. Sushi on the other hand was a different story. There was only one sushi cutter. More customers started to arrive. The sushi cutter looked like he was off in outer space. There was no sense of urgency. There was a 60 min time cap when eating. We were there for 2 and half hours.im guessing they let us go over the time limit because it was taking 10 mins in between half orders rolls.Sometimes when i would look at the cutter, he would just be starring at the wall as orders were piling up. Maybe he was just ovetwhelmed, either way its made for a bad experiance. About 2 hours into lunch another sushi cutter comes frantically running in. It wasn't till he arrived that sushi started coming out. Also the waiter and waitresses would walk away as you were trying to order. They would say that they had your order down as they walked away, however they would either forget items of bring out wrong items. Food was 4 stars, service was 1 star. I decided to go with 3 over all stars. All negative critique aside I will give it another try. If the service is corrected I see 5 star potential.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good sushi nachos
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy tuna

UsZwvpsH-N5FbRo0ngPk9A.text: I've been to this AYCE sushi place multiple times with positive experiences. Some way, some how this sushi restaurant has fresh top-tier quality fish.   If anyone is craving AYCE sushi, I highly recommend this restaurant!

bBiYuk1mHyaS3rKVbrvNIQ.text: My friend and I ended up here after being greatly poorly at nearby Sakana... They are open until 2am for AYCE. It was empty when we arrived but it was 11:30pm on a Tuesday during the pre holiday season when UNLV and most of vegas was slow  Pros: very clean, nice server, open late..  Cons:  Portion: while the Gyzoa was very fresh we couldn't fathom why am order for two people would only have 2 pieces( 1 for each). The gal I was super small and cut oddly   menu: it would be better if it had pictures...reading through the list as it was organized wasn't the easiest.  Subjective taste:  the sushi was not to my taste...I don't like cream cheese rolls and they had many... I wasn't a fan for the garlic ponzu sauce and their spicy tuna just wasn't to my taste.   So... Why a 3 star.. They were clean, good service and while the food wasn't to my sushi taste my friend liked hers and I have to round up on the subjective side

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnage
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday sweet roll dessert
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura spicy tuna roll with garlic ponzu sauce

1LsaLwz90JaC6QiMnQynYw.text: Your typical place for AYCE sushi. Their rice portion is at its minimum but it's good because you can eat a lot more. There is a time limit for the AYCE 60 minutes for lunch and 90 minutes for dinner.  My boyfriend and I ordered a lot from the nigiri items than the rolls and everything we ordered there were great.   There was only on server, which was hard to order  faster than usual but she was nice.

6SXPP-mInMPD46YESbkrhg.text: This place. There's not much that I can say about Sushi Way other than STELLAR! The staff is attentive, the chefs personable, the environment soothing...don't get me started on the food.  Alright...  I'm a sushi fiend. And Sushi Way does NOT disappoint in the slightest. Their fish is fresh, their rice is the perfect texture. There is a balance between the fish and the rice, unlike many AYCE places that pile on the rice while minimizing cost by skimping on the fish portions.   I'll eat just about anything, so I love to ask the chefs what they like or to surprise me. To not be too terrible long-winded, I'll just say that you better get to this place ASAP!   They're new, so they aren't always packed, but when the word gets out and around...trust me. Sushi Way will be slammed 24/7 (well, when they're open). Love it! Gotta have it! This is the only Way to enjoy your sushi around the Strip and in the Vegas Metro area.

fwv_vUxApAQx4HKLn0a_vg.text: Another fantastic experience at this fine sushi establishment. This time I had more of the nigiri selections and they were fantastic. My favorites were the garlic tuna and seared salmon. Truly melt in your mouth delicious.  Other winners were the kamikaze dynamite, jalapeno poppers, wakame, and poke salad. I could easily eat this every day. Plus, the AYCE lunch is $21.95, a terrific value. Can't wait for my next yummy visit. Until then Sushi Way.

Atmosphere was a tad "off"...at one point Eminems hit "Superman" was on...in a fancy sushi restaurant.   Overall amazing and would recommend it to anyone that loves genuine, fresh sushi!

Ycf9MgeLpxxf16LbbCKE8A.text: Very good sushi place! I recommend getting the all you can eat option. The sashimi and rolls are great and it's open 'till 2am.

edKDi7ZMCOgTzKWHm88hrQ.text: Wow I have to say I am so happy for a friend from Yelp telling me about this place over a year ago and we kept talking about how we needed to go. We finally had a chance to meet and go here for lunch. We love sushi and were not real big on eating just rolls.  This place has a great selection not all just rolls but lots of items to choose from. We tried so many different things. The spicy tuna tare tar was so delicious as well as the salmon one, I was in heaven!! Everything seemed very fresh and all the fish was cut in nice pieces. They did not skimp on the portions of fish.  There were a few specials on the board we ordered to try and I highly recommend the boom boom special. What a taste and flavor. So many different textures , soft to chew but a little crunch to it with a sauce that I fell in love with! It had a light lemon flavor after taste but not over powering. I even tried eel for the first time! It wasn't bad! I really enjoyed everything and we had so much on our table I never got any pictures to share. I will for sure share pictures the next time we go which I hope is very soon again. We are big fans of Yama Sushi but I really think we found a new place we will go to more often.  Ended with some pineapple sorbet.   Over all I highly recommend everyone to try this place. My Yelp Friend was right! So happy he suggested this place!!! Looking forward to the next visit!!

WkawnJNzkcom1iFbqG5Ueg.text: I was impressed with the quality and the cut of the fish.  From a sashimi standpoint a little thin. But I was impressed with the lack of rice in their rolls!!  Most places you run into throw so much rice into their rolls you never get enough fish!   Not the case here!  Flavored were spot on.  My favorite roll of the night was the "I Like My Ass"!!  Yes indeed, soft shell crab that had great flavor a!  One of my tests for a new sushi joint is to see if they have fresh wasabi.  This is key in great sushi joint!  Ever since I was introduced to it by a very close friend and sushi chef it is the tell tale of a place in my book.  The attentiveness of the staff was bar none phenomenal!!    The all you can eat menu isn't limited on what you can get but rather how much you can devour in 60 minutes during lunch or 90 minutes during dinner!!!   Highly recommend you check out this new one!!  I think they will be around for awhile once the word is out!!  Thanks again for a pleasant eating experience on the road!!

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Sashimi with Jalapeño!  It melted in my mouth!!

8ctGe8iRa0A9HVJ9Tq0dGA.text: I love coming to this place, the food is great, a large variety and great lunch specials. Last year when my friend and I came to visit Vegas we were wandering around and stumbled to sushi way and decided to try it. It was so good and the staff is very kind, helpful and courteous when you ask for a recommendation or thoughts on a dish or sushi roll. The lunch special is amazing, wish we had one back home id be there every weekend. The atmosphere is a casual calm ambience that you can eat, share stories with friends. Definitely give this place a try it worth it. As I said before each time we come to Vegas we make a stop for lunch here

h9EF8gXoH9cIU3wDqH1Cww.text: Our waitress was great, fast delivery of food and overall the dishes tastes great. Good selection of nigiri as well with exception uni was unavailable that night but overall I'm satisfied and would surely come back

n_4bDCwEA57gOK9e5sbrAg.text: Great place. Very quick and fresh. I am from Reno and am an AYCE sushi snob, and both price and quality are on par. I am a big fan of nigiri, and theirs is super fresh. No need for heavy sauce, but the rolls are good too. So much better than the trendy little sushi bars on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple and super fresh. Who needs fancy sauces?

nhI4aYtSkPtNB7csP1Y2Rg.text: Prob the best AYCE sushi i had.  Too bad uni was only for dinner time.  Very fresh sushi.

8mkxCkF-f5vMktkhcWQx-Q.text: My experience tonight bothered me enough to write my first Yelp review. I eat here regularly, the food quality is decent and the pricing is  reasonably cheap. The service is always quite mediocre (never rude, just slow and inattentive) but is excused due to value.  Tonight, I placed a phone order for pick up, was told to it would be a 30 minute wait. I informed them I was in a rush and it was apparently noted. I arrived 35 minutes later and they said "no problem" took my money and said the food would be right out. 10 minutes later, the food was nowhere to be seen. I asked again and was told they were just putting the food in a bag. 5 minutes later they informed me they hadn't even made my order. I asked for my money back and left hungry.

Jpl52uPtjBXtMkD7xCF0iA.text: All you can eat sushi... Viva La Vegasssssssss!  I've also tried Sushi Mon as well but this tops everything by far. We arrived and they have a lot to park in and waited about 45 minutes? They also take reservations by the way.  We have a group of 9 and our server Jane was so wonderful and accomating to us even for a big group and an indesivie family... our server was great!   Wr ordered so much food I can hardly remember what I ordered, I remember my favorites that were the sushi nachos, and the seared salmon.  I basically loved everything here including the green tea honey bread!

uKhv90hQazvZgjiaqdnXWg.text: Wow, cooked to order all you can eat sushi!   Amazing quality sushi and taste to go.  We walked a mile from Caesar's palace and it was worth the walk... but we took UBER home.

6eP-4gIsAqWet1fMT3Askw.text: Ya know, hole in the wall sushi places are always awesome!!!  When we walked in and it's all you can eat, red flags went up all over the place.  Thank goodness there are other choices than all you can eat.  One bite of the tempura batter and a huge smile came across all of our faces.  It's rare to find awesome tempura batter that is light, crunchy, flavorful, and simple awesomeness!  Fantastic service, $9.95 lunch bento boxes, excellent food.  No wonder the ratings are so high!  Well done!

70xsMeupAqz_W4NOtsNnNg.text: Awesome food ... all you can eat with a great variety choices.   Definitely a go to spot when in Las Vegas. Great family environment and experience. Service was great and quick ...

oveYbJYFnWPGaj8Dsl3R_Q.text: This is the BEST sushi I have ever eaten!  The spider roll is amazing, the salmon killer, the James Bond, the crispy rice with tuna.....all legit and amazing!  And for lunch, it's all you can eat for $21.95.  You can't beat this place!!!!  I'll be back next time I'm in Las Vegas!!!!

vJDlvu_clyZXbaJjx0gPYg.text: Everything was amazing here from the sushi to the wine! Great fish quality and great service!! Richard and Jane were great servers and very attentive! Thank you very much

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place!!

iV2nGIfAdMLDMSuTZpKjeA.text: Very good customer service!! Fast service and friendly staff. Also, a big selling point for me was the oysters! It is rare that a sushi place has a variety and Sushi Way had a very wide variety of everything. Definitely recommend

k5_juwsqpNGCzNN0C0HQuA.text: I was utterly disappointed with this place.  This is my second time at this place and it was a much different experience the first time.  I would have given it 4-5 stars the first visit but this second time was a very different experience.  We arrived for a 7:30pm reservation and got seated right away since it wasn't that crowded at all.  The place isn't that big of a place and only 4 tables were full when we got there so there was lots of empty tables.    Our waitress took our first round order of white tuna, salmon skin salads, salmon kama, uni and 3 other rolls.  It took a very long time for the first dishes to come out even though the place wasn't packed...then another person comes and says that he will be our waiter and that our orders will be out soon.  Then he comes back and says that they ran our of uni cause another party ordered all the rest of the uni.  We waited for over 15 mins from placing our order and then they tell us that there is no uni!...Hmmm.  The main reason I came was to experience the uni as I did the first time.    So we start to get our plates and they must have changed the Salmon skin salad cause it was not the same as before.  It was more like a wet salmon skin mix something...not too sure what it was.  It wasn't very tasty or appealing.  Most of the sushi rolls were decent to good and the salmon kama was actually really good.  So then we order another round of plates and they tell us they ran out of Kal bi or galbi as they call it on the menu.  So now the two most expensive things on the menu are out...okay.  The messed up part is that our waiter tells us that he's sorry but they ran out of Kalbi cause they got slammed with orders.  I looked at him and looked around at the half empty place and wondered how they got slammed with orders to run out when the place isn't even near full.  I thought he was actually joking at first but he was serious.  Keep in mind that this place is open till 2am and it was only 8:30pm.    We continue with a few more orders and then decide to get dessert and call it a night.  So we order the Fried Ice Cream, Green tea ice cream, and Yuzu.  The waiter comes back and says that they are our of Green Tea Ice cream and also can't make the Fried ice cream cause they don't have the Green Tea ice cream for it.  At this point I just had to laugh cause they ran out of each of the most expensive items on the menu.   So the lesson here is to make sure if you decide to go here, that they have the items you are most interested in and that AYCE only means it's AYCE of what they may have left.

dx5SkzUX1AFRB1apw3Zmjg.text: Love this place and always a must visit when I'm in Vegas. Sushi is always delicious, people are always friendly, and service is always excellent. The AYCE sushi is the way to go. Lots of menu options to choose from. 21.95 till 3pm. 26.95 after. Either way, still worth it. Stop by if you're in town. Location is great too.

j-AmokWeYhNOjqIOv4_J_Q.text: I went here with my boyfriend also guided by the good reviews .  I don't know how it works in USA But i think that possible ingredients causing allergy should be written on the menu.  I read on menu salmon tartare, that it should be simple salmon cut in small pieces. Instead, I received salmon on avocado and Cramp.  As I realized there was cramp, I had already eaten a bit because it resembled rice . So I had to immediately take a pill of my medicine to prevent an allergic attack . If you really want to have lunch in this restaurant, be prepared to unpredictable surprise .

4QlEP0v-aCXYHt9FEY26dQ.text: The service here was wonderful. Very good food especially the side dishes. You have to try the bacon wrapped scallops! Definitely would come back here.

F4bB9pEIAf5aF8EVSQBVdg.text: Had an excellent 5 star experience this weekend at Sushi Way!  They're a little behind the strip and definitely worth the commute to this hidden gem.  Don't be scared when you hear this is All You Can Eat Sushi.  It's actually all made to order personally by the head sushi chef/owner.  There are many great items to try all for $26.95 for dinner.    You have 90 minutes and you can pick whatever you want from the menu.  Hot or Cold items, also anything on the daily special board which was amazing. I enjoyed the Salmon Belly Sushi, the White Tuna and Yellowtail Sashimi.  From the main menu they have some fun rolls to try with their unique sauces like the I Love My Ass.  Service was top notch.  We were well taken care of, provided recommendations, and you will get very personalized service here.  Really friendly and the environment, food, drinks were all great.    They stay open until 1am on Sunday and 2am on other days.  I can't wait to come back and wish they were down here in the OC.  This is a great price for what you're going to get and the food is really good too.  I'm sure this place will be getting popular as you can already see all the rave reviews on Yelp.

zLCkDThTkgrTeER6lBAN1A.text: Go out of your way, to give Sushi Way a shot. This centrally located sushi spot is housed in the same shopping center that Firefly used to be in.   I came for the AYCE lunch special, which is $21.95, includes all rolls/sides; excludes sashimi. They have a decent little menu, and many options to choose from. There are a lot of baked and fried rolls here as well. Now, typically I wouldn't go for these types of rolls, but right now I have a strict "no raw" fish rule in place because of health reasons. So, I was really craving sushi, and noticed Sushi Way had numerous options that would fit my needs.  The sushi chefs are very nice, as are the servers. Most of my sushi and sides arrived quickly, and I was asked if I wanted more sushi when I was almost complete with each of the rolls I had in front of me.   I won't list off all the rolls I ate here, but I had 4, as well as two different sides. I was very pleased with the meal, and I would certainly return for another visit.

uo8ebl9omBfUL3rtzUkSGQ.text: Was  looking for something different and found it!    Very friendly and the food is great.  Had spider roll, OMG, baked green mussels, and garlic yellow tail Niguri.   I have eaten lots of sushi and this is some of the best, from classic to edgy.   Plan to come back before leaving LV.

Lc-od9QOuFOqbx2Jbca8dw.text: I have come here twice in the last two weeks while in the area, because I needed a place to work on my laptop. I didn't realize I would end up loving this place, food and service. The staff is so friendly and attentive and makes great recommendations. The lunch server not only remembered me when I walked in the door, but he also remembered what I ordered and gave me the space I needed when I received an important call. I appreciate attentive staff as well as staff that can sense a guests needs (as mine can be tricky when I have a call). At any rate, the food is always fresh and fast. I have several favorites and I love the AYCE here, more than any other place. I will continue to make this a regular lunch spot!

XvdC4KHpPdyg_YWbylLfWg.text: I was anxious to try this place after reading the reviews. I was not disappointed!  It's nice to have a good AYCE joint in the area.  I came late at night. The service was stellar and the food was very good. The chef was eager to please when I told him that it was my first time and that I would try anything he recommended. Hopefully this place is here for a long time!

IyJ3lGfW47Id9w3Vv2kDqg.text: Great AYCE sushi place. Recommend dishes screaming organism,  salmon tarta, poki tuna salad and salmon belly

aBByQZBJlDwYmtS6IRyV5w.text: Very disappointing.  Sushi rice fell apart on the nigiri.  Nigiri fish was small and low quality.  Every roll we picked had a sauce and none of them were good.

ZOUzaRwv09r-VSLz7ct72A.text: The best sushi I've ever had!!! Get the super white tuna nigiri. We just got all you can eat and I'm pretty sure we are making a dent in the worlds white tuna population .

8wozyQI4vT7ovGsPN9Fbhw.text: Amazing sushi, great service by both of our servers Ploy and Lucy and all you can eat deal for 26$. Highly recommended, we will be back definitely!

6ye2DH0_JVk9finiOtOe1Q.text: This is my third time back.  Food is great.  Service is great. It will not be my last.  Sit at the sushi bar~~I will come back..

eWpMn2ZXTTFS2D59itpGeA.text: I come here all the time as a budgeted college student their prices are very reasonable! I definitely recommend to anyone looking for great sushi and good customer service!

WO9nC4T84fGbIXWBkTst9A.text: My pregnant wife was craving sushi, we came here and Jane gave us a few roll options that were safe for my wife to eat. We got the big easy special, the baked salmon (Jane requested they bake it longer), and a California roll. Everything tasted amazing and my wife was doing her happy dance. Will definitely come here again. Great food and great service! I recommend this place to any sushi lover.

QjeS2lD3WRCGhtNrQp1gyw.text: Great place for all you can eat sushi. A large selection of delicious sushi plus extras such as sake and dessert. The staff is super attentive and friendly. The rolls are done to perfection without too much rice. Highly recommend.

DSc1hwSBosFmAQZzIDVq5Q.text: Found my new lunch spot!   Tuesday's special is 50% off beer and sake. The AYCE pricing is standard- $21ish for lunch and $27ish for dinner. It's right next to the old Firefly.  Our waitress was the best! Didn't catch her name, but she was super on top of things- refills, taking away plates, etc. She was awesome (and Korean, like us :] ). The sushi chefs were extremely attentive and made great sushi. The fish was fresh and plentiful. They didn't skimp at all on the fish to rice ratio. Not everyone enjoys this, but the sesame seeds were a different thing from my usual and I liked it.  Warning; the tartare has a bed of artificial crab meat in the bottom.  Salmon skin hand roll is a must try!

pg6nrRdqnoxfJQECnWT9Sg.text: The best ayce sushi I ever had in Las Vegas, good sushi, good service and very good environment! For $26 per person, I think it worth every penny! Surly I will be back! Thank you very much!

G_ODawBXsEYXQIO3FZJ3ag.text: Great hours, great service, great sushi!! My boyfriend drove me down here from SLC area for my birthday dinner. Love this place

Y9VqwYoM_15JT3FOIlrt3A.text: Fun experience, but as a native Japanese, their sushi was just OK. Some items took forever to arrive and a few items that we ordered didn't even come.   We ordered raw oysters and soon as we ate them, we knew they were not fresh.  We got food poisoned. If you are looking for sushi, you can find better place in Vegas.

_9TfTO5NNr83FgfCeMs-kQ.text: Service is decent. Rolls come out fairly quickly as do appetizers. We've been here twice now. Wish desert was unlimited.

6gWj4TFFF7FZr-qpapr4zw.text: Sushi Way best sushi spot in Las Vegas! They were very accommodating so that we didn't fill up too fast. This allowed the three of us to try most of the menu!! Everything was delicious! The server was very friendly and offered suggestions about what we might want to try. Insider tip: Try the yuzu sauce!! If I could give this spot more than five stars; I would!! Best time to go is 3 pm on a weekend.

Y7BgS94wLhVxqEDBoynhNg.text: Food was okay, but the service was TERRIBLY SLOW..... They missed our orders exactly FOUR TIMES.. (several dishes..) and it took FOREVER to get all the food served.. I also had to keep raising my hand to get served, but no one bothered to care.. Had to scream later to grab their attention, but a staff came a moment later without saying sorry - maybe they didnt even realize i was raising my hand for 5 mins + we've been waiting the whole time while dining there (The restaurant was half empty at this time also...) I could have given 4 stars if the service wasnt this terrible. Want to give NO star with this level of service, but too bad i have to give at least one. Not going back.

f-hF9e9-IA1RHuM9Y4HeZA.text: Try it! All you can Eat Sushi for $28 but not a buffet style. You order and it's made and brought to your table. Unlimited Hand Rolls!  We hit this place everytime we are in Vegas.  Pleasant staff. Off the strip and not overly crowded.  Open until 2am!

i6RIr92hbsO5--HRot-i6g.text: This place is hooked up. The menu is full of awesome combos and great selection of different fish. All of the rolls and nigiri were super fresh and tasty. Add to that that it is AYCE!! A must visit place when you're in the mood for sushi.

nsjm8QyeE2XQ0ksoj1JJfA.text: Was my first time here went in for dinner first glance at the menu little overwhelming lots to choose from my waitress was very nice and recommended some items they do offer all you can eat for $26 a person with the exception of kids age 3 and under are aloud to share with you they do have rules to all you can eat don't like food go to waste so prefer for you to Order as you go went ahead did all you can eat ended up trying the California roll, crunch, spicy tuna, Cali dream, jack rabbit, big eazy, sexy bomb oh my goodness all very delicious there teriyaki chicken was pretty good cute little spot have bar seating table and booths will definitely return

Their orgasm appetizer doesn't even tickle me.  The best dish there is the coconut shrimp tempura which comes from a box either way.  How are they 4.5 stars you ask?  People want a free soda so they give them 5 stars.  Really people?  Your integrity for $2.50 worth of coke?  Highly disappointed. CfEysyKXLUmxPYLT5-j7dQ.text: For a spot that a group of seven friends and I chose on a whim, I am quite satisfied with Sushi Way although there's definitely some items that you should not order. The service was great, and the quality of the nigiri was great! Except the uni and oysters. I would NOT recommend those.   We all did the AYCE dinner for $26.95. The atmosphere is a bit dim lit. And just a heads up, they include an 18% gratuity charge for groups larger than six. We also called ahead to check on the wait time, and there wasn't a wait on a Saturday night so our hangry butts immediately headed over.   As soon as we got there, we placed orders for salmon nigiri, fresh water eel nigiri, fresh oysters (DON'T GET THESE), baked mussels (don't recommend these either), udon (this was good!), miso soup, garlic edamame (DANK!!), mackerel, uni (it was an oddly creamy texture), halibut nigiri, yellow nigiri, and some rolls.  Overall, it's an average AYCE sushi spot. It's most definitely not the best I've ever had but also not the worst. Great service though!

Vl632WP0NA3XzblDy1PV5g.text: Would not order from this place again, I ordered 3 different rolls for a to-go order and then it all came back completely wrong, called to see if they could correct the issue but nobody took accountability down to the owner who said that everything on their end was done correctly. I give the young lady on the phone a lot of credit for putting up with the bull**** because she didn't have to endure that flake from me.   Given that my order was wrong I couldn't tell you what exactly I got, but the rolls we not as advertised and they only gave me 6 pieces for each roll, but I guess I can attrition that to it being a wrong order though.   From the looks of it the portions are small and nobody has any regard to taking accountability if a phone order was done correctly. But the reviews stay high so I suppose the restaurant dinning experience might be better? Either way I wouldn't coming or ordering from this establishment ever again!

oDu6IrHmILT4lFmvRlhU3g.text: Had the all you can eat sushi lunch at Sushi Way a few weeks ago and was very happy with my experience. Unlike a typical buffet, you're seated at a table and order from the many. Rolls are prepared quickly, so pace yourself and order two or three dishes at a time. A great deal at $22 for lunch - you can order from both sides of the menu which includes standard rolls, specialty rolls, fried rolls, and your staple menu items such as edamame, miso soup, etc.   There is a catch, though! It's all you can eat for an HOUR and you must finish everything you order or they will charge you for waste. Come hungry, pace yourself, and enjoy!

mxznKJZIK__61DGw_Emupw.text: One of the best in town we've found! Really good quality, location, and they have some specials that will have you coming back for more!

9iEsLTa-YH_MxXIxUbGaTw.text: All-You-Can-Eat Sushi $21.95 for Lunch and $26.95 for Dinner!  Great selection of fresh fish from Salmon, Tuna and Yellowtail in Nigiri and Special House Rolls! And some of the best Blue Fin Tuna that I've ever had!  There's a 90-min time limit but trust me, you should be well and full before that even becomes an issue.  If you're looking for a great place to hang out for the night, drink and feast on amazing sushi only a block off of the Las Vegas Strip, this is your spot!  Make sure that you're hungry because you'll definitely get your money worth out of this hidden gem!

dhzWvB76xulyFHqw5Wv4uQ.text: By far (with no exaggeration) this is THE.WORST sushi I've ever had. If you respect Sushi and have any appreciation for it please don't come here. You might as well eat the doormat in front instead of coming in and eating this "fish."

GiXstogJbsm8sBbmlsFP0g.text: Service was great and AYCE dinner was worth it. We enjoyed the Big Easy Special the most. The whole menu is available with the AYCE. We also enjoyed oysters and the mochi for dessert.  Thank you Sushi Way for your excellent service!

O8BFXcI5Tg3oW19VWVF7xQ.text: Sushi Way is my go-to neighborhood AYCE sushi bar. It may not have the best sushi all the time, but it satisfies my cravings and I'm always able to get in without having to wait 1-2 hours unlike Goyemon or Kaya. I believe lunch is $22 and dinner is $27. Like most AYCE sushi restaurants in Vegas, you get a few extra premium items with the dinner price such as the uni, oysters, sweet shrimp, as well as galbi and the screaming orgasm. They always have daily specials, which has always included a type of sashimi with jalapenos. In the past, this has included the super white tuna and yellowtail.   The best things to order at Sushi Way include the nigiri and a few of the side dishes. I've never had a bad experience with any of the fish. I tend to stay away from the regular or specialty rolls as they usually have a ton of rice and cream cheese. However, if you are tempted to try one, they do offer half rolls. Some of my favorite side dishes include the coconut shrimp tempura (must order every visit), baked green mussels, bacon scallop skewer, and seaweed salad. Of the specialty rolls, I've only tried a few variations of the soft shell crab for fun.   Their dessert menu includes green tea ice cream, yuzu sorbet, mochi, tempura ice cream, and honey bread. I usually stick to the green tea ice cream or strawberry mochi. The tempura becomes complete mush and the yuzu sorbet is too icey. Don't forget to check-in on the Yelp app for a free soda. They do have time limits for meals, but I've never experienced them enforcing the rules.

gX4uL7yI-w5zu6Hj27Ghsw.text: I am by no means a sushi aficionado, but everything I ordered was delicious! Great service and an extensive menu.

ZWIdNFoDy__3pV6TkaXUyw.text: Not sure where to go with this since the pics of my food look dope and the service was spot on...  but...  ...something seemed up with the wateriness of some of the sushi, almost like there was a condensation problem going on in the fridge and some water collected in the tray. A lot of the pieces seemed just wet, even my girlfriend noticed and mentioned so it wasn't just in my head or something. The salmon wasn't totally fresh and neither was the red snapper...and they were out of halibut...bummer. Also, they seared a lot of the pieces even though I'm not into searing it (hence why people go for sushi...uncooked fish, right!?)...maybe they were trying to cover up something.  Anyway with all that above, why 4 stars instead of 3 (or less). The service was great, it wasn't busy and we had a ton of "no rice" arrangements thrown at us left and right made up on the spot that seemed limitless (see pics)...and oh yeah...Tempura. Coconut. Shrimp.  This place came recommended from a couple AYCE sushi fans and I can see it has potential.   Perhaps I'll give them another shot to earn that 5...(if Sakana has an hour wait).

uZjgSkPcpleDX_oAbcgI7A.text: It's rare for me to find a sushi restaurant that I absolutely love, needless to say a sushi restaurant that has an AYCE option.  Sushi Way servers are extremely friendly and attentive. The AYCE is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. We came for dinner at 6:00 PM on a Friday evening. The restaurant wasn't busy but there were enough customers to know it wasn't a terrible place. You can order any of their menu items for the AYCE and the best part is that you can order half rolls! I would recommend the raw oysters, baked green mussels, and galbi. Of course, complete your dinner with one of their dessert items (included in the AYCE)!

h3oul9YUo0S1yMe5_PN6tQ.text: I was looking for a great place to eat all u can eat sushi my friend recommended this place so I said let's give it a shot .....Not a chance I started with a ice cold Azahi that arrived fast  then I proceeded to order sides poke salad, tempura calamari, and a crispy tuna rice, it took 35 minutes before I got all 3 sides then the sushi chef asked if he could start a roll which was nice but 40 minutes before u start a roll when u only get 90 minutes all u can eat then I ordered a nigiri Salmon , yellow tail, and tuna, and a caterpillar roll that never made it Then I was being rushed by the server that had a bad attitude she insisted 2 times if I was ready so After the second time I ordered a mango mochi  Ice cream , the bill came before I got my dessert so I paid this is how bad this place is the sushi chef didn't notice I had paid my bill after 30 minutes I was waiting on my caterpillar roll he calls me sir your roll is ready I smiled and said I'm finished I paid my bill....This place sucks is a totally don't come here and waste your money on bad service and flavorless food and the sushi chef was not even wearing gloves totally a health violation....on ready to eat foods.... don't come here and risk getting sick because they don't follow health code regulations...Thank you I will never return.....and a piece of advice to the owners you need to seriously train your staff because these  employees you have are going to make you go out of business and shut your doors real soon!!!

LeYsAk0hwcR0Tr8kNexooQ.text: A group of 6 of us went here for lunch on Saturday. We arrived right at opening time, and wanted to sit at the bar, but were immediately ushered to a table. I always prefer to sit at the bar, and since the place was empty, i was surprised that we were basically forced to a table.   We all ordered the all you can eat lunch, which at 21.95 is worth it, since that is the cost of about 2 rolls. I love nigiri as well, so the value was definitely there.  All the food was decent and came out very quickly (since we were the only ones there).  When the nigiri came out, if multiple people ordered the same, it all came out on the same plate.   The food tasted fresh, and looked appetizing when it came out. This place would have gotten five stars except that we were forced to sit at tables instead of the bar.

XXBMQBwQXrunB9aWLUhPqA.text: Really great and fast service! The food was good and the menu was extensive. Monica was so helpful in explaining the menu items and providing recommendations. Thank you for the meal Sushi Way!

gC3WfhefTQ7GMAzns-Iq-g.text: Five stars and it deserves it. I thought LA was the only place where a great AYCE sushi restaurant was until I found Sushi Way. Huge selection of real sushi, even the hard to find stuff like uni, ikura, amaebi, fresh oyster sushi (Amazing!), and the more common sushi like hamachi, tuna, salmon and so on. If only I could have tried every roll on the menu? So good and my highest recommendation. Our waitress Jessica was great. Thanks Jessica.

cM-XCjdPj1TpdSzAQ2XVOQ.text: Great sushi for a great price. They've got a huge variety of styles and flavors that kept me asking for more. The nigiri was fresh and didn't need to hide behind anything. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!

Their all you can eat menu is huge and they have a reduced price for children! He is 7 and it was $14.95 for dinner. He ate at least $25 worth of sushi!

elMcoC8StIPKiu5n0RJ5Sw.text: We were in Vegas for several days and wanted to try a local place so we turned to yelp and the reviewers did not disappoint. This is an all you can eat place. The waiter was attentive and the food was good. We loved the names of some of the rolls. Small place in a strip mall that seemed to have a few popular places.

W_q1e0vXxhLKocd88Djayg.text: For AYCE type restaurant, this is such a good one with suitable price. Raw food is quite fresh and delicious. Do not forget to order just half portion per roll menu (4 pieces) since there are 8 pieces per portion. Dessert is also nice as well especially fried banana with vanilla icecream. Good service. Recommended !

l8pp7kYN5nFpjFlCrgY85g.text: This is the second time i've been here, I LOVE this place.. Everything is soo delicious, and so worth it!! In the land of buffets, only the specialized that know what they're doing reigns supreme. For lunch , it was $22 and omg we kept ordering and ordering roll after roll after nigiri, its so cool to try everything if you wish; be forewarned ! DO NOT OVER ORDER, they CLEARLY STATE:  YOU WILL BE CHARGED FOR WASTING FOOD, and leftovers, EVEN RICE! Luckily, we didn't go nuts and we had the opportunity to try a lot of the rolls and nigiris.  They also serve izakaya food with a variety of beers, sakes. I CANNOT EMPHASIZE how amazing this place is.. I've been to many a few sushi buffets around vegas, and regular sushi restaurants; when it comes to price and freshness and exclusivity of certain curated rolls, this places is hands down one of the best. We literally broke even for lunch after the 3rd roll . The rolls they made do not seem like your normal tossed together cheaply made rolls. They're creative, like the sunrise roll, with sliced citrus over salmon.  The regular spider roll. just to name a few.  The seared tuna, the garlic tuna was very well paired, not too salty and flavorful. The bottom line is the fish is fresh, the staff are really nice and friendly, they are attentive to you needing more sushi. My second time was to make sure i REALLY love this place, and sure enough, i still do. They also do a frequent visitor stamp card! so umm heck yeah!.. Go and try it for yourself!

_vl1dwzqIJauf1rSYLj65w.text: To begin with this place was not that good at all. I was born and raised in Las Vegas and have tried so many other sushi places around town that this one does not even compare. I will never come back. Everything was half assed. They didn't take the time to truly make their sushi great. If you have a basic craving for sushi, this is your place. But for the price, you can higher quality sushi. Please go else where

s8070V3qjmgaVCcerageEQ.text: Definitely I reccomend this restaurant the food was delicious and If you don't know eat with chopsticks they can teach you.

FUe6wmH38fkvfaLR_LjyJw.text: Should've done the AYCE! Would've been worth it but it was late and I wasn't tryna put myself in a food coma..  Ended up sharing a baked salmon roll and Snow White roll.. so good. I could've ate like.. 4 more tbh.  Wasn't too busy but that was probably because it was a Sunday at 10pm lol. Found them on Yelp! One of the few sushi spots with a ton of reviews.  Didn't expect much for sushi in Vegas so the food definitely surprised me. Check in and get a free soda btw!

cR48o1HN3XjMkDOdbO9rag.text: The best sushi spot in Vegas! Sushi lovers and mermaids should definitely give this place a chance. It's near UNLV and central to most things in the Valley. AYCE is worth it and portions of fish are generous! Service is great and you can go wrong with anything on the menu. There are even options for non-sushi lovers who might be in your group. Also, don't forget to try their honey bun for desert!

i5DIPUekoH276fJEvj3ouQ.text: My friend recommended this AYCE sushi spot to me and I would have to say this will be included in my top 5 go to's.   Walking in, this definitely has that typical sushi restaurant feel with a bar. The waitress immediately sat us down and provided menus to my buddy and I. We didn't even have to wait long to get her to take our orders either. It's like she had Psychic powers because she was always on top of her game serving us when checking if we need anything.  Sorry Richard, we got ourselves a waitress who knows how to keep her customers happy lol. She strikes up a conversation on her free time to make our experience a lot better for not only the food, but the welcoming personality. A+ for her service!!   My friend definitely showed me great expectations for their Sushi and fusion specialties. We did AYCE for $26 and got free drinks for writing a review/rating them on yelp. Ask about their stamp cards. When you get 10, next visit is free.  Don't forget to try their tempura ice cream and there's no limit to trying each of their desserts. Usually most Sushi restaurants only limit you to one dessert per customer...   Take a look at my photos to see all the delicious food I had.

RsxmnL05b1UE4BE4db7B_g.text: Went back twice in a week for AYCE...coming from chicago, we were skeptical about the ayce at first, but it was definitely a good value! The salmon (and if they have salmon belly on special, go all out!!), fresh oysters and uni were to die for...i am not a fan of rolls, but the Big Easy is a must! you can even do half rolls for varieties.   3 stars is because we realized the consistency varies among the chefs...our favorite chef shift ended half way during our first dine-in, and the experience wasn't the same since then..

g_guD_BVXmNPo5n2BCiqmA.text: AYCE is really good. The Volcano pieces were huge. Nigiri salmon, tuna and shrimp were excellent. The rolls had more sushi. Perfect combination fish/rice. You can also order half roll what is perfect when you want to try different things. The price is reasonable compared to what you can find in Las Vegas.  Other suggestions: Dragon roll, shrimp lover.

Bl4v32yUXtrcvagjAJVbBA.text: This is my favorite sushi place in town , great service , food is amazing, friendly staff, and very clean.

wDOHhixMdRhNAiyU8QXV-Q.text: So my friends and I decided to try this place on a whim and we were not disappointed. When we got there there was no hostess to seat us so I was a little confused. One of the sushi chefs waved us in and a waitress asked if we wanted a booth or to sit at the bar. Since there were four of us we asked for a booth. The waitress told us to take the one in the corner, instead of leading us to the booth...a little weird, but she wasn't unfriendly so I didn't mind.  They brought us all water, but I don't remember whether or not they asked if we wanted something else to drink...again not a problem because I only drink water (in their defense they may have asked but I wasn't paying attention as I already had my nose to the menu trying to pick out what to try first).  The waitress was super patient with us as none of us had ever been there before and we all said we needed a couple minutes to pick out our rolls. Of course we were all doing the AYCE because the dinner was only $26.95 which is pretty good for a dinner price. Once we got our first round in the food came out really fast which was also shocking because I ordered baked mussels and a fried roll. I also ordered the salmon killer roll which was just a bunch of salmon. Somewhere along the way, one of the sushi chefs misheard an order and made an extra roll and the waitress gave it to us because she said if we didn't want it then it was just going to go in the trash and I don't like to waste food so that was awesome that we got that extra roll! (I mean I know it's AYCE, but still...it's something we probably wouldn't have picked it for ourselves). For the second round I was already getting kind of full so I ordered some uni nigiri (which was some of the freshest uni I have ever had), and the sushi solution roll (also insanely delicious). For dessert we all had fried bananas with vanilla ice cream. Everything we had was just so good that now we've decided to make this our new sushi spot to eat even though three of us live in Henderson!!!  It did shock us all that it really wasn't busy when we got there. We knew that this restaurant had a 4.5 star review on here. It turns out that this place's happy hour starts at 9pm so the place got pretty crowded right before 9. This restaurant also has a stamp card where when you buy 10 AYCE meals, you get the next one free which is just awesome for a sushi lover like me!

fgVnyptvw0vZYJblrSIIFw.text: SUSHI WAY!!!! Seems like every time I make it back into Vegas I stop by Sushi Way. I am solely basing this review off of this all you can eat sushi spot only. This is the first and only all you can eat spot I have tried in Vegas and I fell in love instantly! With that being said, the interior of the restaurant is a average size spot. They have an L shaped sushi bar which holds maybe 15 people or so. They also have a decent amount of seating throughout the establishment as well. Every time I've eaten here everything seems as fresh as it can be from a all you can eat spot. I have never gotten sick eating here. The sushi chefs also will surprise you with items off menu if you strike up some conversation with them. After all they are humans too and want some social interaction at work! haha I have tried soooo many sushi and rolls from here that I can't describe everything I have ever ordered. All I can say is that if you're in Las Vegas and feeling super hungry and want sushi, I would give Sushi Way a try! I was never disappointed!

The food was good but it felt like a hostage situation waiting to get all of our dinner for over 2 hours. Two parties left their tables out of frustration.  I am a pretty patient person but I started getting uncomfortable and embarrassed just only having drinks and nothing to eat in front of me for so long.  Even with nothing on our table the staff didn't bother checking in with us to see if we got our orders or wanted anything. To make matters worse it was a birthday dinner for my partner and I felt awful.   I won't go back to this place.  I don't normally review places but the service here was just so bad and a waste of time.  If you do go here you'll probably enjoy the food but just make sure they don't forget about you.

FKps3gy9av4I53wfHVASFQ.text: Very disappointed. Craving for sushi and went here due to its high ratings. We sat down at the sushi bar and I ordered all- you-can-eat. My girlfriend does not eat raw seafood so we ordered bento dinner for her. We waited at least an hour for her bento box. If I had not flagged the server to ask for it, it probably would not have arrived. I was already halfway through my course when her dinner was placed in front of her. Gladly, she enjoyed the food aside from the shitty service. Unfortunately, my all you can eat dinner was an unpleasant event. The amateur chef loaded my nigiri with fat portion of rice. The ratio was about 3 to 1.  Fish was cut so thin it looked like paper. I felt that he was trying to get me full fast so we can get the hell outta there. My kitchen order came quicker than the sushi that I ordered first. This tells ya how slow this so called chef was. By the time I asked for the check the chef had a disgusting smirk on his face. I'd probably give them a bit of slack if it was super busy but it was a slow steady night during our visit. Save your money and go somewhere else. I will never come to this place.

fMNuMKjaB4177-sQWEOS3Q.text: Coming from out of town we wanted to try a place off the strip with a hometown vibe.  After coming to Sushi Way I can say you need to come here now.  The all you can eat is a great value and the sushi is original and fresh.  If you come please asked to get served by Andy.  He's the greatest waiter we've had so far on our trip.  He's attentive and always willing to get you anything you need.  We will be back for sure!!!!!!!!!

Oe6um2tUOJFv2idtibsvaQ.text: This was the most amazing all you can eat sushi place you can eat at for the price. The sushi was freshly made to order.

kCMoDYVOqKQFpCE-sh0jIg.text: A fun and interesting all you can eat experience.  Lots of menu items I'd never seen on a Japanese menu including Japanese lasagna (good!), Cajun albacore (the special, but included in the all you can eat menu) and coconut shrimp tempura.  De

5NCnlfqd9NzeBye7-tIoIA.text: This place was amazing! I wish we had it back where I live! The all you can eat was a great price (like $26 something I think per person for dinner), and it includes everything (except drinks), not just sushi! We also got miso soup and ice cream. The green tea ice cream, sorbet, and mango Mochi were all delicious! As well as all the sushi we got. The miso soup was great - not too salty, but definitely not bland.  What really put this place over the top though was the service. Everyone was so nice there! Like they're usually nice at most restaurants, but at this place they seemed genuinely friendly and happy that we were there. And they were right on top of everything. I've had all you can eat where the sushi took forever to come out. Not this place. Probably because they bring the sushi out as it's made, not necessarily all together. Some might not like that, but I really did. I'm really glad we chose this place over the other sushi places in the area!

wqqj4P5F131BJaTOF7V7KQ.text: Wow! Where do I even begin! Let's start out with the atmosphere. It's fantastic, cozy, yet modern and staff is among the friendliest. Let's not forget to mention the Spotify playlist that just hits the SPOT. Now getting into the sushi well let's just say you're going to pay half of what the strip charges you and get 3x the quality and uniqueness. While all of the sushi chefs are fantastic I must brag about Ivan. He's a one of a kind sushi chef who will not hesitate to make you some of his custom rolls. In the end Sushi way has friendly service, great food, and at a great price.. What's not to love?

_BztlMcI0h8BIitL26v20A.text: You want a new sushi spot (opened for about only a month now) that serves great quality sushi in an all-you-can-eat format?  Go this 'way' ... the Sushi Way!   Let's preface by saying that my all-time favorite ayce sushi spot currently is Sakana but Sushi Way may take the top spot in the future.  If you were a big fan of Sakana then when I say this rivals them, you ought to hurry before this place gets too popular.  It was that good my first time here and I can only hope it'll stay this way when I return again soon.  The location takes over where once Dragonfly/Firefly used to be way back then.  So many good memories made here and I'm glad a new sushi joint has taken its place.  My group walked in around 6pm on a Monday and we were the only customers there.  Sweet.  More attention for us.  Free drink with Yelp or Facebook check-in. Nice!  Thirsts quenched.    Onto the food:    Appetizers- Gyoza, Fried Rice (w/ chicken), Tempura Shrimp and Tempura Coconut Shrimp, Seaweed Salad, Poke Tuna, Baked Mussels, Miso Soup, and Sweet and Spicy Dumpling.  Everything was great but the Poke and the Baked Mussels were REAAALLLY Good.     Check out my beautiful pictures..  so fresh, nice color, tasted marvelously.  My daughter and I enjoyed the seaweed salad and the tempura shrimp in unlimited quantities is reason enough to be eating here.   There were multiple other choices on the menu that we didn't get to try simply because it was just the three of us eating.  (oysters, yakitori skewers, etc.)  Sushi- Japanese Lasagna-  California roll with cream cheese baked with yumyum sauce on top.  Assorted regular rolls such as shrimp tempura rolls, rainbow roll, etc.  All rolled well, nothing fell apart and the taste was good.   The screaming orgasm came with nice thick pieces of tuna in that delicious tangy screaming O sauce.  We had assorted nigiri including salmon, yellowtail and garlic tuna.  The fish was fresh and the ratio of fish to rice was excellent.    I did also get one order of uni and it was super fresh!  When the uni is fresh, it's as good as it gets for me.    Also, note on one of my pictures, if there's a roll you're interested in that's not on the menu, there's a "create your own roll" option.  They will try to make it for you.  Thought that was cool.  With regards to the service, the staff was very welcoming and attentive.  Waters were filled within reasonable time and the food came out quickly.  Only time can tell whether this place will be able to handle a packed restaurant once word-of-mouth continues to bring new customers in here.  Until then, stop by ASAP and enjoy some great quality AYCE sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 orders of ayce baked mussels.  Omg so good.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The d.d. Roll.  Spicy salmon on top with crab and shrimp tempura inside. Screaming O sauce all over.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The uni was so fresh today!  Garlic tuna in the back.

1VYbBJ3JgDwLKVK_OaQ8fA.text: Have always been a little sketch about all you can eat anything. Sushi way has broken me in, in a good way. If you're going to get two rolls or a roll and an app, all you can eat value is hands down the way to go. We ate at the sushi bar and the chef "Mike" was the kindest and most helpful sever I have encountered in a long time. He recommended some great dishes staring with apps to rolls and dessert. When you mention that you are getting full he is so accommodating by splitting rolls into smaller plates so you can try a little of everything. Definitely will come back next time I'm in town!

4HECNCz0K24SRbM3_3zcFw.text: When in Vegas, I prefer to eat off-the-strip, as parking is easier, crowds are smaller, and prices are generally lower.  Sushi Way met all these criteria - stopped in for lunch with the family and left completely satisfied.  We ordered a wide variety of sushi and roles, and had no complaints on any of them.  The kids even special ordered their miso soups (one with no seaweed or onions, the other with no tofu) and they even nailed those orders.  Will definitely come back next time I'm in town!

vzsYduJ6WNc6LNiKyfkjDw.text: Tonight I had THE most..."spiritual" experience in a long time. And of all things with food, and my gift of a sushi chef. Meet "Mike", a 67 year old sushi master who grew up as a pineapple farmer in Hawaii.   I could tell you I only ordered one thing off of the menu. That after that, we began talking and he learned I appreciated authentic sushi, with minimal flavoring, much more than the hyper saturated "American sushi". That for the rest of the night not a single thing I ate came off the menu, but was custom made to fit my palette and preferences. But none of that does the night justice.  As soon as we began talking he began imparting wisdom along with every dish he gracefully handed to me. As though to feed my soul along with my stomach. He learned I was a photographer and most everything he said thereafter he tied into photography or what he knew of me. I wish I had recorded everything he said (he reminded me of my grandfather), but I will do my best to paraphrase the many things he shared with me:  "Say...hundred cooks learn to make one dish. But maybe only 20 learn to make it another way. Just like photography. One subject. All photographers take one picture. But you see one thing and you see ten things. Ten angles. You make ten things out of one thing. This is cooking."  "People grow up eating fast. Fast food. We don't think about what we eat we just eat it. We don't think about life we just live it fast. Then we get old. Then we think about what we eat but it is too late. We think about how we live but it is too late. Slow down. Eat slow. Live slow. Appreciate everything slowly. Enjoy."  "Beauty...beauty is an interesting thing. Beauty leads to jealousy. Jealousy leads to anger. Anger leads to hurting people. We must not hurt people. We must see beauty and appreciate."  "Don't do something you don't like. Love what you do. Find what you love and use it to make other people happy."  "You work hard, you come here and I take care of you. You relax. You enjoy. I like to make people smile."  "We can't just hear. We must understand. I say something to you. Tell me what I said. Understand it. If you don't understand it you did not hear it. Don't hear what people say. Hear ideas."   COME HERE!

b-nwryacb1pg-uCk7aiWvg.text: First of all, I'm very excited that the owner is Japanese and that you can order a la carte here. Most sushi bars in Nevada are only all you can eat. Being from Los Angeles I'm not used to that.   The traditional sashimi I was served was very fresh and the sushi delicious. The owners name is Jun and it was great talking to him. Also Ethan and Damian where very capable at preparing any dish. Let's not forget Taka who makes sure all guests at the sushi are happy, have what they need and has a great attitude.   I must give Sushi Way a good rating and hope you enjoy it here.

j1XIKyqkA4lRCcBxAlMlQg.text: This was my first time eating here. I ordered 2 caterpillar rolls from the lunch special menu. The rolls came drenched in eel sauce, so much so that all the rice in the rolls were brown. The first roll was somewhat edible since it was only half drenched so I used napkins to take off the exceeds and just ate it since I hadn't eaten all day and was starving. Even then I couldn't finish the first roll. The second roll was just disgusting. It looked like a dark brown roll with an avocado on top. Sauce was dripping down from it when I picked it up. So I sent it back.  I complained to both the chef and the waiter but they did not do anything and still charged me for both rolls. I understand sometimes the food and the wait staff are not in sync so I usually let it go, but I spoke with both parties with no result. I'm very disappointed with the experience.  TL;DR - ordered caterpillar rolls that took a bath in eel sauce. Complained to chef and server, still got charged for everything.

UntcvNKF3gHXzCVy4zQwWQ.text: At best 2 stars......sushi was ok. Fish wasn't very fresh, orgasm sauce is disgusting, all the "specialty" sushi was blah, they like to use sour and tangy flavors for everything, but the deep fried foods were ok (can't go wrong with IQF if everything else sucks) The saving grace of this place is the service. I give the servers 3 stars cuz they were very attentive and gave good suggestions, although our order taker started to give attitude cuz I ordered 3 times, I mean I paid for a buffet you gotta expect that as a server. Anyways I would not suggest going here, place is kinda beat up, smells dirty, food is blah, service is ok, and I question the freshness of their product. You gotta know "you get what you pay for". In this case that was expensive for a whack sushi buffet.

laeeIO9c4B7Lqw91qxVKsg.text: Surprisingly, really good! Rice to filling/topping ratio is on point! Especially for an AYCE that's decently priced. Sit at the bar and be able to constantly order directly with the sushi chefs. Hand rolls are a definite recommendation over cuts. Be sure to order all the "one-time" items, you're welcome! Oysters are great. Exactly like the shooters but on the half shell. And who wouldn't like to exclaim, "Can I have a screaming orgasm, please?!" Only complaint is that the uni and sweet shrimp didn't taste as fresh. And the spicy garlic edamame wasn't exactly what I was expecting from a Japanese restaurant. But everything else was delicious though!  Friendly staff and quick service. Restrooms are clean. Parking is just enough. Has a TV above the bar to watch whatever sports are going on.

6dsn8tHE-mThZxo37zLkoQ.text: Sushi way is the way to go. Me and my girlfriend had all you can eat sushi. This restaurant is located right on the outside skirts of the strip on paradise road. When we came in its very slow and quiet for a friday. Its your typical ayce sushi menu. I tried their salmon belly nigiri and i was in-love with it. I always order salmon belly or garlic tuna nigiri. The nigiri was well made and tasted very fresh.   The rolls were good but needed some more sauce in it. The service was fast, and friendly. I would say the quality of the fish is good and the service is great. I would come back again to this place to try more of their other dishes.

kFPR4RIJhHTZgftGTwAMzQ.text: Where is the food court tasty and you can eat as much as you want. Prices are not expensive and will be back again

u6ggoFqn6CVaXRs7Zmj6tQ.text: My sisters always come here when we visit Las Vegas.  The sushi is really amazing, nothing like we've tasted before! My favorite from their menu is OMG. It was very delicious :) for desert I go for the fried banana w vanilla ice cream! I'm not a big sushi person but my sisters always love coming to this place and I tag a long and I never leave disappointed!

C1Q1QAlR66ifC71H-_TA_g.text: The outside of the place is right next to a outside bar but the quality of the food is amazing the service is amazing and the servers are great a must visit place while in Vegas

h8VYDpO6y7kdU_hzNJQp8A.text: Dined in last night for my good friends birthday, they were very accommodating in taking our party of 16 and had no problem seating us. The real issue was their two servers had NO IDEA how to take our orders by section. We were split up into three sections (left side, middle, and right side) as the food was coming out, the servers quickly named the food item and didn't take the time to actually see who ordered it but laid it down anywhere on the table. The birthday boy was unfortunately sitting in the middle of the table, which got absolutely NO FOOD for almost an hour. After checking up on the server TWICE, the other sections of our table received their THIRD order of food. Yet, we were still waiting for our FIRST.   Absolutely terrible service, I have never been so frustrated with a sushi place before until now. Their servers need to prioritize which food is going where and not blindly putting it wherever. The worst part is that they still charged us an 18% gratuity that they didn't deserve. I'm also in the food industry and this is not how service should be handled.  Never coming back here again.

qBfBqZJWtm0-W5wpfh0BfQ.text: I finally got a chance to check this place out. I travel quite a bit and I'm always seeking out AYCE sushi spots.  Sushi Way has an extensive menu and their quality of fish and the way the chefs prepare it is as good as it gets. We had the luxury of sitting at the bar with Jose who did an outstanding job and made us some special items which were dynamite. The service was spot on, my cup of water was never empty. I had to work early the next day otherwise I would have been drinking alcohol like a fish but that will happen next time.  To all you "All You Can Eat" eaters, this is a great spot so don't pass it up, Sushi Way is not huge  and I'm assuming there could be a wait at times but it's worth it!

TFiQ3cKF8FTMJR-llIx8dA.text: So... we came back last night and obviously called first to see if Mike is working or not and he did.. so here is the review on that  I really have a mixed feelings about this place!!! One thing I will have to say though if Mike isn't there I wouldn't dare set a foot in this restaurant!! He really do the face of this business!! Idk what you guys would do without him!! He's a gem and give him a raise he really deserve it!!!

oSRRPZToi7jl3YqxQkuA-Q.text: We come here all the time great ayce  sushi staff is great chefs are great atmosphere. Also bacon wrapped scallops and yummy pork belly I never leave hungry lol  Great place to go

YwIiBGiLUg9DLqwmA0B0Tg.text: Came here with a group of friends - a few of us did the AYCE and other got bento box entrees / a la carte. I did the AYCE and it was super fresh and great portions, with great fish to rice ratios which is uncommon for AYCE places. Service was pretty good as well. Overall a really great value!

RPzVscys5GwVGDZVQoMKcw.text: If you're looking for a good sushi restaurant, you can't beat Sushi Way. Just off the strip and plenty of parking. All you can eat is available, but not necessary. The rolls are always good and they have a huge variety on the menu. Lots of tables and never overly crowded. I haven't been to Sushi Way in a while. I thought I'd give it a go. I decided to try different rolls and did the all you can eat. I I like that they offer half rolls. I started out with the spicy edamame and it was really good and hot. Most of the rolls seem to be tempura and are pretty similar. I like the crunch roll #2 with calamari instead of shrimp. My favorite was the kiss a fire roll. It was hot. It had jalapenos and hot sauce. This is still one of my favorite sushi places in Las Vegas.

Es0rvg3oCpWtEVs7xNgJwg.text: Good AYCE sushi spot. They have a good selection of specialty rolls, nigiri, and appetizers. There's a few items that are only available during dinner rather than lunch, such as sweet shrimp, which kind of sucks not to have during lunch but if that's the only difference between lunch and dinner, it's not a big deal. I would have liked to see more options for hand rolls though. Especially with AYCE, I prefer to have smaller portions of an item rather than a big roll so hand rolls are perfect, plus it's less wasteful especially if you feel it's too hard to finish a whole roll (which by the way they charge for leftovers which is typical but also charge for leftover rice). But overall each roll and appetizer I ordered was fresh and tasty. Their dessert options included honey bread which is toast with honey and ice cream..so good! Never seen that on any other AYCE menu so that was a plus.

EVPK4QFO1s6yOTTfaVhiFg.text: This place is all I've been looking for. This may sound a little to basic but I've been searching for a place with a really good California roll and this is it! They paid close attention to the simple rolls which is the reason why I would come back here in a heartbeat. The FBI dessert was so delicious.

FnjKfQ37clXPpRBIQtLJPA.text: Fabulous!  1 mile from Treasure Island and well worth the walk/Uber.  AYCE at $26.95 that includes the entire menu.  Best roll - The Big Easy but all were very good!

coqO3h1WCH3bGUiN3yxm6w.text: DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT FOOD POISONING!!!!! My poor girlfriend got so sick she couldn't walk, she was depleted of all of her nutrients due to the nature of food poisoning I won't go into detail as you likely know the symptoms.   She got so dehydrated from vomiting and diarrhea we decided she needed to go to the hospital. We called the restaurant to advise them and the girl at the front desk had the owner call within minutes.   The owner said "oh no, this has happened before. Take her to the hospital and my insurance will take care of it" we took her to the hospital where she sat for 5-7 hours and received fluids to replenish her nutrients and hydration.   The hospital diagnosed her with food poisoning and the owner apologized over and over saying the insurance will take care of everything. When we finally got with the insurance company the adjuster was a bully, rude and began to retract the owners statement on his behalf.   Long story short they stuck her with a $3,500 hospital bill and didn't take care of anything they promised to handle. The also promised to reimburse the meal and didn't.   Sushi way is filled with food born illness. DO NOT EAT HERE!

_1EGa5JtPPH1VAB-n6ELxA.text: Word experience of sushi ever! We came for lunch one time and it was horrible. Nothing of what we ordered really wowed us. We did Ayce and the person helping us rarely checked in with us when this place only had maybe 3 other tables there, we even had to get the busboy to help us. Getting sushi out for us took 20-30 minutes at a time. The Nigiri fish to rice ratio was a very small portion of fish for lots of rice. Everything about our experience here put us to never want to return.

aVfv9EBtJuOGOnNB1fcMAQ.text: Wow. I love AYCE Sushi and I strive to try them all. This is probably top 3 in Vegas for me.  We went in late and got sat right away. The server was alone and it was actually a little bit busy for late night and for one server on the floor. But she was on point, she was running around taking care of every table and us. So I can't wait to go back at a different time and have an even better service when she's not so busy. She also knew the menu well and was friendly.  We ordered our usuals and they were better than most places which we noticed right away. All the sashimi we had was fresh and flavorful. All the fried appetizers we had were great. Nothing was over sauced or over done. Really; the food was fantastic.

v4VT7sAR68qxLagnHjVBEg.text: This is a great all you can eat sushi place. There's a large variety of rolls that are to order and side dishes on the all you can eat menu. I'm definitely coming back next time I'm in vegas!

f7_23QyAxQMtCSPdnhifww.text: My new favorite AYCE in town! They just opened not long ago. Atmosphere is very open and cool. Come check it out~ they have great food and service! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese lasagna. Mmm~
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best dynamite in town!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YOLO roll~ so yummy!

nffy3nlDgRsh172NPkVYng.text: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident and I'm so glad that I did. Their food quality is amazing. service is great. The atmosphere is casual and welcoming. The fish itself is fresh and on point. I haven't even talked about the most amazing deal that any wallet loving individual has yet to see. The all you can eat sushi menu. There are few places far and wide who are able to offer their costumers an all you can eat menu without limiting the individuals to certain roles and quality. Not this place. you literally have the whole freaking menu at your will to devour without hesitation. COME WITH AN APPETITE. Time is your only enemy as this amazing deal has restrictions of 1 hour for lunch and 90 minutes for dinner. But that is more than enough time to eat 7-8 rolls each.

nXjI7ZyCEqDcHKrn5sPrVw.text: Some of the best sushi I've had - and it's all you can eat - unbelievable!  Highly recommend sitting at the bar where you can keep the orders flowing directly with the sushi chef for the all you can eat ...

ilt-N-0lHfHGe-3pyJk8wg.text: All of the fishes and food were fresh and delish! Wonderful server (super down to earth). Chefs are kind, smiley, and welcoming. When I visit Vegas again, I'll be back :D

yXjkwmcprFQFIemu0xSuxA.text: All you can eat menu is great. Service is also friendly and nice. Highly Recommend! I would suggest go with the dinner menu as that includes unlimited fresh oysters!!

L1McbljpAlA6W5fK0dpyiQ.text: Food was really good. Specially the spicy rice! And the all you can eat dinner buffet was more than worth it. Servers were great and very attentive to ensuring we were taken care of. Two thumbs up!
