JMqW_G_pvMMSl6CItRYcNA.text: AYCE. Very slow.. I was the only customer and literally the each order came out past 7 to 9 minutes apart and I was already half full on 3rd order, usually I don't order many at a time cause I hate to waste food but this place, but if I have to go back, will order as many as I can in first order.  The server was nice guy but forgot my , salmon roe roll, tuna roll. The worst thing of last visit was uncooked pork cheese roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One order only for sweet shrimp, sea urchin, screaming orgasm, fresh oyster, galbi

6y0z4fcShy_PgTG9Z77MiA.text: Extremely fast service, courteous waitress, good food and entertaining sushi names. Oh and Lots of veggie options!

G7mwRBafCp4BoJH4oavbLA.text: AYCE sushi for lunch. Service was quick. Everything I ordered was pretty on point, just wish the menu was a little bigger as far as speciality rolls. Good selection on nigiri tho.

DjpuaKQGocnjgZlhSwg6jA.text: Great Sushi.. Nice atmosphere. Friendly staff. And a gorgeous waiter. Win win Good selecrion, Was in love with the jalepeno poppers.

tPhzw1ebrr8CvXTGtWAOjw.text: Excellent! Best sushi deal I've ever had. Edamame was tasty. Good vegetarian options. Fast service, you can order till you're full. Tasty Mochi

TlNen4Xp99Hjyjs5yz2faQ.text: I could make this a long review because there is a lot to say... But it's simple, BEST quality sushi and most creative rolls I've ever had for AYCE. If it wasn't AYCE and I had paid full price it would have still been worth it... And this is from someone who's tried, Nobu, Katsu-ya, Izakaya. Great service at bar, TRY IT!

7x4-zde47sN1UKb-Eb_BYg.text: Everything I tired here was great. The only thing I didn't like was I ate to much. I will definitely be coming back here again.

DNwOUHEiQtvh4ZycktAkag.text: Small restaurant with so many food choices. Choose all you can eat.  Japanese Chef. Very good oysters.

in18XAbq2InyismYEoQ22g.text: Friendly staff and they had a great menu. My mom was not a hard sore sushi eater and the staff went out of their way to find something she would enjoy.  I would go back.

zVHJVpEcFFTReHoVLklxqw.text: Sushi was amazing!!! Went for dinner before the watching the rebels play. Did AYCE and was able to do half rolls so I could try different roles. Great service.

Emsa3dm1k7OrzuGRknHCfw.text: This is an awesome AYCE sushi place.  The sushi is super fresh and the staff are friendly.  We love Andy.  His recommendations were delicious! This would be our new LV sushi go to.

Fs40g1iS4HjUj2geAOxk9A.text: First time here. Unbelievably good. Had the all u can eat lunch. Excellent quality and great service. They have a huge selection of rolls.

sBG1VqJHrRHIiv7oJtcixg.text: Looooooved the sushi here! I've never had such a good experience at a restaurant. All thanks to JANE, thanks for everything !! I'll definitely plan on coming back during vacations. The food tasted great and your service was exceptional! My favs:  SEX BOMB ROLL,  COCONUT SHRIMP TEMPURA, OYSTERS, MUSSELS, GARLIC YELLOWYAIL, MOCHI ICE CREAM ... BOMB !!! This is from that one LA table, we WILL be back!

7Tm9KEljCi3K9LVm0TTX0w.text: As an obsessed sushi-eater, I had to try this new place in town and boy was I not disappointed! The fish is fresh, top-quality, and delicious! The appetizers were good and what I love the most about this place is that they offer great variety of delicious rolls, ordered as a full roll or half roll! My fave place in town do not allow us to order half rolls so I never got to try a variety of rolls and usually stick with the nigiri but now I can! Besides the food, the service was good and the place is clean (which is pretty important in my book!). This place has definitely become one of my top AYCE sushi restaurants. I will definitely frequent this place more, despite living in the other side of town!

wV8t25bkTE9UQPOunXo1DA.text: All you can eat at a great price. Sat at the bar and had fantastic service, chefs were very fun and attentive. The sushi I had was better than many places with much higher prices highly recommend!

4eEfvZsH-zv5sudy8B-mFg.text: Great place,  food 5'*****. Fresh.Great customer service. Price are reasonable. Definitely will be our favorite sushi place in Las Vegas.

6ADKy-nmoA17QHnLWm7PeA.text: I am not one to go to an AYCE sushi restaurant but did based on the reviews. I was not disappointed! Service, presentation,  freshness, taste, all GREAT. I can't explain any negative comments from other reviews. They had a generous selection and all was made to order. One limitation was you had 90 minutes to eat but I don't see that being an issue for anyone. Next time I am in town I'll be back.

UUEUkUnqGoG5YW3vwcHaMA.text: Jun the owner has developed some unique rolls. I've been here 3 times now and it is a must for me every time I'm in Vegas. The all you can eat is a fantastic deal!

uXLKEx6VcGZoIWdXmJ9S3w.text: Food is good but customer service was sub par.   We got no plates to eat off of, waited about 30 minutes before being asked if we were ready to order, then another 30 minutes after being served our first dish.

OgMMlNTf4MvUfBqna_uZBg.text: This place is so good! Fast service! The all you can eat is such a great deal. There are so many rolls to choose from. So glad we came here on our visit to Vegas. Definitely recommend coming here if your in the mood for sushi.

Fcki5207KJ5tUB0yon084g.text: This is place is awesome! 5 stars.  Their AYCE menu goes 21.95 for lunch(11:30am-4pm)  and 26.95 for dinner(4pm-2am). Their sashimi is fresh! Great selection of sashimi as well. I tried the salmon, shrimp, octopus, shrimp and surf clam. They were not chewy or even very fishy tasty. They were savory, smooth and delicious! Their rolls are magnificent. Well presented and flavored. My new favorite in Las Vegas! :)

xwHo19u4Qll69yL4iIWvZw.text: Great service && the food is always delicious! Try their pork belly appetizer! It's super yummy

FoqJ9tfrFHbKjxe2kMPxJw.text: We sat at the bar. Arrived before 7 and seated immediately. Everything was fairly quick in terms of service. Sushi rolls were all delicious. We had oysters, spicy tuna tartare, mussels, and the screaming orgasm for side dishes. Everything we ordered was the perfect portion. Instead of doing full orders, we did half orders to try more varieties. My favorite was the Burning Your Stomach roll. It has a kick to it but I love spicy food so it was perfect.

gwegPH_bwQD3goMMf3zekg.text: Excellent choice to satisfy our sushi cravings while in Vegas. Short Uber ride since it's off the strip but totally worth it. Super friendly staff and sushi chefs made great recommendations. Will definitely be back!

HR-005XGNES1gEK2DtMs6Q.text: Amazing food with great deal if you go the all you can eat route. Must have a large appetite to really take advantage of the deal but if you can eat your weight in sushi, this is the place for you. Top quality sushi, didn't have a single roll that wasn't fantastic, and it came with desert included in the price as well. Definitely will be coming back when I'm in Vegas again

Phxn0eCsA9HV9Nt4TQSbUw.text: This place was amazing !!! All you can eat sushi for 27 bucks! Not a bad deal and that included appetizers and desserts too!   What did I not try is the question! I went with a huge group as I was here for a convention and we all ordered multiple things and shared. I can't tell you a specific roll that was my favorite as there were a lot of favorites .. And worst case scenario if you didn't like anything it wasn't a waste of money since you can order something else.   Service was great and friendly.   The oysters how ever my managers complained about weren't they great .. I didn't try it so I can't say from personal experience.   Otherwise I can see myself coming back if I'm ever back.

s4KBERpML5HrBC136ugjCQ.text: Can't beat AYCE sushi for $27. Service was fast and there's lots of options to choose from. You need to finish everything, including the rice. The rice portion is not too big, which is a plus. There are a few items that are starred that you can only order 1/person, including uni and sweet shrimp. Each nigiri comes with 2 pcs. The standouts were the sweet shrimp nigiri, salmon roe, screaming orgasm, and salmon tartare.

vKjJ__VfijGvATaS0c-LJw.text: This is the best sushi restaurant I've been to when I come to Las Vegas! Our server joy is the best, great customer service, very attentive and great personality. Fast service and great food   Love it.

rwEvqQNr4Lf-Xx9amjsPrA.text: I came in with a party of 5 around 8pm on a Friday night and was helped immediately. The servers worked quickly to put a table together for all of us. We all got AYCE and ordered a shit ton on our first round and the server got everything down with ease and no mistakes were found when our orders came through.   The place was fairly crowded but the three servers all worked together to get everything done quickly. I'm pretty sure I experienced the best customer service ever here so I'm very impressed. The three girls were very attentive to every customer and made sure we had no issues with anything. Whenever we asked for extras like more ginger etc. they promptly did so without showing irritation. I get that being a server isn't the best job out there, but as the millennial I am, I feel bad constantly asking serves to do their job lol and it was nice not to feel like a burden. I didn't have to ask for anything twice (god forbid) and they were all just sweethearts about everything.   The atmosphere of the place itself was nice. It was fairly calm and not too big. It is a spacious but cozy place. Definitely a new go to spot for sushi in Vegas.

1AKdo3IQxef3N3GuEjb47A.text: The Korean old waitress is so rude!!! She doesn't greet or smile and never say thank you or sorry. She got us a wrong item so we told her that we didn't order it. She said nothing. Since I don't like to waste food, I said I can eat it to be nice and she said nothing. Seriously??  AND she said I can't order my favorite Alaskan rolls without crab! Even after I told her I have crab allergy, she said I can reduce the amount of crab but I "have to" eat it!! She laterally said that!!! WTF???Seriously???? Even tho you guys say on the menu that you guys would make a custom roll???? So what if I ask you to make a roll with salmon, cucumber,and avocado? Would I still have to eat it with crab??? Lame.   After I said then forget it, she asked the chef and he said he can make it w/o crab( of course! Why not?) But I never expected to be told to eat something I am allergic to in any restaurants so I was so shocked! Also, in almost all the restaurants(as far as I know), they  normally don't put crab meat in Alaskan rolls anyway!!!   Also when we went to have a lunch there, it was almost empty but each order took about 10-15 min to come!!! So ridiculous!!!! I really wanted to love this place but I can't. I don't think I will never go back there. They are Korean so they don't know how to make sushi and cut fish right. But their fish quality was actually good for ayce, so If the service was better, I would give them another chance, but never! I will never go back to the restaurant that tells me to eat what I physically can't. Or unless she leaves the restaurant, or they train her right!!

FTtk20DNBtkblSIJ_8o9Yw.text: Large selection on the ayce and closes late which is plus! Servers are nice and attentive. They include dessert in the ayce which is great. Would come back!

oOBdSeWHSsrXwQ4NjSqplg.text: This has been my go to sushi place since around the time it opened. It's always been great for good quality fish and good quality portions of fish. Their waiters are super friendly and it's definitely one of the best AYCE in town, and I've done AYCE on just about every side of town.  The last few times it's been a bit inconsistent with sushi chefs that change every single time and when I get nigiri the fish temperature is almost room temperature instead of chilled as it should be. The food is still good, but the rolls have been more inconsistent since every time we go it's different sushi chefs that don't seem to have as much training. If the fish were chilled properly and the rice to fish ratio were consistent between chefs I think this would be a 5 star review. I do love that they offer punch cards which gives you a great incentive to keep coming back!

TruieZbCtNwR7zVquYpkVw.text: The service is so great here. The two times I've been here have been great. The food is good and comes fast. There is a lot of variety but if you are a raw fish lover, there is a lot of things for you! My favorite items to order are the seared salmon, salmon hand roll, screaming orgasm and cajun albacore. I love that this place isn't in "rounds". Best sushi in Vegas, in my humble opinion

dZoPYq0AUnOBiR-VTD6eiw.text: Wow! Read a ton of reviews for multiple sushi restaurants... Saw the ones for Sushi Way and had to try it and glad I did!!!!!!!! All you can eat for lunch 21.95 per person, 60min limit. I'm a big eater so this worked perfect for me! Loved this place! Everything was very fresh! AAA+++  Def coming here again!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream!!!!!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who&#39;s your daddy
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll

BsltQpZ8-pwQ8CUqBP8qQw.text: I loved the sushi!!   Very fresh!  We had the AYCE....because why not ;). The menu selection for the all you can eat was impressive. Had all the regular rolls/nigiri...and then some.   Not too busy at 1p on a Tues and in a little strip mall can be deceiving. But the staff was super friendly and fast. The waitress and sushi chef were funny and engaging. The only reason this place didn't get 5 Stars was because the awesome server was the only one on the floor(besides the busser) so we had to wait a bit to order. But really if that's the worst....I'm a fan! I'm just visiting from out of town but I would def be back. Thank you staff of Sushi Way.  There are a bunch of sushi places to choose from and you did it right

XnFdUdxhXzpE48EU92OPBA.text: Great sushi and all you can eat so worth it :) Good fast easy service. I will come back again for sure.

gMyopLKOxiNUmTlOCtacCw.text: HIDDEN GEM! I grew up coming to Togoshi Ramen (RIP) in this shopping center and never knew about this sushi spot until I was searching yelp for a lunch idea to take out some out-of-towers today.  Did I mention how excited I am that I found this place?!   The service was excellent. The quality and consistency followed through the entire meal. Tons of delicious apps and sushi to choose from. I can not wait to come here again!  Some favs: Baked Salmon Roll Salmon Skin Hand Roll Fat Ass Roll  I Love Sushi Roll  Tip: Get a stamp card! If you plan on returning, be sure to get a stamp card(one stamp per all you can eat)

8zQ7qkH88HlL0f3u6bZ5Sg.text: The best sushi in Vegas. Great fast services, we must ordered at least 80 orders of nigiri  sushi. Plus another 30 plus items on the menus.... The quality of fish is sushi grade. They even served from a fresh box of unis.  Jeanne, our waitress is so efficient  and courteous, happy and patient.  she is the best waitress that every restaurant wish to have. This is our sushi restaurant in Vegas,  we are locals and hapy to see a great sushi restaurant near us.  We'll come back for sure.

bxOwZim1QUVCiI-I3VjCRA.text: One of the best sushi spots in Las Vegas can't go wrong with the pricing the Sushi is so damn good!

3hd4HJvLAjh_Gp-9r4Nl1w.text: My Favorite, underrated sushi restaurant to visit while in Las Vegas. A hidden gem for the locals. This place is not about the high prices and fancy ambience, it's about the really fresh and tasty sushi. Pleasant surprise. The oysters were just as good as any expensive restaurant on the strip. I will definitely be returning again with family every time I am in town!

MVf-7E7-b01HkFucxDWFHA.text: The way to AYCE sushi is the sushi way. The staff is attentive, the fish is really fresh and the galbi is to die for. If they had a giant vat of the marinade I would buy it to swim in. The sunny roll is a bright ray in any day and the gyoza really hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet shrimp, garlic tuna, garlic yellow tail, salmon belly and salmon roe.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jose roll and the brightest roll in the sushi galaxy... the Sunny roll. (They do half rolls)

Ll63UplBvm4qMQ9o9WQpVQ.text: This is an all-you-can-eat sushi place for about $25/head. The restaurant wasn't that big, but it was clean. We got the last booth on a Saturday night. Not a fancy establishment...some people brought their kids & infants.  The selection of items was tremendous. Some of the item names are, ahem, not family-friendly. "Excuse me, uh, what is a Screaming Orgasm?" Lol!  Quality of the fish was okay, perhaps slightly better than average for sushi buffet. Note: there's no way we can compare sushi buffet fish with a regular restaurant, given the relatively low cost. The seaweed salad was too sweet.  So, why did DH swear never to return? It was the rice. Their rice was gluey and starchy, so much so that it distracted us from enjoying the fish or shrimp. The  sweet shrimp itself was pretty good, however, they didn't give us the deep fried heads! The uni was a touch bitter & a really small portion. It was okay, but we didn't want more. Which was a good thing, since this item was limited to one order per person.  The Kalbi was good. Haha, must be a Korean-run establishment! :) Eel was okay, but no torch-caramelized top. Sunny Special roll tasted fine, however, not as skillfully done as the nigiri. They had more than 1 chef making rolls, so maybe these were done by the other guy. See the photo with the cross-section on how it was rolled.  The "Yum Scallop" was basically a gunkan sushi with shredded scallop mixed in mayonnaise. We couldn't understand the waitress & thought "mai yu" was a special seasoning! Lol! She meant "mayo"! You folks can pass on this one. ;)  The Honey Bread dessert was tasty. Basically a King's Hawaiian bread roll with a scoop of green tea ice cream, whipped cream, and a drizzle of chocolate sauce. I don't think there was any honey in it. DH tried the yuzu sorbet and the flavor was weak.  Service was surprisingly good. They get an extra star for that. The wait staff was eager to get our orders in & happily explained things on the menu. There is a 90 minute time limit for dinner, but we were never rushed. Food came out quickly.

p6nqPdBYt-QpZSquxmVjAQ.text: Arrived about midnight, seated right away in a booth.  Pretty sure it took longer for us to decide what we wanted over how long it took to receive it.  Started with miso soup which is always a great start to a meal.  Followed by teriyaki chicken appetizer  Golden Philly roll - filled with cream cheese and deep fried .... melts right in your mouth warm and creamy!!  Big Easy Special - HUGE!  Very flavorful  Spicy tuna roll - always nice to go back to sample simplicity    From beginning to finish was less than 1 hour.  Service was quick and fantastic!    Great late night find off the strip!  Located within a shopping center.  No expensive overhead to cover so definitely reasonable in price!    I will most likely visit again on my next trip

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AXIN7wL9o2aQXYkuK13zzw.text: Come here every time i'm in Las Vegas.  Very well done great tasting rolls and sushi.  Great attentive service.  Open late!  Get off the $$$$$trip and get here, this place is local and real!

ZyU6QBLtPIyKc-VOrP6sfA.text: The sushi was excellent. I really enjoyed it, though the crunchy roll was really tiny. The Big Easy was delicious. Same with the Edamame.   Our waiter was awesome - very nice and attentive.  Really liked everything but our orders were taking so long. We were waiting 10-15 minutes each time we asked for another dish. Unacceptable. Main reason for the slow down is because the owner and her friends or family came in and demanded priority. All efforts went into catering to the owner. Not cool. And what kind of business owner does that?! We just kept watching dish after dish coming out for their table while we were waiting and waiting.  Also, they have gotten pretty busy but they only have two sushi chefs. Doesn't seem like enough.   To end our meals, we got two orders of the honey bread. It was tasty but it's not real honey bread. It's just a small piece of Hawaiian Roll with honey, ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate syrup.

Lsioza_Y4ZLiWjy7xCqijQ.text: I frequent this establishment and as always, the food and experience is always great!  Staff is always welcoming and attentive even though when they are busy.  Unlike other places, they don't skim on the fish when its All You Can Eat .  They make the rolls just like they would if you were ordering by the roll.  The fish quality is fresh and the rolls, nigiri, and all other items are made with care.  There's many other places I've been to that the roll falls apart even before you pick them up off the plate.  Never had a problem here as everything is prepared and made well.  I always try to order a different combination of sushi nigiri and rolls every time I visit.  Definitely recommend for anyone looking for a nice clean and tasty all you can eat sushi restaurant =)

2E8zqfm47dzPd1iRsmqAiA.text: Quick dinner before heading back to the hotel. I thought the food was fine no real complaints. I wasn't a fan of the bacon wrapped scallops, they were a bit slimy even though they were cooked. The pork belly was good. I don't think the Uni was very fresh either. Overall is was fine... average quality I assume. Although I eat a lot of sushi so I'm very picky. Service was good as well. My only real complaint is the AYCE pricing seemed high to me. I know this is vegas but for the quality of the fish I wouldn't go back with these same prices in place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Bites
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped scallops
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming Orgasam.... tuna sashimi with a slightly spicy sauce

UK0_MYi7Ccrqpi-rP1pmTg.text: Great menu, friendly service, fresh ingredients, and reasonable prices. My husband and I were looking for the perfect late night sushi take-out place to go. We definitely found it!!! Can't wait to bring our friends and family with us next time to let them enjoy the experience. Loved the Baked Salmon Roll

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuisines prepared by knowledgeable professionals.  Gotta try the &#34;Screaming Orgasm&#34; sauce on the salmon.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fast, friendly service
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phenomenonal specials!

2CBXfJhqwJ_2Y9WzCkC9Ww.text: AYCE sushi.... We saw, we came, and we conquered.  This place never has disappointed me and all my friends.    This is the only place that I've eaten uni that I actually liked it. Normally it tastes like the ocean but if you ask anybody that has eaten good uni, they will tell you that it tastes like butter and over it tasted like butter. Even my brother and my dad who has high end taste likes it here.    One thing to note is the things with the red dot at the end of it (uni aka sea urchin, ama ebi aka sweet shrimp, fresh oyster, Kal bi aka galbi, etc) is one order per person. Other than that it order as much as you can eat. Don't waste or you might get charged.   They have beer, different kinds of sake, soft drinks, and soda.   Desserts are things like mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, yuzu sorbet, tempura ice cream, and honey bread. Unfortunately you can choose only one of them.   Yuna was our server and she was the bomb. Very friendly and gave us some good suggestions. Thanks Yuna, everything you suggested was good.   Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95.   For all of you who cant eat that much, you can do Ala carte.

kT98Qq4g6eJ7joeuRhQ-WQ.text: After taking up a calisthenics class, Matt L. and myself decided on AYCE sushi and this place was the closest on my go to list.   Miss Jane was our waitress and couldn't have been more fortunate to have her. Unlike many other sushi servers, she would stop by each table to engage with her customers which made her very approachable. I asked her for more pickled ginger and she came back with a bowl full! Now that's the kind of woman I need in my life Lol.  As far as the food, I stuck to my favorites from my last visit and the quality is still there: Big Easy Roll, Kiss of Fire Roll, Bacon Wrapped Scallops, Super White Tuna, Garlic Tuna, Sushi Nachos, Coconut Tempura, Oysters, Baked Muscles, Pork Belly, Tempura Ice Cream, Mochi Ice Cream (no limit on desserts).   Thank you to all the chefs backstage for preparing our food and of course Jane for putting up with our immature personalities. Keep up the great work and don't get frustrated during the busy hours like your former co-worker;)

S0AX40VU0g4jkA7wTIAopg.text: This is our go-to place for A.Y.C.E. sushi.  They have fresh nigiri and some cool daily specials.  It's not too far from Flamingo off the strip.  Our favourite is the no rice rolls, especially the one wrapped with cucumber...so refreshing.  Service is usually good but could be slow some days.  Desserts are always great with good selections.  They have a stamp card system where you get a free dinner for 10 visits which is another good reason to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4ylHqc4wlDOsBr3JPrbyaA.text: The sushi here is average, the service is a little slow, and the AYCE is overpriced at $27 per person. They didn't bring out 2 or 3 of my orders, and the place was only about half full. They were also completely out of mochi and many of the desserts. My ice cream also came out half melted for some reason?   Overall, I agree with the people who say the fish is fresh, but not enough to make up for the service or price.

sqj6N9kBStB-XUCQtNqNWA.text: This is one of the best all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants I have ever eaten at.  The nigiri is all great and they have lots of creative rolls both hand and cut  The chef knows his business and the servers are friendly, attentive and always checking on you.  Reasonable price and great drink specials.

z2tY_Bw5nhytt-TQomH3qw.text: First time at Sushi Way. We came for the all you can eat.   Great quality sushi, everything was so fresh and clean tasting. Very well prepared, large pieces of fish and a good amount of rice. The itamaes were very skilled and everything was presented well and delicious.   Highlight was a strawberry rice wine. This was so smooth and easy to drink. We blew through 7 bottles in the course of our meal. Totally worth it!   The waitresses were helpful and super attentive. Great service, there were always around and available.   Great sushi spot, I'd really recommend coming to try them out. Off the strip, but worth the time and really high class.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MOWqg1Fn_it2YQcyT2CleA.text: Everything we ordered was so good. Super good deal for the all you can eat ! Definitely will be stopping by on my next Vegas trip

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vcWY7HRzHLDcfFG1ss7aIw.text: My boyfriend and I were in Vegas for one night and looking for a good restaurant with reasonable prices. We searched and searched, and there weren't a ton of inexpensive sit-down options that were nearby. However, after about 20-30 minutes of searching on Yelp, he saw the menu for Sushi Way--at $10-15, the prices sounded great, and the place had 4.5 stars.  We sat down and picked two sushi rolls to start--when the server came to take our order, we told him what we wanted, and then he asked if we wanted to do the AYCE sushi option for $27 a person. There were a couple rules to review on the menu (like they will charge you for wasting food), but I LOVE sushi and knew that I could eat my money's worth. Any stomach ache or vomiting from overeating would be totally worth it. That's how much I love sushi.  I ordered oysters, baked mussels, seared salmon, salmon, eel, sea urchin, sexy lazy special, vocano roll, pineapple sorbet, and vanilla ice cream. Everything was SO good. I loved the sexy lazy, vocano, and eel the most. I still dream about those flavors in my mouth. Oh, it was SO good. None of the sushi had excessive rice, they were super friendly, quick, and paced everything out well instead of dragging it out so you're full faster.  I definitely wish this place was in Portland. I would probably go eat myself stupid at least once a month. At least.

Qtq1hZQdv9vfsr3kEDFK9g.text: Me and my family are locals and have been eating sushi for 20 years , we have a sushi place that has amazing food but terrible service and decided to venture out and find great food and great service . We thought by all the great reviews this place was going to be amazing , out of a party of 12 we were all pretty disappointed with the service and THE FOOD . If your new at sushi and don't know any better this place might be ok for you ( tourist trap ) but if you know your sushi than this isn't it at all . I never write reviews on here but I didn't want people to keep getting suckered into coming here .

ipI5t9v_oTdEw0fdYdbEcw.text: On our way back from Zion in Utah, we were craving a buffet as a reward for the drive and being out in the wilderness. This place had pretty good reviews so we stopped by Saturday night around 8pm. Despite the great reviews, the place was pretty empty - not sure if it was a good or bad sign (no clue when the Vegas dinner rush hours are) but I was starving so I took it as a good sign.   AYCE is $22 for lunch and $27 for dinner. The menu is pretty huge and also has a good variety of cooked stuff. Can't compare to other AYCE sushi Vegas places since we weren't local.   The good: - Service was amazing! Not sure if it is because it was half empty but props to their team - plus the food came out super fast  - The fish didn't taste fishy. The fish to rice ratio is a little higher than I would prefer...I would say that it is average. The uni and sweet shrimp was super tasty.   The meh: - Don't get their oysters...it was way sauced up and didn't look terribly fresh - Don't get their Galbi/Kalbi: super chewy  - Their rolls / Sushi Nachos were way too saucy. Would not recommend   Stick with their nigiri and don't get any of the cooked stuff or rolls. This place is 3.5, rounded down because I'm a little weary of places that offer free stuff (in this case - a soda) for reviews (that you have to show on the spot).   Parking: pretty easy in a strip mall - on the side of Citibank and Urban Turban.

g5YUGhPVUy9L5AG4829-kg.text: First time here. Service is good and food is excellent! Not too much rice and excellent grade sushi! My new sushi joint!

fl-NR1WqoaqLy_ygZ2CLMw.text: All you can eat (AYCE) sushi?! "When you crave it, you must go!" I believe someone in a religious text quoted that.. The Book of Noms? Anyway, I digress.  Sushi Way is tucked into the Corporate Center in Vegas near all the other food choices. The service was excellent and the waitress/staff were all incredibly attentive. The food that came out was fresh, and tasted great (see all the photos of goodness in the review)! The lunch AYCE price was $21.95 I believe, and had pretty much everything on the menu up for grabs.  All-in-all, very good spot to stuff yourself silly. Be warned though, DO NOT WASTE FOOD. I think every household (including you who are currently reading this) has been scolded by your family as a youngin'. If you do it here, you will be charged.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LCLFwdAIKZGwveo8fiSyLA.text: You know when you go to a high class sushi joint and you wish you could eat another 20 pieces and absolutely STUFF yourself, buuuuuuut you can't really afford to do that? Well come to Sushi Way because you get ALL YOU CAN EAT quality sushi for the price of 2 rolls at any other place.   Every piece. Every piece was SO good! I'm talking Unagi, garlic roasted tuna, white tuna, apps galore, all leading up to the Screaming Orgasm (actual dish) which you just HAVE to put in your mouth. AND YOU GET DESERT!!  *mic drop*   Whether you win or lose at the casinos, whether you're a Vegas vet, Vegas Native or a tourist from halfway across the world, Sushi Way is THE way to fill up on some of THE BEST sushi in Nevada without breaking the bank. Win-win in my book

742DM4B6DHO5nln5-flJNA.text: Ahhhhhmazing! This restaurant's rave reviews are absolutely on point! Would definitely recommend this as THE Las Vegas sushi destination to put on your list.  The vibe is hip and trendy, with Eminem rap music bumping through the speakers and high-speed skating on the TV screens. Food was ready extremely fast, and everything was amazing.   I've never had deep-fried sushi before, and my Johnny roll was awesome!! I would've eaten two! We also got two other sushi rolls and the vegetable tempura. Tons of options on the menu, and lots of them were very different from what I'm used to back home in New England. Lots of great new things to try!  Sushi Way does have an "all you can eat" option, but the a la carte menu is what we went with, and I was happy with my decision.

5Uv5lkbT6Fd329hg1xhNqw.text: Really good sushi and they're open till 2am ! Came here on a Wednesday night so they weren't that full and we got all our food quick. Plus our waiter is beyond handsome I'm pretty sure he models on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious

i7jgd_9oyZKPOuZI7aDdyA.text: This place is awesome! My Uber driver (a local) recommended it when I was heading to my hotel;$26.95 for all you can eat from 4p-2a and everything I was served was terrific. I let my server Jay know my preferences and he put together a smorgasbord of great stuff (appetizers, rolls, sushi,etc.) He kept it coming and set up the next round based on my feedback; he was truly awesome (attentive, knowledgeable, pleasant demeanor, etc)  I would highly recommend this place to sushi fans that are looking for fantastic eats at a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat -awesome

UXe-oSOyimDzwerf1MLneg.text: AYCE Buffet with a great selection of items. would definitely recommend the nigiri! We ordered multiple rolls, nigiri, udon, oysters, scallop skewers, and the screaming 9

ojOHr7F2aIykTX7zB2dRBw.text: Did the AYCE. Being that I live in a non-sushi kind of place, sushi is the one thing I have to have when I go to Vegas. Because I want to get more than one piece, I like to go off Strip for my fix. This was a new choice, and I was not disappointed.   The boyfriend and I did the all you can eat, getting the nigiri first: super tuna, scallops, salmon, and yellowtail. All were fresh, with nice, properly seasoned rice and reasonable portions, with the scallop being the stand out (I think I had six pieces total). For the rolls, they allow you to get half and half if you're torn between two choices, as I was with the Alaska and Arizona rolls, and again, great sizes, super fresh, and tasty combos (I preferred the Alaska with the crab, but that's just personal taste).   Also got the Salmon Tartar, which is quite rich, served as a round with a top layer of salmon tartar, a lower layer of mayo/crab, and a creamy mayo sauce. The shrimp tempura was light and not greasy. The only disappointment was the tempura ice cream, with a heavy, unappealing shell over the green tea ice cream. But it was such a minor fault (and I really wasn't there for dessert) that I don't care.   The sushi chef was super friendly and very on the ball, he almost seemed disappointed when we stopped ordering (even though I thought we'd been kind of piggish). Overall, a very satisfying experience.

71TodkgqfABwi5zvaY6JYA.text: Came here on a whim,  man it was good.  Despite it being Friday night it was slow and sat at the sushi bar and the chef on duty was making me roll after roll of the popular ones.  I ordered a few more off the menu and everything was fantastic. Would definitely return.  Favorite was the big easy roll and spicy garlic edamame.

37MQA4hAlIsRZCINNiutIg.text: This sushi place is not bad at all. They have an AYCE option for around $25 a person or you can order the entrees individually. We ended up getting the AYCE option because it seemed so much more worth it. The quality of the fish is pretty good, seems decently fresh and tastes great. We ordered pretty much everything from the raw oysters to the nigiri to rolls. The nigiri and rolls were good, salmon, tuna, eel, yellowtail all the standard stuff were on point. The only thing that was less favorable was the raw oysters. Nonetheless, a pretty solid sushi place!

Ab71zI7Sty0sMCHpL7HaFw.text: Very pleased... an upscale "All U Can Eat" ..  the baked mussels will blow your mind!  All the rolls our group had were excellent quality, the yellowtail fav of course.  Friendly accomodating staff.  Would highly recommend.

kcko3_bTp0HCB58DMrTQFA.text: Garlic hamachi great!  Good rice to fish ratio for nigiri! fair price of $26.95 for dinner!  Ayce sushi. Got here at 6:00 and no wait for table of 4.

XrC57trIuRAPbYepP32GCA.text: OMG, everything was wonderful try the sushi nachos, mind blowing!     The uni is the best I have ever had.  Well worth the cost!  Yuna was very helpful, and nice.  We were on a family reunion vaca, and everyone was stuffed and more than satisfied.

exKOoCRh2nNwc7vivr1KRg.text: Highly recommend this place. The all you can eat is good. The fish is fresh. Verizon was an awesome sushi chef. P.s ask him for his special rolls. Been to many sushi places. This is in my top three.

lqBT8bPHf4ZCyhgyUKqlmQ.text: I ordered a to go order from here and it was affordable, and fresh quality. I was impress with how much food they gave me and how fresh the ingredients were. I ordered the sushi dinner. Came with nigiri pieces, California, soup, and salad all for $13-15. I definitely will come back to this place. I haven't tried their AYCE but it looks fantastic.

jIjrPYadp7-QNJIGLCJuqQ.text: Staff very friendly and accommodating. Pretty good quality for the price. Wish they had a better wine selection. It's convenient and solid food.

5W4fS69vMYdhFYUuEctU8w.text: Located near the strip, "Sushi Way" offers some decent sushi for a reasonable price, that is all you can eat.   Look I'm not all that into sushi, I'll be upfront but I found myself enjoying some new stuff.   No Edamame before my meal? That kida sucks.  The fried rice SUCKS! But maybe it was a bad batch.  The Sushi tasted fresh with good flavor.  I'm not the biggest fan of sushi, but I can say without hesitation it's ok.

_WbmHRVauUNO49EREWBgKA.text: Just finished a meal here and will have to say that this place may replace my usual go to spit when I am in Vegas. The fish was fresh, service was as fast as they could be given they were swamped with the CES Rush.   I would only say that Yama sushi has the advantage because they have a larger space than sushi way, but the food here was great and may be worth the possibility of waiting.

VoJ901w-SNDbqIcmzHN_Ig.text: Sushi Way is almost like a hole in the wall. If you don't know about it already then you won't find it. I mean unless you're at Tacos and Beer next door. Everytime I've come here the food is always fresh and DELICIOUS. Never disappoints. Their baked mussels and sushi nachos are always the first things I order. For AYCE it's pretty decently priced especially because the food is good quality.

gM7tq73uQ3dn2pYeAIgnLQ.text: Ate here about 4:45 pm on Sun/21 Sep: - Server (Kelly?) was great. - Food was great. With AYCE you can order anything on the menu and the "Chef's Specials" of the day (sign posted near the entrance).  Unfortunately they were out of Kalbi (Korean ribs).  - Free drink with a Yelp check-in ($2.50 value for a soda, free refills). - Sushi Way and Jjanga seem on-par with each other.  I would prefer Sushi Way if I'm on the Eastside, and Jjanga if I'm on the Westside. - The plaza it's in seems to have lots of restaurants I should try eg Urban Turban.  Concentra clinic is also here so should I need to endure a 2+ hr wait for non-emergency medical help, this plaza is a good choice to dine & wait.

kWFNAFSYgWtmIK5fQ8lLzw.text: It's been my fifth times here already and we also tried Umiya sushi place and with no doubt Sushi way is much much better. Will come back later soon.

cwf0iLQ9a6_BZheLbjnljA.text: Always looking for new good sushi places. Came across this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try over the weekend. Went in around 12 and it was pretty empty. The food selection is good and they had a decent amount of tuna rolls which I loved. There wasn't one roll I wasn't please with and my BF and I ordered quite a bit. My daughter was being cranky (she's one) and one of the workers (Hispanic lady) kept cheering her up. Service was good. Food was good. We will be back. :)

YmJuJN-Oxz4FeHQQQymOzw.text: Coming from Hawaii where everything is expensive, when I saw an all you can eat sushi place this reasonable/cheap,  I was skeptical about the quality of it all. However, my uncle was insistent it was amazing. He undersold it.   All the sushi was fresh, and amazing. The one that surprised me the most was the uni (sea urchin) and amaebi (sweet shrimp). Both are normally expensive regardless of where you go, but here they didn't skimp out, even though it was limited to 1 order per person.   The sushi rolls had interesting names and were verging on the too complicated at times, but they mixed the flavors and textures well for the most part.   Definitely going back whenever I go to Vegas!

Jwd3Wu1A17FKGZvYE8Y5QA.text: OMG sooooo good! Best AYCE sushi in town! Everything was on point!  I read some of the hater reviews. Im not sure what they were eating, because i have 0 complaints on the food. The only thkng that wasnt the best is the service. We got a girl that was on her 2nd day. So she forgot some rolls, mixed them up, and ended up having to switch with another server. Im sure once she has been there a few more days it will be perfect!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey bread! YAY! SOOOO YUMMY! Made me so happy! Definitely order that for dessert.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dynamite, i loved it but it was mostly mushrooms.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lil bit of everything! All AMAZING!

iXt6IZZHhaq5qRy5bCO1NA.text: Overall, it was an alright meal, but looking back at reviews and pictures, it seems the cut of fish I received was inconsistent with others.. Came for an early dinner on Saturday and was really looking forward to our meal after a hike in the narrows. We chose to sit at the sushi bar and service was decent.  For apps: the coconut shrimp tempura and baked green mussels were good. The calamari was not so great. Not crunchy and the batter came right off.  In our first round, we ordered 2 orders of uni, but was only brought out 1. So I had to ask for the second. When they brought out the second order, there was significantly less uni. I was dismayed but the uni was still very good.   It seemed after our first round, the sushi chef wasn't happy that I asked for the second uni order and it was reflected on the size of fish and rice we got following that order. The cuts of our fish for the nigiri were small compared to the pictures, and the amount of rice got a little bigger. The rice also fell apart too easily.  I did enjoy the white tuna the best, it came with a garlic ponzu, and the fish was really good. It'd be even better with a better fish to rice ratio. Garlic yellowtail was also good. Everything else was so so: salmon, garlic tuna, scallop.  The sweet shrimp was nice and big in size, but the sushi chef did not include the fried shrimp head, nor did he offer or say anything about it.  The Red Boy roll: this was good, the white tuna on top was a little cooked on top, and the charred flavor went really well.  The I love my ass roll: not so good.. There was supposed to be soft shell crab inside, but there was literally none, just a lot of imitation crab filling.  The yellowtail collar and jalapeno white tuna were the chef's special for the day. The yellowtail was huge and delicious, although a bit overcooked. Also liked the white tuna.

JKRaOnQVSTZ1P8DNbJEA4A.text: We have been to many sushi all you can eat sushi restaurant in the past, but this is the best one so far. Excellent service, sushi and desserts.

fioopx6TIynVVFNkV6HNCg.text: I now know the way. Best ayce sushi in Vegas, hands down! The Hawaiian sushi master was super friendly and helpful with his recommendations. I loved the wrong way 69, but I didnt love I love my ass. ;)

CC88lA2LV-NVN1Fku4rLDQ.text: Tough to find better AYCE sushi.  Rolls are fresh and a good size.  Ate my body weight in eel

5eGwt-bgBUdzd5Da4dItow.text: I love this place.  Excellent table service from friendly servers.  Prices that can't be beat and great sushi to go with it.  This is not one of those AYCE places with conveyor belts or tables with the food being breathed on and touched by other patrons.  Rather, you order from a menu and your items are made for you and brought to your table.  This is my favorite sushi restaurant!

sr9d4LAzJS_xakNGtviWqA.text: Te all you can eat is amazing, they offer half rolls which is convenient. I want to try a little of everything without getting full on a few rolls. We went during happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sake time

rV5B_fuDx2sWEJC8vuO4fQ.text: Good food. What you expect from a sushi buffet. I ordered take out and I thought it was pretty solid. Good place to go to get your sushi fix

54QUjnz5Xg_4CJPDClFC5g.text: Great place. AYCE is a must. Service is good theyre pretty attentive, sushis not the fastest to come out but the quality is worth the wait. Definitely will be coming back.

gdo6n8pFwJ-h1TkN4tu34g.text: I was quite surprised. Amazing service and the salmon and otoro was on point. Jose was attentive !

dYnVG3Eb2lLd0K4c_VZbSw.text: So yummy!! All you can eat dinner is a must. Bring a jacket, it's a little chilly inside

_T-BLWadloMm3LZOgAKHEA.text: Excellent! Will return next time to Vegas! Great price for Vegas. Rolls are well assembled and service is great.

ePgIFbjD6htpyNxt7NN4Tg.text: Yumm alert!  You like all you can eat sushi? Can you stuff it in your pie hole (sushi hole) in an hour? You betcha!  For about $26 bucks for dinner, one person, no sharing, finish in an hour ANYTHING on the menu'. Challenge accepted!  My dining guest does not eat sushi.... sadly... however, he did have some amazing pot stickers as well as some tasty katsu chicken; so there is something on the menu for our non sushi eating friends.  Here is a tip as well....... you can order half sizes of the rolls! If you are anything like me you want to try as much as your sushi tummy can handle! Also, beer drinking is fun, but it does have a tendency to make that rice expand in your belly, so stick to water or their amazing tea...   Lunch is around $21 smackers, all you can eat, no sharing... you get the idea...  Oh yes I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F8Y1Ve3ADDbVXdSY00kOog.text: The experience was very average. Pros: the service staff was fast and pleasant (not overly nice). The salmon killer roll is edible, and the fried ice cream dessert is tasty. Cons: Stay away from the "I love sushi" & the salmon teriyaki plate.

Yl2phxfhePT6HGnOs2fslw.text: Love the food here; great variety of roll selections. Taste is also very delicious. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends.

aNNxl87juf_hWjWMSUP5Kw.text: This is hands down the BEST sushi restaurant I've been to thus far. We're talking better than Yama, Kaizen, Sushi Mon and Jjanga. They are fairly new in town so I can only hope this continues to be the case after they've become more popular.   The friendly, warm service was better than expected. This one guy Richard, who seemed to be the manager, constantly came over to check on me and other guests. Based on my initial orders, he asked if he could recommend a couple dishes which were the specials of the evening. I've never had this happen before during an ayce experience.  There is soft lighting, dark tables and chairs and music that wasn't loud enough to get annoying. This would make a good place for a date. The sushi bar was the most spacious I've seen to date and with plenty of elbow room between chairs.  My picks for the evening:  *Screaming Orgasm: Lightly seared tuna over a bed of radish with some "O" sauce. *Salmon Tar Tare *Poke Salad *Evening specials (sashimi): Super white tuna & yellowtail. Both with jalapenos.  *Rolls: Big Easy, Dancing Eel, Kiss of Fire, Burning Your Stomach   After demolishing said dishes, I polished off the meal with a refreshing order of their Yuzu Sorbet. Part of me wanted the honey bread but nobody needed to see me get assisted out the door.   For $26 buckaroos for dinner, it can't get better than this. Also, don't forget your stamp card. Your 11th ayce is on them. I will be back at least once before the end of this month.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front: Salmon Tar Tare Back: Screaming Orgasm

WYRrTSOJMYHkYfy8KO9SeA.text: This is our 2nd time here, I see it becoming the sushi spot we always hit when we come to Vegas. Great variety of rolls, great price for AYCE, good service. Nothing to complain about, except a super full belly when you leave.

4PbTHePP0rbIEf3ODgL8Lw.text: RUN!!!!!  Honestly, everything was great until I was watching the chefs banter over a sauce - at least that's what I gathered from the conversation that I saw.  Right in front of me one of the chefs squirted the sauce on his hand (which he had a glove on) bent down behind the sushi bar, and licked his glove!!!!!!!!! I'm assuming this was his version of a taste test.   Okay, gross, but what happened next was completely disturbing.   He stood back up, and continued to make sushi with the same hand he just licked!!!!!!!!   No change in glove, no hand wash, NOTHING.  Right back to packing rice with the same hand he just slobbered all over!!!!!  Needless to say, I'm BEYOND disgusted.  Luckily my friend and I had already asked for our check.   I left in a hurry, And I will NEVER be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Aom8BOn_2nNBJ7BSjt8J_Q.text: Bookmarked this place to try in the hopes of finding an AYCE competitor to Yama, and I got to try it out with the boyfriend this past weekend.  In terms of taste, this place is really good. It also has an impressive menu. I liked the fact that they gave us an AYCE and a regular menu. The food is what has me giving this place 4 stars. Favorites from what we ordered: Tuna Poke Salad, Seaweed Salad, Yolo Special Roll (love the fried onions on top to compliment/balance the roll), Chicago Fire Roll (had enough spice for the boyfriend), Japanese Lasagna Roll (always a fave for us), Honey Bread (reminds me of a cinnamon roll with ice cream instead of frosting), and the fried Tempura Ice Cream (tasted like Fruity Pebbles Cereal). Honestly knocked one star off 'cause of customer service we experienced early in our dinner. It was nice to be greeted and seated right away. What wasn't cool was waiting for a waitress take our order about 10 minutes after we had been given water by the initial host to the evening. Umm... We didn't have our phones out, distracted from looking at the menu.  I will admit that it got slightly better after getting our appetizers, but when we were trying to order the sushi, the waitress was nowhere near our table.  I look up and around the restaurant for her, and she's at the cashwrap area, leaning against the counter or whatever, talking to the host that seated us. The boyfriend said he observed her there for awhile, but just didn't want to point it out to further irritate me.  I was about ready to leave when a waiter we hadn't seen earlier came by to get a sushi order. Big thanks to that gentleman. We never got 1 order of sushi I asked for, but no biggie 'cause he checked up on us more than our waitress, who I only saw pick up our plates, not saying a word to us. The host even checked on us more - asked about soda/water refills, and brought me the sake cooler I asked for. The fastest service I got from her was when she brought the check and picked it up in less than 5 minutes. What the...?

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poki Salad (top) &amp; Screaming Orgasm (bottom)

6GlsJgKMATsqhVrC955DHg.text: This place is pretty legit for AYCE! They don't fill you up with a lot of rice in their rolls, and the ingredients are fresh.  The food comes out pretty fast, too! Most importantly, there wasn't any wait when we came on a Saturday night.   Between the four of us, we got Arizona, I Love Sushi, Rock & Roll, Candy Cane, Baked Salmon Roll, Crispy Rice (with spicy tuna on top), Golden Philly, Fat Ass, crunch roll, yellowtail nigiri, sea urchin nigiri, albacore tuna nigiri, fresh oysters, miso soup, seaweed salad, and multiple orders of Screaming Orgasm.   We were soooo full after all the food but somehow they just kept coming!!  The service is friendly and they come around to check on you every now and then. It is a little far off the strip, so be prepared to walk (which is probably a good thing for before AND after you stuff your face silly with sushi).   Time for a post sushi nap...

7_r0BbWpDxRE3qekpOXzCA.text: Sushi Way had the best all-you-can eat sushi that I have ever had.  We stopped in for dinner and could not resist the special.  All of the sushi was super hight quality and excellent.

rS_6K_fajgysOUDu1VJb1g.text: I just want to start off saying this is not the worst AYCE sushi place but it definitely is not the best. After we got our seats we waited about 15 mins before someone took our order. After ordering we asked the server what rolls that they gave us were and she had no idea what it was. If your server doesn't even know what it is how do you expect me to know if it's the right one? We just dismissed this and just said its ok and she just told us to eat it, that it's good.   As far as the quality of the food, it's ok but I've had better. I had the Arizona roll and Sunny Special. The Arizona roll had yellowtail, cucumber and avocado which was topped with yellowtail. I definitely enjoyed the Sunny Special more which had crab and was topped with salmon and a lemon slice, the lemon was too strong for my liking but once I took the lemon off the rest was enjoyable. I also ordered the poki tuna salad which was probably my favorite thing I ordered.  After eating we told the waitress that we would like our check, I guess she didn't hear us or forgot because she walked around for like 15 mins and then came back without the check and asked if we wanted anything else. We asked for our check again and I would say another 10-15 mins for us to get that as well. The restaurant as a whole is decent, they definitely need to work on customer service though.

wdG1GDTkdeqhBWeJ_mVKbg.text: I've been here two times for all you can eat sushi place. I think this one the best so far . I love this place , nice - clean , friendly staff and the food is so yummy .  Definitely, I will come bank and recommend to my friends.

PFvDbc2s7I__NRun3vdY5Q.text: First time to sushi way. Great service and fast , very helpful and a lot of choices on the menu. Crunch roll and go rebel!! Love the sushi and service!

_sac6dcrF92R12JWqkqGrw.text: Not so good this time. Orders came long time after ordering (twice), and the servings came not so well done and good as they were the first time.... Many things to say, but... After sometime, this other great sushiman came to save the night for me and my wife. We tried some good stuff, new stuff... Recommend this place!!

Jxtm4Bt1LeYEGhoUWP1kdA.text: Delicious! I didn't have to wait to be seated, like Yama Sushi, plus Sushi Way has better sushi! The salmon melted in my mouth, the shrimp tempura was mouth watering, the honey bread was amazing! Everything was so good! FYI, if you are thinking of getting green tea ice cream get the honey bread instead as it comes with a scoop of green tea ice cream. I'd say this is the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas.

Had the all you can eat, and theres so much stuff that I can come back without trying the same thing twice.  Love the portion sizes, let's you do more types of rolls.  Thanks Andy!

2PTxc_QIEXYN38TxDIU7eA.text: Went here for ayce dinner. About $27 a person without tax. I wanted to take pictures but we devoured the food so fast.   There was a great selection of rolls with really creative names as well as sides and appetizers to choose from. Rolls were too saucy for my taste. I am not a big sushi expert but I love the thick cuts of fish and how they melt in your mouth! Next time, I'll definitely get more of that. Desserts were pretty good. I got the mochi ice cream which was small so the perfect size after ayce.  Service was a bit slow. The restaurant was small with two to three servers. Every time we need something, it was a bit annoying trying to get the server's attention. However, our food came out pretty quickly!

z8xzkusiP1F2CdBBIUFBYQ.text: Definite hidden gem. Fish is fresh and service is fast. Coming back for sure when we are back in town!!

I love their mussels and their rolls, some of my faves are the sweet 16 and oh Jenna. Try to have them with an Kirin Ichiban beer. Seriously every time my family comes to visit they ask me to bring them here. They are consistent, their products are really fresh and the price is really good. I always seat at the bar because we like to chat with the chefs.

WtJ1o8i-ia52732GlZOdlQ.text: Away from the strip in a strip mall.  Nice Korean family folk.  Didn't want to abuse the AYCE.   My favored is the flat white with a small crisp chili and dot of siracha... yumm. Role we're above average... Sexy lady and Big Easy was delish.  Others were too vinegary for me. Baked mussels with cheese was the bomb. Sat at the bar, so my service was tops... also help to come at open to avoid the crowd on Friday. $22 best deal in town.  1 mile walk from Paris casino

01C_fpA-ipn77YquNkOw1g.text: Off the strip so easy to find parking.  We went during lunch.  $21/person AYCE.  Overall - highly recommended!!! Would take family or business partners there to impress!  To start, we got Miso soup, Pork Belly, Spicy and Sweet Dumpling, and Coconut Shrimp Tempura.  We really enjoyed the pork belly side dish and the coconut shrimp tempura!  We didnt like the spicy and sweet dumplings so much we sent them back.    We then tackled the following rolls: Big easy, Sexy Lazy, Kiss of Fire , Sunny Special, Dragon, Fat Ass.  Our favorites were actually the sunny special (very fresh tasting and light!!) and the Fat Ass!!! Our least favorite was the Kiss of fire.  It was odd to have salsa on sushi - the salsa itself was great- just odd on this roll.    We also really liked the special - salmon nigiri.

TaMcmGxfOvLiLihvDgpRmw.text: Always delicious, great service, great food, I come over every month and they have rewards!! Free ayce on your 10th visit ! Great warm sake too!!

TgFcHtqntjfLHyAoy5WlLw.text: "All-you-can-eat sushi. What a wonderful thing. It's the perfect mix of sophisticated and sloppy. It combines cultures and styles in a weird way that forces you to reevaluate what you're doing." Lev Novak, ThoughtCatalog.com We tried a new place in Las Vegas for some AYCE sushi. I must admit that it wasn't bad! My favorite bites were the salmon belly, the uni, the sweet ebi, and the honey bread dessert at the end of our meal. I also got my beloved unagi which they didn't drench in too much sauce. Overall the quality was pretty average and I appreciated thst they didn't try to overload you with rice. Sushi Way is a cozy little eatery with lots to offer. The service is so-so and I had to remind our waitress a few times of forgotten items. While I'm not sure if I want to replace my other AYCE sushi place [which starts with a "G" and sounds like a Pokemon], it's definitely a contender!

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s the Boom Boom up front.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna with jalapeño on top, the salmon and salmon belly on the bottom.

KioetRWvI01Dko24wZneag.text: Came here due to the high number of good reviews & their menu options looked promising. Maybe we came in on a bad day but food wasn't up to expectations.   Starting with the nigiri - we first ordered eel nigiri. I absolutely love eel but it was drowning in eel sauce & eel tasted off. There was a lot of bones in eel which greatly detracts from the flavor. Salmon is my preferred fish but didn't even request a second order of salmon nigiri since the rice-to-fish ratio was so bad.  I ordered few of the no-rice rolls which were a no-go. When my "rock & roll" sushi came in (which is tuna , salmon , white fish , yellowtail & crab wrapped in cucumber) , the fish tasted frozen , there was waaaay too much crab (more crab than the actual tuna , etc.) & the cucumber was thick cut + orgasm sauce all on top tasted terrible. I didn't take a photo of mine but my "rock & roll" did not look like any of the photos other Yelpers have posted in the past which looked way better before.  We also ordered a few baked & deep fried rolls. It was hard finishing them even when we ordered half rolls. Did not taste as good as their descriptions sound.   I really wanted to enjoy the other menu items such as "salmon tar tare" in appetizers section & "volcano roll." The orange/yellow sauce + sriracha on top of salmon tar tare was not a good combination. "Volcano roll" (which is also part of their no-rice rolls) could've been decent since I love avocado but the spicy tuna + crab inside tasted pretty much almost frozen too.  Service was bit slow but I can't blame them since they seem short staffed - during lunch looks like only one waiter , one food runner/busser & two sushi chefs. AYCE prices same like any other place/competitors - about 22$ for lunch & 27$ for dinner. However , I'd suggest trying out other places :(

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey toast - skip
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel nigiri

lx3fe0ydebJb6PFeMBDWWw.text: Delicious. What it do baby. Good rice to fish ratios. You already know what it is. They got the fresh wasabi too. I know right. Like I said, you already know. It's gonna be good. Just go here.

LLXwxzSO9cXEto-ggUovAg.text: (Review based on 2.5 stars)  Sushi Way is located in the same plaza as Tacos & Beer (right next to it actually) with parking. My husband and I decided to try this place on our last night in Las Vegas, for dinner. We came in for an early dinner around 5:30 pm. When we first came in, no one greeted us. A server walking around saw us but did not greet us. We were just standing around and decided to just seat ourselves at the bar.   As we sat there, we just waited. Eventually my husband asked the guy behind the bar (Mike) if he could take our order. He said he can only take sushi orders but not for the kitchen. I just kind of thought he would assume that we were here for the all you can eat option (pretty much as everyone else when they come in here...). My husband asked if he would take our order after he said that...   Anyways, during the course of our meal, service was initially average and lacking. But eventually 2 other servers came out and took care of patrons, including ourselves. I appreciate their attentiveness. Also eventually that guy, Mike, left to do inventory and this other guy came and he took care of us.   Everything we had was good, except for the uni. It was not fresh and had that fishy smell. You do not want your seafood to have that smell, if it does, it indicates it isn't fresh.   If service was better, I would award this place higher, but because of the lack of service in the beginning and a little after, I have no choice but to give this place 2.5 stars.  If you like being ignored and not being acknowledged, come by here for sushi. And then when you are done eat somewhere else. Being that this is Sin City, the land of buffets and gluttony, I am sure there is a better place to eat at.  By the way, for 2 people for dinner (all you can eat option), it will cost you $58.35 (tax included).

-C5oUd8gDD5XUjU4yJUFiA.text: Wow! This spot is seriously one of the best sushi places we have come across here. All of the food was so fresh and flavorful. The staff was kind and super quick! There was no wait on a Friday at 7:30, which was awesome. Their fresh oysters are to die for, and the Sushi Solution roll was my favorite roll of the night. It's a far drive for us, but totally worth it! I definitely recommend this place, and we will be back soon!

d5F9sYJxolJfqX65X-wcLw.text: Now my new Vegas sushi place! Fish are fresh, portions are perfect ratio of fish to rice, traditional in preparation resulting in really great tasting sushi! BTW the price is right, try going AYCE!

QGiVHZPGqF9e5rXTf_pJAA.text: Date night with my hubby.  This place is a MA zing.  We certainly will be back. The menu is huge and all different with adorable names.

LMPPZl595jdW7vJLgRti2w.text: This place is awesome!  For a quick ride from the Strip, you can have all you can eat, really good sushi!  If this was on the Strip, you would spend over $1,000 for a meal like this.  The ambiance is a strip mall sushi place so lacking in atmosphere but makes up for it with the food and prices.

zl4eiakOHhi8Y6LmlmZhzQ.text: WOW what happened to this place??? Way to much rice. Some fish went down in Quality like the yellowtail & Tuna. They ran out of soy paper I asked for my Salmon Skin Sashimi. Guess what our waiter told us ???  Oh we can't do that. We have been here as regulars for over a year and if your told we can't accommodate you that means to me "Go Elsewhere & go Fuc.. Yourself. We won't be back.

ALBqoJIhAetbKz6CQpas8Q.text: 5/4/18 Been to 6 different kinds of AYCE Sushi restaurants and I can say that this is one of my top 3 places. My husband and I took my friend,  visiting from Seattle out to eat. Good choice yelpers!   I love their salmon belly nigiri and we all ordered the "one order" only per person. Everything I tasted was fresh.  My husband didn't like their uni (sea urchin), he said there was a different taste to it and he has develop an acquired taste to uni. Anyhow, so far this is the only AYCE restaurant that doesn't limit on desserts. If I knew I could have saved more of my appetite on desserts.   Well,  I'll be back for sure! Happy eats!

The only thing I have a complain with is they forget to bring you everything you ordered. They also forget to come back to the table and offer you refills on your refreshments.   That's about it.

qP77KZyLtEPIm8OILn8GEg.text: Wasn't expecting much but Sushi Way was pretty solid for a Las Vegas shopping center sushi spot.    Place was busy. XIKSE0CRsJvzEajQeQTTXA.text: Just arrived in Vegas tonight and wanted some sushi and found this place in Yelp.  The place is pretty nice inside and looks like your typical sushi place. aRGfMCFWJktVg7DvNSF_CA.text: Great AYCE!! Its not exactly on the strip but if you are willing to drive a bit this place is totally worth it!! I will be coming back when i come to Vegas!!!

GbJ12OR-o0LMMplv3Py-8g.text: They have uni in their ayce menu, and the sweet shrimp is very big and fresh.  Good deal!  I will def come back again for my next visit to vegas

o8rNa-btip8-FdcHhCdmEw.text: Note worthy with our first time at Sushi way though is that I liked the coconut shrimp tempura, fat ass, hamachi Kama, and honey bread dessert, basically a mini version of honey toast since thats new and un common for a dessert with sushi places.   Been to at least 5 other AYCE sushi place here in vegas and I would say Sushi way is 2nd to last... but don't get me wrong they are pretty okay though.   I'd rate the Food a 3.5 for the reason of they seem to be drowning with sauce and I did try and request for light sauce and still saucy for my preference but the customer service was great. For that Its 4star for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pbrrjNexgukt7e2XKFuvpA.text: Great sushi! They had fast delivery and variety to order. Dankdankdnakdnandkndandkandm

4EPPKMWLTnvd_ZSKKqLzKg.text: Meh. Well, I guess for being in the middle of the desert you could do worse when it comes to getting sushi.   I decided to order off the menu rather than go for all you can eat. Rolls were overpacked with rice and tiny pieces of fish.

u8A4LDrVVKHmF3crm4scng.text: A wonderful addition to the AYCE sushi scene in Vegas!  It's very conveniently located not far from the strip and not far from the convention center. The 3 of us came for lunch one afternoon to satisfy our sushi cravings! My friend was raving about this place, so I had to come and try it.   Prices $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner. Lunch does not include sweet shrimp, uni and some of the other expensive items. Minus 1 star. We started with a bunch of sushi items on the sushi list. The fish was incredibly fresh, and each one had a long piece of fish on top of a piece of rice. The fish wasn't thick but definitely larger than many of the other AYCE places. The super white tuna just melts in your mouth, so good! The scallop sushi was made with real scallops, the smaller ones and definitely very fresh also. We followed the sushi with a bunch of rolls, and each one was made well and tasted great!    Service was decent, I did have to ask for refilled a few times. Free soda with Yelp check-in which is awesome. Dessert options were good. The sweet toast with ice cream was yummy. Bathrooms were clean, parking was easy. Definitley recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sb4okytoySAyRXuNiQ6VGg.text: See my check-in. This is an AYCE sushi place that doesn't feel like it: They don't load up the rice so you are to stuffed on it and the fish is great quality. People are super super friendly. 5 stars for price and friendliness alone!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fo78XsExP4LObu0PtACdQA.text: Great prices, great sushi and Rodolfo is the BEST. Anytime I'm in vegas I'm visit him at Sushi Way! Order the SEX roll, it's literally sex in your mouth.

Kd4DIQpHWKF3_5qOjYvIdA.text: Great find! Almost paid twice as much on the strip. Glad we didn't. Great food, great service. I will be back.

BDVPBUriPjDkC7hBsC1tdg.text: We got in without a wait. Good, friendly service with tons of good sushi for a very fair price for Vegas.

WXxiaE4epla1Ymx4tdMu2g.text: I really like this place everything is always really good, but unfortunately they don't serve ayce salmon belly with the ayce special anymore, it's fucking heart breaking, I would have given 5  but I'm standing my ground

kV_zq79T_hXliV_qMFz5hg.text: First time here.  Skeptical from look of front entrance but got good reviews.  Walking distance from hotel.  I was very happy with my food and the atmosphere.  I suggest not even looking at the menu and just get the all-you-can-eat option for $27.  You'll easily double that as you can order from both sides of the menu.  Great service and fast food prep.  Fish was all very fresh.  Salmon was a bit tasteless but the sign of a good sushi place is the quality of their uni.  It was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4nBD0L3eMlnrixK6htSy2Q.text: Amazing food and amazing service for an amazing price!!  Very friendly staff and on top of it they make you feel like a person not a number or a dollar sign. It was my first time here but not my last! Will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE Sushi omg so delicious

eIqTkFv53B5O3NUc4amQCA.text: Food was not bad but it wasn't the best.   The waitress brought us the wrong food, twice and forgot three of our orders on separate occasions. We think she is new.  I didn't like the lighting. It was very yellowish. The seats were uncomfortable.   Could go to better sushi places for the same price.

jKtJIPLuFnf0tBBqHPgXfA.text: I love the all you can eat because the quality is fantastic and the price is right.  We went here 4 days in a row because we had a great meal every time.  Joy and Julia are both fantastic waitresses!!!

dLERgDL93DnBb3fBxa99-w.text: Can't get over how much I love this place. Sushi is fantastic, even better when they don't have a problem deep frying my bfs special order. Will always come back- don't forget to get yourself a punch card!

jJmMnVsAC5X1pqXjlc0VsA.text: Great price on the all you can eat and wide selection  Sushi was fresh and prepared prefect   Friendly staff Easy parking  Clean

RbB8DbvPyeq70kh791Ka6w.text: I went here last night with my girlfriend and her friend for the first time. We have been to many sushi places in town, but this one was not very good. I can accept a little slower service on a Friday night, it was between 7 and 8:30 for our visit. It did take time to get our orders, they completely forgot one of our orders, but the worst part was the food.   The sushi was warmer than it should have been. The baked green mussels were drenched in cheese, the rolls were very bland, the candy cane, a soft shell crab roll seemed to not have any crab. The jalapeno poppers were decent, but I suspect those were pre made.   Over all not a place we will be returning too.

KYMDqCriJWZXdHGiN-O1tA.text: This is my go to spot in Vegas. Amazing quality and price. What a value. Very nice staff. I come here on every trip and have always been pleased. Must try to garlic nigiri options!

qH4-jLhvG1QAw6CHDADLXQ.text: Sushi is amazing! My husband and I got the Philadelphia roll, crunch roll, salmon and yellowtail sushi. We got the all you can eat it was well worth it!

T2qEDw7ociC1qn2XglqfCQ.text: Great sushi place to eat...love their speedy service for an all you can eat place the fish quality is great...the waitress and chefs are great pleasant and just all around great place to eat...i just had to come back cuz i had a great experience the first time

fBo_47ZFEkQkEzX3kGvaeg.text: Chef Chu Chu was amazing , Richard was a great server. I and my boy had a great time there with all you can eat menu. Sushi was great and fish was so fresh. Sweet shrimp was amazing. Excellent service from Richard and Chef Chu Chu will bring us back there again.

_7WoXvgjLfwLYFGmtw5U3g.text: Supppppppeerrrrrr good! Me and my boyfriend came to try Sushi Way for the first time and it was better than expected. Our waiter Richard was awesome. We will definitely be coming back!

lWbYOoesKKO0ZCMLk6_odA.text: This place is great, Rodolfo gave us the best of attentions the food is great, fresh, the sushi nacho is wonderful, the rock and roll is amazing definitely a must.

dFb1jLfvSD1rcXzjgGlPNA.text: The sushi rolls where amazing and the service was great. The server we had was amazing, she was so funny and charismatic. The guy who I'm guessing was the owner or the manager was also very energetic and nice. We tried several rolls and none of them disappointed us. We also tried the mussels, which were AMAZING, one order had 6 of them which was great. We were really happy about it because the other places we've been, only serve two as an order. Overall our experience was beyond words.

Sy6P61BmcgMuA9XxhsZoDQ.text: Yummy food and creative rolls! Only wish the food came out faster. A little pricey too, but worth it in my opinion. Honey bread dessert was so good.

fz2c6PcNPQDjfhhuu-VQ0A.text: We must have come on an off night. It was just awful. They use cheap, low quality rice that's also cooked badly. I resorted to cooked food because I just couldn't eat the nigiri. The fish is fine though but sushi needs good rice, too. The handroll rice was a bit better. And they put this overly citrus-y ponzu (I realize ponzu has citrus in it but this thing is out of balance) on a lot of the nigiri which is just... why??

A7oUGc7ei-vuYPkx3Rq43g.text: Had one our best meals at Las Vegas for dinner at $26.95 per person.  Everything was super fresh and made to order.  Had three small toddler under 4 years old and was not charged.  Very good selection and varieties of raw and cooked food on the menu.  The Udon was very hot and tasty.  Great place.  Call for reservation is a must.  We came in early at 5:30 since here was two large parties in the evening.  Service is good as well.

37PgRdfzJrAsOfpm-CXSqg.text: Excellent service, sushi was fresh and made quickly. Definitely do the all you can eat so you can try more! Convenient hours (we can go late night) and close to everything without the expensive price tag that the major hotel restaurants have. I had a perfect experience!
