Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu side 1

7EZz7jMujVbatTaEWkA1OA.text: This was the BEST sushi I have ever had!!!! My husband and I LOVE sushi; we've been here twice now and whenever we visit Vegas this is on our Must Go To Eats!

axeZlYew4yEw9fYpZNTBlg.text: My wife and i came here on Saturday night for dinner. We both got the AYCE ($26.95 per person). The stand outs were the baked mussel (get like 3 orders of of these!), screaming orgasm (get like 2 orders of these!), and crispy rice with spicy tuna (my favorite!). My recommendation for rolls would be the sexy lazy, sweet 16, big easy, and yolo. And for dessert, we tried the honey bread and yuzu sorbet. The honey bread tasted good but it was nothing special. The yuzu sorbet was great bc it cleanses your palate from all the heavy flavored sushi that you just ate. Their service is great, very attentive and fast with your orders. My wife and I have been here twice already in 1 month so that says a lot about a sushi place. This place is up there in my top sushi restaurants here in Vegas.

WB-KPQGHJ6t7oN7Vv8nWPw.text: This place is pricey but i completely understand why! Everything is so tasty and fresh! I suggest the OYSTERS u can never ever ever go wrong with AYCE OYSTERS! Its sooooo GOOD! Doesnt have that fishy taste they wash it thoroughly! Friendly and veey welcoming atmosphere. our waitress Jane was delightful and very attentive to our needs! Y'all betta get over here and try this joint!

zjFpJWQDV3NqNpE2x8wBCQ.text: Love this place. Good portions and friendly staff. The menu has a good selection of nigiri, rolls, kitchen items, and desert. The chef didn't skimp on the fish on the nigiri like some all you can eat places. It is priced well since I've gone to places where I've eaten less and paid more. I loved this place so much I came back twice in three days!

LEcPQycLB9spKZhvvzuYXQ.text: This is one of the best sushi bar in town. Good food and friendly people.

81DJy85FNw1tNHOg5WJxeg.text: It was a great experience! It's not easy to find a good sushi place. Sushi way is my favorite place because the sushi  tastes really good, location is perfect, nice atmosphere, friendly staff and reasonable price.

R9Dqxzr4aqmg0J1jSKd9zA.text: The food was good. But very poor service on a weeknight. The restaurant was severely understaffed, there were only two servers in a restaurant with a 50-person capacity and one of them attempted to serve as a hostess. They lacked expediting skills as well. You're better off finding a restaurant with adequate service.

2Qg3tp8iEggXgzl0tEfF4g.text: This is not the place to go on your lunch break. There were two waitresses and two sushi chefs. We sat in a table. I think if maybe we sat at the bar, the service would have been a little faster? It was by far the longest lunch I ever had. The appetizers came out fairly fast, but our sushi took forever and a day. The sushi chefs were very slow. Everyone around us seemed to be wondering the same thing, where is the food?!  The decor is very simple. There was a TV but it wasn't playing anything. I think if that was on, it would have helped with my boredom while waiting for my food. I think they could improve the atmosphere with better decor considering this is close to the strip and the restaurants around this area are nice.  The sushi was ehhh. Nothing was extraordinary. Nothing I had to have more of. Some things were okay, some were not good. We went for lunch, but the lunch AYCE doesn't include some of the items I wanted, like sea urchin (uni) and fresh oysters so I paid the dinner price. I never eat sushi without having uni. This was by far the worse uni I've ever had. First off, it was a really small amount. Second off, it left a really bad bitter taste in your mouth, which means the uni was not fresh.  We were completely underwhelmed by this place. I don't understand why it's so highly rated. There's so many places out there and I would have to say this is my least favorite. We won't be back.o

CYt-f9qze-BeZbdh-ZTvqw.text: This is my first Yelp review. The service here is that miserable that I feel the need to share. On a tight schedule, our party of 8 showed up at 8:05 PM for an 8 PM reservation. We came to find a completely full restaurant and no host at the stand. When I could finally get the attention of a staff member, we were told a party had come in 5 mins before us claiming to be me and swiped our reservation. The restaurant was unwilling to move the party even though they had not placed any orders, and we were forced to wait. After 30 minutes of waiting, we were told again we couldn't be helped. We were never offered any compensation (discount, free drinks, etc) or even a simple apology for the inconvenience. The restaurant staff was unwilling to accept any blame for the incident and did 0 to alleviate the situation. We eventually were forced to leave hungry due to our tight schedule.   Although I live close, I will never return to this restaurant, and I will do my best to make sure no one I know goes there either.

ZB83g0TzLcwS_UBrRj0vwA.text: We took a nice walk away from the Strip and we are so glad we did. The only regret: our schedule didn't allow us to come back a second time. The food is creative, fresh and tasty, everything is included in the all you can eat menu and it's a better value than a la carte. The service was outstanding and attentive. Our bill came to be double but it was an oversights and the waiter promptly fixed it.

ylCjwCcVWhPww4XZOs3rKw.text: Fantastic place. First time here. My family and I will be back here without a doubt.  Sushi chef was friendly, FAST, and funny. All you can eat is the way to go- options are beyond any other all you can eat sushi menu.  For some reason our daughters teriyaki chicken took a while to come out, but don't let that stop you from trying this place.

sdZHOsbzstoI2FC-_Ydqag.text: Excellent sushi.  Great menu. Friendly accommodating people work there I highly recommend

eYJvYOBFVCSiB00vpJPW4g.text: I can't wait to go and eat here again . The best bag for your buck in Vegas! The food was awesome! A must try!

RM9icQRuSENX2Di1xqMbYQ.text: This place is quite hidden yet very good :) Recommend it :) the employees were very attentive to or needs and the food was very fresh and very good! The place is very well kept as well and very close to the usual places of hang out.

L81DOSuuZZvuka-sAZsT9g.text: The sushi was very fresh! I did the dinner all you can eat and by the time i was done, i was filled to the top!!!  The chef allows you to order any item on the menu. It was definitely worth the price.

_b658HpR4bwa3YqdiW8hpw.text: Got the AYCE dinner for 4 people. Everything was delicious. The service is fast and friendly. We were recommended a lot of good stuff from the menu. (Hint, if there's a star order it!) The desert is fantastic as well. For the price you'll be hard pressed to find a sushi place in or near Vegas that offers as much quantity and quality. Sushi Way is the only way.

fPZ_RnhEm9p2I3F7c9gtng.text: Very delicious!!!  Highly recommended. Fresh fish. Will definitely come back again :)

R1S_kNxmrFaLmUkCdgaxuQ.text: Best all you can eat sushi eva! Monica was a delightful waitress with some great recommendations. Can't beat the price, $21.95/person.

p2DnC1IOGDt4agYMD0cSdg.text: This restaurant was fantastic! Super great price and quick service! Budget friendly and the food was great :) We ordered the spicy tuna rolls and they were great

NlUA_WK_HvAY_0J5izg9Qw.text: Don't miss this if you love sushi. It has to be the best sushi value in Vegas. Great service and terrific food.

eYp_ilP4plTi9P_lbmhmSg.text: Like others, I am always wary of AYCE restaurants.  This one is not set up as a buffet rather you order items from the menu.  Unlike others, you can order as many items at one time as you want when they aren't busy.  The food was great and I prefer sushi over rolls.  They had many sushi choices so I wasn't limited in that way either.  They have cooked items for the not so adventurous.  The place is very small so going on off hours makes it more fun.

G9TU5NQCvSBU7odK-r3Y6A.text: After comparing other ayce sushi places to Doh's, this is my new favorite place.  Came here for lunch at about 12:15 on a Wednesday.  Only one sushi chef and several tables were occupied, so the wait for  your order was a few minutes.  Once the 2nd sushi chef arrived, everything went a lot faster.  Our waitress was very attentive and courteous.  Nigiri sushi tasted very fresh.  Cuts of fish were pretty big, while the rice was kept to a minimum.    We had a desert called honey bread, using Hawaiian sweet bread dinner rolls.  Shokudo in Hawaii uses something like Texas toast.  Similar in taste, just not quite as big.  Usually I walk out of an ayce sushi place feeling full and uncomfortable.  This time I felt satisfied and just right.  Very comfortable atmosphere.  Definitely will be back for my sushi cravings!

tgltE2XLDb5lT2lPm2PkIA.text: I went to this sushi place because of its high reviews. I have been to a ton of different sushi places in Vegas over the last 5 years and these reviews absolutely do my match up to what it should be rated. The food came out 1 plate at a time and took forever in between plates. The restaurant wasn't that busy and the food is subpar as well compared to many of the other options in the city. This place offers almost the exact same menu as Sakana. Sakana is top 2 of AYCE places in Vegas for sure. Unfortunately will never eat at Sushi Way again. Staff was nice though.

rMAIiZyDvFbBK4i8NyJpPQ.text: AYCE sushi sounds a little sketchy. But this place is every bit as good as typical sushi restaurants. I thought the sushi might be pre-made, but it's to order. There were a couple of rolls I ordered that came with crab but it was more of a crab 'salad' - I was a bit surprised but it was still very good. The wait can be a little long after you put in your order, but that's not atypical when you're eating sushi.  What would have been a 5 star review - if based on food and value - became a 4 star because of the service inaccuracy. We ordered twice and both times the server forgot to put in one of our rolls with the kitchen.

eIGzvNBIKXllYwDPkVfB8Q.text: This place is awesome! Gotta come check out Ivan and his skills! Will be coming back to Sushi Way very soon!

jBbK_59Z1xfGgLcSCPTjBg.text: Awesome place! Gave it a try and truly not disappointed! If you are unsure of where you should go... Try this new place! Derive ok.

Xb_anmXPMufOimdNt1rrfw.text: Great selection. Exceptional service. Near the strip. One of the best AYCE sushi spots in Vegas.

x4rP6UFc6BJB5JX9l7MpOw.text: Love this place..fast service. The fish is fresh and delicious especially the seared tuna and garlic yellowtail. Come around 5-6 there is no wait and great service. Write a review for a free travel chopstick. Con: more rice with nigri then other auce place

2Y315RKjLV1SRjo_XgttJQ.text: Not only was my service not the greatest, when I revived my avocado roll it came with salmon inside of it & my sushi roll was falling apart, I'm a regular sushi person and this place was not the a place that will be returning, I was also with a party of 6 others and no one as satisfied. The food just did not taste fresh.

Pv7PcanfYY1RaYRClBroyg.text: Called Saturday afternoon to make a reservation. The lady on the phone asked me how many people and what time. She then asked me to hold for a second after I answered her. I felt odd because she was one question away to complete my reservation (my name) but anyway. I eventually hanged up after 6 minutes of hold. I waited for 15 minutes to call again. Again, I was asked how many and what time and "hold a second". I was like again?? wth??!! Good that a second lady came to the phone and took my reservation this time.  Our waiter was nice enough but they are definitely short staffed. There were only 2 waitstaff on a Saturday night. We had hard times getting help for anything.  The food. It's not super bad per se as none of us got sick after. But for sure it's not 4 1/2 stars worth. The rice are a bit dry. The fish tasted obviously frozen and thawed. The rolls were lack of flavor. They are all so bland even with different sauces. One of the rolls we had was called "Burn your Ass" of something like that. It wasn't even spicy at all.   I had hot tea to start with. Since the service was so slow and I never got my tea refilled, I decided to order a soda. When the bill came, I was shocked to find out they charge $2.50 for hot tea. Mind you it's only some generic luke warm green tea. Well, the soda was also $2.50 which I expected. But generic green tea, which they were too busy to refill, for $2.50??   I suspected most of the good reviews are from out of towners. Most of the cities in the US do not have as many AYCE sushi restaurants as Vegas. With 90% of the sushi restaurants in Vegas are AYCE, we are spoiled and picky. I'll stick with my favorite Sushi Neko from now on.

1A15RWDfFvwzS9D0wPzPXg.text: This is still by far the best sushi joint in Vegas that I've found! The salmon nigiri is to die for, so worth it! Go, you won't regret it!

9_yEHeo2GE0kVXJxKYDz-Q.text: Excellent quality sushi for AYCE.  $20.95 lunch (1hr) and $26.95 dinner (90 min)  Make sure to try the garlic edamame with your AYCE Make sure to try the sorbet for dessert after the AYCE

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tar tare
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon avocado roll

IGgMIoq5sb4AlzqwyTwLtg.text: My brother & I went on a Saturday around 7:30 pm, & it was PACKED. Litterally no where to sit but at the sushi bar. I thought to myself that we were going to be neglected for sure. I was so wrong. Our server was very attentive. Since we sat at the bar, we placed our orders directly with the sushi chef, who was unexpectedly friendly & funny. We both had AYCE dinner for $27. The chef was very quick with each item that we ordered, and the rolls, though prepared fast, were delicious & neat, not overly ricey. My brother paid the bill, & he was so impressed that he left a $24 tip. It's a good thing I live on the other side of town or else I would be there about every other week. I did, however, leave with one of those food card things, with the 11th AYCE being free. Although not every other week, I do see myself driving to that side of town every now & again specifically for Sushi Way.

VUXmqZXMpO06T4G3v8epeg.text: Sushi Way is one of my favorite AYCE sushi restaurants! The screaming orgasm and coconut shrimp tempura are a must! I'm normally more of a sashimi and nigiri girl, but I always order the sexy lazy special, sweet 16, and go rebel (deep-fried) whenever I come here! I love all their coconut rolls. Their nigiri never disappoints me. The staff is great as well! Remember to look around for the chef specials that aren't on the menu.

f7jWe7ebxEaZBhIhRFbUjw.text: My family and I ate here today (Wednesday) for lunch (lunch special is $21.95 all you can eat, which ends at 4pm) and had an amazing experience. Richard S. was our server and he went above and beyond to make our family outing great. He attended to us, made my toddler niece feel special (brought her chopsticks with the grip, suggested kid friendly foods, and surprised her with treats like mochi ice cream and a Jolly Rancher candy), he recommend us rolls, was funny, and in every way exceeded our customer service experience. The food was beyond delicious and they are generous with the fish portions. On top of all this, they have unique rolls, deserts, and dishes, which were all superb and flavorful. This is now our favorite sushi spot! Which makes it even better they have a stamp card to treat you after your 10th stamp!  I love this place!  Special thank you to Richard S. for making us feel so special, we really appreciate your outstanding customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jd7EjN7vEL5JjJ6OfmXvIw.text: I like to try new AYCE places & this one did NOT disappoint! Found it on google/yelp which totally hit the spot. Good for kids not  busy for Saturday no wait time, very very clean. It's a bit small so the noise was a little loud but that didn't change my mind on the overall food + service which was great! Jane our server was AWESOME, funny & her make up was on point! Ahah  The sushi was SO GOOOOOD, I am obsessed with yellowtail lately and I've never seen or had garlic yellowtail which they have! I also got the Arizona Roll which was yellowtail loaded = A+++  The fresh oysters TASTED fresh unlike some other places   $26.95/adult & $14/3+ years old

N0AZrkSYsFEqNyMKGZPuSA.text: As soon as I walked, in my excitement for this place grew and grew! All you can eat: challenge accepted. Their menu was endless and their service was excellent. A great place to try new types of sushi.   Update: 2 years later and I still love it.

is0m7Nk0Mh5uHUQ3yM5wvw.text: New place just opened up a couple weeks ago. Closest sushi place near my office. Really happy that the sushi is good quality.   The Sex Bomb roll was delicious.   I will be assembling my crew and returning very soon. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Tar Tare
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I judge all sushi places on the freshness of their salmon nigiri. This place is top notch! Highly recommend!

oXGP4KERZQjbCbbdA2MVvg.text: What a nice and cozy place. I live nearby and always stop here on my way to work. Great place to come for a quick bite or even a date. Would recommend it for anyone who asks :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden philly

6yzRkzSBclx9SMUGb0aoKQ.text: Was looking for a sushi place for takeout to avoid eating at the hotels on the strip where I was staying. Drove further north to Sushi Way which I found through yelp. To my surprise all the sushi I ordered were very fresh even though yelp said it was an AYCE restaurant. The only complaint would be the slice of fish were a bit on the thin side. Coming from California we are use to a more generous slice. Solid 3.

dSBz_XMqn1Wc3Y89V8BBMQ.text: This place literally made me fall in love with sushi!! Great food selection and atmosphere :) Definitely recommend getting the all you can eat!!  You're gonna love this place!!

enCmbg1PL6NwaiyQMpYqSQ.text: When the boss in the all you can it sushi is Korean, it is always good to visit.

KQYlaJkRIuXhtYjAKniC_g.text: This is the best all you can eat sushi place! The staff is great and on top of when you need to order more food. Each time I have been here it has been with a group and the staff has been more than accommodating. Definitely will go back next time I'm in Vegas.

nVlrurvdTdgjbiG_d9uH9A.text: This is located where the old Firefly was. My husband bookmarked this place and we came after venturing to M&M world. We went on a weeknight around 730 and there were only a handful of people. It's hard to pass by if you do not know exactly where the place is, when I called to ask what shopping center the restaurant is located, the person who answered the phone seemed a bit confused lol. It's where Tacos & Beer is, if that makes it easier to find.  AYCE dinner was like $27 a person?! I thought the server was really nice (didn't catch HIS name though). Also I thought the restaurant was nice and clean. But, I have to say it's not better or worse than any other sushi restaurant, it's comparable to Goyemon, Osyhi, etc.  The one thing I have to rave about was the Sushi Nacho. Omg, YUM!!!!!!! That was the best thing they had. I would've ordered like 10 of those if I wasn't full from the other rolls. But honestly, I can't really remember the rolls being that great or special except for that one. Their Japanese lasagna was also good, they put a lot of cream cheese on it.  Fish seemed and tasted fresh.   If you're in the area, go check it out. I just wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.

VvvFz5e9R-RLqsUVjACZSQ.text: The best sushi deal in Vegas, for 26.95 you can get all you can eat dinner, which even includes sea urchins and oysters (1 order per person). Every thing we tried was amazing quality!!! Thank you Chief Robin, you're the best :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our amazing chief

9eNvlYwmZN7-0jFLqDSIFg.text: great tasting sushi, and good service. i would come back again.  Enjoy the company the service was great and the food even better

3lY9RTUTNpBWfhRArGjcJg.text: Now that they have a liquor license...time to update.  Couldn't believe Ploy was our waitress again! She rocked! This place once again did not disappoint! Ordered three poke's again! Was great to try all these different items. I absolutely loved it. Though I'm back in CA, I am craving going back. This place is unreal. Thanks again Ploy and Sushi Way!

oPRSLK3bJ5TgsF_fLeLOAw.text: Great atmosphere! "There's all you can eat sushi menu" which is great! Very good service

FqYQ6Ef4qh0D90ZcOmjqEQ.text: The food here is very good, the servers are nice and helpful! We get our food very quick, and will recommend to my friends! The dragon roll is really nice, the portion of the food is good, and the ingredients are fresh!

OWyqK7VfovZLxSXgGNkVvA.text: Place was fantastic. Extensive menu included in AYCE and lunch only limits a few items for ~$4 less. We were also allowed to order half rolls! We tried the Red Boy, Sex Bomb, Sushi Lover, Chicago Fire,  Go Rebel, Carrot Top, OMG, and DD rolls. We also had Seared Tuna and Fresh Water Eel Nigiri along with Coconut Shrimp Tempura and Bacon Scallop Skewers. Dessert selections are also included so we had the FBI(fried banana and ice cream) and Strawberry Mochi ice cream. Everything tasted fresh. I even enjoyed the iced tea. We got there right after they opened at 1130 and service did slow down a little once they started filling up(and it did fill up), but our server was great and we really had a great meal. The only downside I found is they have a no sharing rule. But, with half roles available, that was mitigated.

tJlRihv2Ung9Jkwn2fYqag.text: Delicious fresh fish, fast and friendly service. Will definitely come here again, best ayce I've ever had

fqn0OdUXJhPbn78wTJYCzw.text: This place was absolutely amazing!  It was worth every penny considering it's one set price for all you can eat sushi!  Our waiter was great and the bartender/chef was even more amazing!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone!

WGAOqQqMLynKyhYDxP6spQ.text: We had great food and Jane was a great server! Sushi was delicious! My husband had several sushi rolls and thought they were all delicious and my son tried teriyaki chicken and thought it was very tender.

yRa0rVErdYTwC2aa2fxtvw.text: Excellent .... Have the sex bomb... The big easy. Sexy lazy....pokey Tina salad...all winners!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R74b6NmAOa3RxAaaUHybHw.text: Awesome service and super extensive menu. Will definitely come back again. Food was very good and good quality!

uX7nnMRcvgHD2exXJf3qwQ.text: So to start off..I'm a HUGE ayce critic. (Lol) and this place....is AMAZING. FROM THE SERVICE DOWN TO THE TASTE! I honestly can't think of anything negative about this place. The atmosphere is perfect. What I love, is that this place offers half orders on all you can eat, and the service here is awesome! They're quick, polite, and always checking up on us in a timely manner. (SPECIAL THANKS TO JANE!! SHES AN AWESOME WAITRESS, PRETTY TOO FELLAS  lol) So far everything that ive ordered tastes WONDERFUL! FULL OF FLAVOR. NOTHING bland touched my toungue. I would definitely recommend this place to ANYONE. Dinner is a must tho, its 26.95 a person, but you can bet your ass that itS MUCH WORTH IT. My new "GO TO SPOT" FOR AYCE. i love it here! Thanks SUSHI WAY!! (And, they gave me free travel chopsticks!) Super sweet!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those chopsticks tho

prViRyzqkCtGvOwgMiiMCQ.text: Wanted some sushi in Vegas so I yelped this spot and went for it! The sushi was delicious and the service was excellent! This place is located a bit off the strip but was definitely some good sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

an0xS7lP8rh0beiABzZeJg.text: Worst sushi I ever tried. Ordered delivery, it came pretty quick but I can't eat it. Doesn't look and taste fresh. Very disappointed

rbyOa_g-VJazEQfQR4c-GQ.text: My daughter had to do a restaurant review for school, so we picked somewhere we have never been before. Sushi Way-   So glad she had the report to do.   The sushi here is fabulous, by far the best I've had had in years.  Try the green monster. Yes we are definitely going to drive from across town to eat here.   It's not far from the strip either for those out of towners to come here too.

Lf7MULgXsPq6GDETKhmanA.text: Not only was the food amazing, but the customer service is out of this world. Our server Jane, words cannot describe how amazing she was. Not only did she make sure everything was up to par, but she even chatted with us for a bit. She knew a lot about what we ordered and ever offered us alternatives that complimented our pallet.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best server ever!! #Jane #SushiWay

Ac-XvAwzmG6_AZuhR75ONQ.text: I was hesitant to really believe all the 4 & 5 star reviews for this venue as I've seen those types of reviews in the past where the venue did not live up to the hype. Well I have to say that Sushi Way really does live up to the 4-5 star reviews. Went in with a group if 10 people tonight with having made a reservation ahead of time. Table was all made up for us. The restaurant was not busy at all until toward the end of our meal which was about 2 hrs after we arrived. We all ordered the AYCE & ordered lots of things & I'd have to say that almost everything was fabulous. I didn't get pictures of everything we ordered but I'd have to say we had about 10-12 more items ordered than what you'll see in my photos. Some of the rolls are the same rolls from I Love Sushi which I thought was great because I love the Cherry Blossom just wished Sushi Way's version had the crunchy like I Love Sushi's Cherry Blossom does. Really loved the Salmon Tar Tare, tuna nigri, yellowtail & Rock & Roll roll.  From what I recall we ordered: Nigri: Tuna, Salmon, Super White Tuna, Yellowtail, Garlic Tuna, Ebi, Unagi,  Albacore, Seared Albacore, Octopus, Squid, Fresh Scallop, Uni,   Sides: Poki Tuna Salad, Screaming Orgasm, Shrimp Tempura, Coconut Shrimp Tempura, Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna, Sweet and Spicy Dumpling, Salmon Tar Tare, Calamari Tempura, Fresh Oyster, Baked Green Mussel, Sushi Nacho  Rolls: Spider Roll, Dancing Eel, James Bond, Cherry Blossom, Rock & Roll, Burning Your Stomach Roll, Mexican Roll, Candy Cane Roll, Lisa Hand Roll,  I Love My A Roll   Pros:  - Nigri was super fresh. Tuna was fabulous. We ordered about everything on the nigri list as well as serveral "side dishes" as they like to call the appetizers.   - Super friendly service & they were on top of service almost the whole evening until the end.   - Like the fact that you can order 1/2 orders on rolls all through meal & not just the last roll you eat.   - Allowed our group to have the 10% off locals discount for their Christmas special.  Cons:  - Table placed vertical to wall didn't leave enough room for 10 people to sit comfortably without bumping elbows. Wishing the table would have been placed parallel to the wall with three 4 seat top table tops.   - Shrimp heads were undesirable as they were over cooked & you could tell the oil was not hot enough when they were fried & oil tasted old.   - Oyster on the half shell seemed to have been pre-frozen. They just didn't taste fabulous. - Towards end of night it seems that our table was being ignored as 2 rolls had been forgotten that were ordered as well as desert for 2 people was forgotten & it took over 10 minutes to get it while everyone else had already eaten their desert.   Although the Cons list may look longer than the Pros list the cons will not deter me from coming back to Sushi Way. It's definitely on the "repeatable" list.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Nacho
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Shooter

SmQjZTzBGqFkOGI1sB5ZeQ.text: So good. Very close to the strip without strip prices. Great quality of fish and the taste is great. Lots of appetizer options to go with your ayce. Definitely the best sushi I have had in this area.

VPkwvfwyIHez7rxXoa6XLw.text: This is probably my most favorite sushi place to come to when I'm in Vegas. Great food, extra cozy atmosphere, helpful waiters/waitresses, and did I mention good selection of music. "Reminisce a time" . Last but not least ask for Jane!

OYb8Q60uG2PUJJADf52eew.text: If you don't want to wait for goyemon come here.  Quality is on point and the size of their nigiri is pretty perfect.  So close to giving this place 5 stars but the order time was just a bit slow but its ok the quality of the food makes up for it.

0RrvoyZ5VKGJo-HoCGz1Pg.text: I want to love this place; I really do. I absolutely love nigiri, so when someone tells me that there's an AYCE sushi place that serves fresh quality cuts, I come running. These tippers were right on the dart.   Perhaps it was just my experience in particular that was bad.   I came on a Wednesday, not quite yet during a rush period, but nearing.   I started with my usual orders: uni, salmon, tamago, yellowtail, you name it. Everything had a refreshing taste to it, top notch quality that was almost on par with Sushi Koma. I particularly thought that their sweet shrimp was the best I've seen in an AYCE so far.   I had a delightful time with the food but... not so much with the chefs.   They took a long time, and when I say long, I mean a REALLY LONG time. I'm usually not so picky about the wait since I know that I happen to order a lot at a time. However, after waiting for over 10 minutes before the rush hour even began, I was starting to get suspicious.   I timed them. 11 minutes, 14 minutes, a whopping 17 minutes. Even when my order just consisted of oysters, 13 minutes.  Perhaps making nigiri does take a long time, one by one, as my waitress assured me; however, in comparison to other sushi places in the valley, this is by far the slowest. Where is the competitiveness in that?   I watched the chefs. I literally had my eyes hawking at them with laser focus. They were talking, chit-chatting, laughing, having fun amongst themselves, and NOT working on my order.   Hm, maybe that's why.

ZqMGQqRfZqCYg8ClPf6M7Q.text: Great service, delicious fish and quick and attentive service. Everything you would expect and want when visiting an ayce sushi restaurant! We will be back!

nWFbQHgHXS5c3SpHXN-98Q.text: This is the best Sushi AYCE I have found in the Las Vegas strip area. The selection of sushi is epic for an AYCE place. Every type I had was well made and very tasty. The service was great also. Place is nice inside, easy to find and very clean.

NsE3Mp3yOukJhOUPvQW7-w.text: Up for a challenge?!  You will be challenged to try EVERYTHING on the menu...oh and did I mention it's all you can eat?  Oh yeah!!! AYCE!   To start please order a refreshing beverage - Japanese beer, cold and flavored sakes and soft drinks for your designated drivers (yes, children, do not drink and drive).  Then once your thirst has been quenched, plan ahead and pace yourself: I would recommend the sushi nachos (2-pieces per order) and seafood bounty generously piled on two crispy fried won ton chip (it's the nacho part of the dish) which perfectly pairs with the freshest morsels of seafood goodness, peppered with minced jalapenos for an extra kick.  You can then open the floodgates of sushi heaven - there are over 50 different type of rolls -fresh rolls, soft shell crab rolls, shrimp tempura rolls, baked rolls and deep-fried rolls.  By the way this was only the first side of the menu!  Flip it over then you will be wooed to try traditional nigiri sushi, vegetable rolls, an assortment of side dishes, soups and salad!  Are we food drunk yet?!  Not quite...please, please reserve your second stomach for the desserts!  Mochi ice cream, green tea ice cream, Yuzu (Japanese citrus) sorbet (my favorite!), tempura ice cream and honey toast!  Whew!   Bottom line my fellow Yelpers, there is something for everyone!  Just make your way to Sushi Way on 3900 Paradise Road, Suite B...and you'll be in paradise for sure!

LYk-wZMsrcXxyu2S4nWUPQ.text: Highest quality fish & seafood out of any Vegas AYCE Sushi joints I've been to, including yama, sakana, twister, goyemon, and kaya. Super fast service. The Salmon Tare Tare is delicious. Sushi Nacho is killer. All nigiri is of the highest quality/freshness. Large selection of flavored japanese sake and beer. Order the "sake cooler." Also has great lunch specials if you are on the go. New favorite sushi place. Free wifi. Don't forget to ask for a stamp card!!

P14X4Mdf9b_S-k_UEBZRLA.text: Ordered from here for lunch today.  Got super white tuna, miso, seared tuna, seaweed salad and fat ass roll. They gave me NO wasabi and no utensils, and no napkins. The food was GROSS. Inedible. I only ended up eating the miso. Everything else was too foul smelling and disgusting. Waste of money. Won't be back.

21SRVwDB9yfjGJuCgTSwpg.text: Stopped by here while on vacation and I'm so glad I did! A+ quality sushi, and the chefs at the bar were very friendly. Everything I had I was satisfied with: mackerel nigiri, salmon hand roll, and their caterpillar roll. Definitely would come back if I could.

7qMVn2RUrCOmfHXDJjMVrA.text: High quality all you can eat. Fresh fish tuna salmon yellow I love it and I will come back again for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All fresh fish!!! Tuna and salmon always the best also super white tuna yellow tail and uni so yummy

5jkyul7Mqwxz_B2GpN1G7Q.text: The food was great and the sushi chef was friendly and did a great job with presentation. Had some sushi and a few rolls with hot saki. Tasted great. The volcano roll had a milder taste than expected. But without comparing it to any other place, still a good roll. The place had a clean and comfortable feel. Would have been 5 stars had the waitress not forgotten to put our order in for an hour. Sushi chef more than made up for it!

bEjy6GEw8eNtMXSooDlDVQ.text: Thrilled we tried this place before we left Vegas. We come in often for conventions and will be back for sure. The fish is fresh, beautiful and tasty. Place is clean, including bathroom.  We sat down around 5:20 p.m. and service was lacking with only one waiter. 20 minutes in and more staff showed up and service became good.  Will be back!!

HKX_8a3pH2SuLQ1HmSJ4sA.text: First time here and I am very impressed.  Everything is very good . Highly recommend. Customer service was amazing. Food fresh and delicious.

HeM8fwaoYNk5ZzsH_yuTug.text: Food was good the rolls were fresh i guess their left over policy can be broken if you talk to Richard great server may be owner he made nite a pleasureble one would recommend thanks Richard great service

vCpqYdvzWjiOrrS4UXoDdw.text: Awesome awesome place!  I am a vegetarian, they had so many options for me as well. So many choices. Great friendly staff. Definitely will be back.

OUQIhgZKTtnXlTKFE9a3CQ.text: This place is amazing! My girlfriend and I made a last minute trip to Vegas and were looking for a good sushi joint. This place easily goes toe to toe with sushi samba. We sat at the bar and got excellent service from Ivan - the 22yr old sushi chef wonder. I can't wait to come back to this joint next time I'm in Vegas!

yNxQSltp3L_4gWaAtySd_w.text: Yes I agree with the other yelpers... well worth it if you do the AYCE, but we opted for the bento boxes, which were complete with the usual meat, sushi + tempura. Service was great, maybe because we were the only few there on a Friday night, wait, did I just say that? Open til 2am, so we barely made it before the crowd started pouring in. Still fairly new, so hopefully their quality stays the same once the word gets out =P

3vZPPhoeGLYVO3hTEoNR-Q.text: I like searching for hot and new spots on yelp and stumbled upon Sushi Way, with 4.5 stars, it was a no brainer to come here. My wife and I came here during lunch, it was not busy so we were seated at the bar very quickly. The service was friendly but forgetful. Apps we ordered did not come out when first ordered. Now for the main event unfortunately the sushi, pretty much all of the rolls we ordered were bland, no flavor, no taste. It was weird, nigiri was good but still did not hit the spot. Probably will not come here again but we'll see.

HltX8ZIMUiro8V1P8j00Bw.text: Food is decent but service is very very slow. We ordered items and never got them. Some can out 30 minutes later. Some didn't come out at all. When we asked about them the waiter totally had forgotten about them. She kept saying I'm sorry and blaming the cooks. Sad thing about it is the place isn't really busy. As I sit hear typing this review I am still waiting on my order. Waiter came by and ask if I want ice cream yet I haven't gotten my prior order of shrimp tempura ordered 15 minutes ago. What a joke. Never again. Don't come here if your hungry because that's how you will leave. Slow and poor service.

vhkMTSxdKv34U2UoseM-EQ.text: Great food and very friendly service. Very little rice in the rolls which is rare for such an extensive AYCE menu. We have found our new favorite sushi spot in Vegas!

3vVKs21t7xG9t4dfSBtl8A.text: Overall good. Food came super quick. Service was good. All the waitresses were very nice. We came before 7pm on Saturday and it was almost empty. The only thing was oyster was not fresh enough.

4KD-uDIh9k_QJdiqjCiJew.text: Great food and service. I would recommend this place to anyone and know they will thoroughly enjoy their time here in sushi way. The fish is also very fresh! Best sushi experience in Vegas hands down!

zP2InQgggmU9wBN47XJb1g.text: Amazing rolls for AYCE sushi.  Very wide variety of any rolls you can imagine.  Along with fast and friendly service!  If you leave this place hungry you are doing it wrong.

96dLtsWrhcdGgq2bWka3Kw.text: Wow! Incredible sushi!! I don't usually eat AYCE but this place was on good recommendation. They were totally accommodating to my no rice rule. They have cucumber wrapped rolls and a $24 sashimi plate that I could not finish! I highly recommend it.

2uFMdZt_PY6jBQeZEXEAkw.text: The best AYCE in town. I am a huge fan about ayce, i tried a lot but this one is completely different . It s more like a fine sushi place , the quality is definitely here. i tried so many dish , i will not able to do the list but a few are very remarquable : the cherry blossom is a peace of art and the sexy lazy special is very tasty and orignal ( if you like coconut).The service is very fast , that is not always common in a usual acye sushi.

Jk50mflft-7LKs71aBxzwg.text: Awesome.. Food is always fresh. The staff is super friendly.. The place is always super clean.. :).. Best spot for all you can eat close to the strip..

dNRVpWwAxmBeJg7DXOn2Qw.text: I was craving sushi and needed a restaurant located halfway between the two of us, and Sushi Way was the ideal destination. Easily accessible and great reviews for their AYCE lunch. The menu was extensive and had numerous unfamiliar concoctions that appeared worthy to try. We certainly weren't let down as all were excellent in both presentations and taste. Ratio of rice to protein was good, and they even had rolls that were without rice like the exquisite "Cherry Blossom." Service was good (for the most part).  I would definitely go here again. One of the better AYCE joints in town.

fhprne9ksxJqnRBrFg-5vA.text: I just back from this AYCE sushi resturant. The resturant was dark and seating was average in comparison to other sushi resturant. I did notice that there weren't any seatings for 2. Not a big deal but if you come with just one other person expect to have 2 empty seats next to you. (Kinda kills the romantic vibe). I came in during a slow time so I'm not sure how busy it gets but the store was basically empty for most of the time. There is also a bar where you can watch the chef crate the sushi right in front of you. WHAT! Pretty cool. We didn't sit there though we just sat at a table. There was only one waiter while we were there but another showed up as we left. The waiter that helped us was very attentive without being intrusive. It was a little hard to understand him but that wasn't a big deal. He was very nice.  The food. Only have one word for it... amazing. (The 5 stars probably killed the suspense of that but whatever). We had a lot of sushi rolls. Probably around 10. Needless to say we were pretty stuffed after we left. They were all good. Some better than others. The only one that I didn't particularly enjoy was the fat ass. They don't call it that for no reason. It was huge! However it did taste a little bland compared to the other rolls. It was still good though... I don't eat spicy food. Like at all and I was disappointed to see most of the menu items had some sort of spicy ingredient. I was a little turned off when I saw that the sushi I ordered had jalapenos... until I tasted it. FREAKING AMAZING! The spiciness wasn't overwhelming at all. It added a small zesty taste to the sushi. Coming from a person that hates spicy food. It was the best thing I have ever tasted with jalapenos on it. They do offer a fairly small desert menu. I got the green tea ice cream. It was good as expected. They offer one desert per person if you get the ayce deal.  They do have a few rules that actually didn't bother us at all. A common rule in most ayce sushi resturant is that if you don't finish the roll then you have to pay full price for it. This is the norm so it didn't really bother us. Also we saw that there was an hour time limit to eat on the menu. However it was slow and they didn't really hold us to that. I imagine during more busy time of day they might be more strict on this rule.  Decor average and no two table seatings 4 stars      Add seatings for 2 and this will immediately jump to a five. They probably won't though because the resturant was a little small.  Service attentive without being intrusive 5 stars  Food amazing 5 stars  If you haven't been here. Definitely check it out. They gave us a coupon for free meal on our 11th visit. We will definitely be back and are looking forward to our future free meal and many more to come!

htDJOhvDk7caWgbV_UJfLQ.text: Excellent and prompt service, very friendly - I love that!  Food was excellent... I ordered the seaweed salad, a spicy tuna roll and salmon sushi. Also a 'Sake Cooler' - mango flavored, which was delicious!

Zp475TfqfufwAY2GZ7YkMg.text: The food was kind of good...But the service was very very bad...There were seats there, but the server just asked us to wait. After like twenty minutes we finally got seated, but no server came to ask for an order and didn't even bring water to us until we asked some guy 10 minutes later...When we asked an Asian server for the dishwares(yes they just gave us two sets, we have five guys), he just said what's up and ignored that...So rude...

46CIKjmM9xes5v3G1gIARg.text: We spent 12 days in Vegas for business, and this was our go-to place. Several days we ate both lunch and dinner there. Great value, very fresh, excellent service. Thank you, Jane!

GNJ0f0ezBcctustLKCKYpg.text: From out of town but this place was amazing and the staff was very friendly too!! Can't wait till I am back in Vegas to come back here!

1Ge_avK0-0B4jtY2KVJ5ng.text: We did not have a good server but the place is good. Food quality trumped server's attitude.

Vuayp22PlHYD8jpWV90Ipw.text: I just ate there tonight and the other positive reviews are on target.  I dont' give out 5 star reviews often but this place deserves it.  This is not like other All you can Eat Sushi places where they give you lots of rice and small pieces of fish.  Each dish is prepared with a noticeable attention to detail that is normally reserved for high-end Sushi Bars.  I opted for Chef's Choice tonight and i was not dissaponted.  The Chef brought me some very good Sushi dishes that I would never have thought of ordering on my own.  Some of the other reviews have complained about slow service.  I can see where some impatient people would say that but remember this is not a buffet and it is not fast food.  Quality and attentions to detail does take a little longer.  So relax, enjoy the company you came with and enjoy some excellent Sushi.  I will be back and I will be bringing firends.

RYPkeOAHPaYlGGiU-ZDTMA.text: Luckily we found this gem next to our hotel room. All you can eat sushi for $21. The sushi was delicious. The sushi nachos is a must try. It's pretty much poke on a tostada. Our drinks stayed full while we were there. As soon as the waitress saw we were running low she filled us right up. Great atmosphere and great food. If I'm ever in vegas again i will be coming here for sure!!

I0OHolNZ07N0QhV_dwfMqw.text: New spot I found on Yelp and decided to try out with my friend.  The AYCE menu is quite extensive and there only about 10 items that are limited to just a single order per person while the rest of the menu is unlimited.  The only reason why I have deducted a star is that when it gets really busy here, the wait times for your sushi will be LONG.  We nearly waited 30 minutes just to get a few rolls and some sashimi.  They also have a time limit but I am not sure if it is enforced since everyone is waiting for their orders.  To their credit though, the food is delicious and the service is friendly.  Not sure I would be back though due to the long waits.

cavFtGx_Hc9orSrzD_pd9A.text: The variety of rolls and appetizers are endless here. Waiter was pretty attentive even though it's busy. Sushi chef was very nice and polite; super plus! The rolls are amazing here. The spice was right, no need for soy sauce. Shrimp tempura was kind of rough; the batter taste like McDonald chicken nuggets. All and all it was a good experience.

jkKa6pIICjjv886fiFbuTw.text: Aaaaaamazing! I'm a Vegas local and this is the spot good prices great sushi awesome staff!!!

BscconoklBYUC7DYz45agg.text: Went to Sushi Way last night for the first last night and am so glad I did.  Everything was fresh and tasty, the menu was overwelming even to a veteren ayce sushi diner.  So many rolls sounded so good I wish I could have tried more, but I did manage to try the Big Easy, sweet 16, spider roll, hamichi, salmon belly and super white tuna with jalapeno(chef special that day).  The list of appetizers was extensive as well.  The bacon wrapped scallops and kamakazi dynamite were recommended by our chef/owner, who was very friendly and was ready and willing to keep our sushi flowing.  I live in Reno and only get down to Vegas 4 to 5 times a year,  I cant wait to come back and try some more menu items.  I highly recommend having dinner here SO GOOD!

MC27FuvqErQV_TxFxe2jiw.text: This place is on point in every way! Fresh sushi, amazing flavours, and great service (thanks Ploy & Jane). A definite must if you're in the area!

0rnjHTV2PXukiIPiEwbdlw.text: just opened, great sushi! great service! recommend the" hot n juicy", "carrot top " , and spicy edamame, ..Sake Bomb!  well it's been about 12 things tried so far and everything has been awesome , n in picky sushi eater, I never do all you can eat but this will be a repeat for sure , gets a 5

KTft5radRXLVXxdUCR5FUg.text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The All You Can Eat menu is a rediculiously good value because it includes the entire menu. I ate about $50 worth of food for $26. The chefs really know what they are doing and you can tell that they love their jobs. Extremely fast service too. It was moderately busy the night we went. We got our rolls in less than 5 minutes each time we ordered. I HIGHLY recommend this place if you are out in Vegas. It is on par with the high end sushi restaurants out here.

M1xh7mKG9Rk2Jy3hjliK7Q.text: I'm a pretentious foodie that is very hypercritical and 5 stars is almost unheard of from me. All you can eat for under $30 ???? Must be crap right?...Wrong! Good quality saki, great vibe and sushi rocks. Be patient and not overwhelmed when ordering , the menu can overwhelm you . I've never been to a sushi bar in my life with better value.

mwb4IzNlB79-FUgCx2ZGMg.text: Came here for a work conference. For the price best sushi I have had. And awesome service

lTwR8_XDp3XFjbxtQx8Uuw.text: was looking for a good sushi place off the strip not over price and with goood sushi!! omgg best place ever!!! the all u can eat was worth ur money so fresh so good !!! its a must!!!

E5dMlcEO4riRa75nkWYZUA.text: First time here and completely pleased.  More of an intimate place. The food was great.  The service was great.  It's open late til 2am so it's great for people who work on the strip or are staying nearby.  They also offer a stamp card for locals and after your 10th visit you get one free. I will be back!

dWAMl9mBjk-UDzsL2xYOLg.text: Not a big sushi eater at all but "Stephanie" told me what she likes to have, I took her word for it and I was really happy, thanks a lot "jane" lol

s5Cfzafroa5LTI6JsLsPEg.text: Good, but not great. There are better ayce sushi joints around. Most popular items are limited to one per person, including dessert. I've tried a lot of menu items here. A few are tasty like their galbi and super white tuna special. But most of their rolls are forgettable and too similar, their screaming orgasm lacks complexity and their salmon tar tare is bland and just too much (it's a meal in itself). Mochi ice cream was bland, plus they need more variety. Service was very friendly and helpful.  They treat you good here, and the food isn't bad, but there's much better ayce in the area.

W_T3x6Xr912KBY_fEx3uWQ.text: Sushi way is my favorite spot for Sushi..everything is very fresh..I've tried half the menu and I've liked everything so far...my favorites,,screaming orgasm..shrimp lovers..when I was pregnant I craved their sushi more than anything..it's that good!!..but of course I couldn't..I just had my baby..and can't wait to go in and have some Sushi...see you soon...

HG2s_anvnkB1SFQmglDqgA.text: Best sushi I had in my life. I'm from Jersey but this place makes want to come back to vegas just to eat this place again. Exceeded all my expectations. Interior is not like wow but the food is unreal. Combinations of ingredients send your taste buds into cloud nine. I can't believe this place could get anything other than a five.

Lbyz1Y5kxBm-URhp1bxe-A.text: Outstanding sushi and service! Great atmosphere and relaxing spot off the strip, quick walk from Las Vegas Blvd. And the prices are amazing!!   Will be back on every visit to Las Vegas. I would give 6 Stars if I could!!

pTYWDt49XL-IWqrEvke7SQ.text: Great experience. Came in 5:30pm on a Thursday, no one else here. My friend and I consumed an outrageous amount of great tasting sushi. All you can eat only made it better. Best deal in Vegas!  Alaska roll  Arizona roll Rainbow roll Kiss o Fire roll  10 salmon nigiri 8 tuna nigiri 4 yellowtail nigiri 4 fatty yellowtail nigiri (melt in your mouth) 2 unagi nigiri   I have to say I wasn't a fan of the Kiss of Fire roll but it was me, not the roll. Will definitely be back next time I'm visiting Vegas.

0evK0_l4D65xVHbEC4uzxQ.text: Great environment and nice waitress :) the baked salmon roll is the best! Definitely worth my trip!   Lunch 21.95 Dinner 26.95

uBYRd8k_9iz5eKYvTkZnkQ.text: Sushi was very tasty!!! The fresh oysters were so clean tasting with their ponzu sauce.  Great service and can't beat the price for the All you can eat menu.  Will definitely come back again!

IjBkH8CHvz2zj3y6nl05dg.text: Customer service is amazing and the food is even better 11/10 would come again. We sat at the bar and was given delicious fresh super white tuna topped with jalapeno  over and over. The spicy garlic edamame was amazing too. Definitely worth doing the AYCE. Verokon and Brian were awesome!

kOFqt8PzIMwHIAOMTvhvmA.text: If I could give more stars, I would. Staff is so friendly, our sushi chef "Choo choo" was a hoot! He made us incredibly delicious rolls and kept us laughing the entire night. From California on vacation, but frequent vegas vacationers. DEFINITELY WILL BE BACK!!! The fish is so fresh, this might beat home (ironically, we live at the beach, who knew!) Love sushi way!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And the creative rolls, try the rock and roll! No rice, wrapped in cucumber. Yummmmmy!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu selection

VCvA6TKuj_35EmF4WDPk3A.text: Bada$$ sushi spot close to the Mariott. Dameon and Ploy did an awesome job. Great sushi variations and appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dameon Special

QSqFolqhcICDrl1NWLsDzg.text: I was super excited to try this place. I'm always looking for new AYCE sushi restaurants and usually Yelp doesn't let me down. However, I was disappointed tonight.   The service - Our server was training a new person. Both of them were nice, but about halfway through the meal our server let the trainee take over and she didn't seem to have any idea about the menu, which roll was which, or even basic sushi terminology. Also, at one point the sushi chef told our server to not let us order more until we were finished with what was on the table... Since I don't really like sushi rolls, and I had finished all the nigiri I ordered, I had to wait until my 3 other dinning companions had finished their rolls. I've never experienced that before.   The food - Very underwhelming. We started with some apps... The mussels were okay, nothing special, and had way too much eel sauce. The salmon tartare was super bland, but the nachos were flavorful. The hamachi kama was over cooked, but the portion size was good. Tempura was just ok, too. The best one was the poke, it was spicy and full of flavor, but when we ordered a second one it wasn't spicy at all. They were like two completely different dishes. All of the rice was super mushy. I tried to order a spicy scallop hand roll but they wouldn't make it for me. They gave me a yum yum scallop roll instead, that had absolutely no flavor. I can't really speak to the rolls, but as we were leaving, one of my friends said he wouldn't go back because he wasn't impressed with the rolls he had.   Overall, it was such a disappointing experience. We'll be sticking to Sushi Mon or Goyemon for our late night AYCE sushi fix.

o_HnwI4aMkMnAv49tKR2mA.text: On a Friday evening we got seats at the bar right away.  Our waitress was fast and helpful the whole night.  Our chef was great and was on top of our orders right away.  The green mussels were so good.  The chef even recommended certain things based on what we liked, which was cool.  The sushi was really good, but not the best I've had which is the only reason it's not a 5.  Will definitely be back though.

Ii8-326LzeH-lIBcHzqeXA.text: Just stumbled upon this place when we were craving for ayce sushi! Food is fresh, service is fast. I just wished it wasnt as dim but hey thats the only complaint for me. Definitely a spot ill add to my must eats in vegas!

f5JlbyeAM8-Eb2UK1W4P1w.text: Wow, we come here at least once every two weeks. The sushi is extremely fresh and their extended menu which includes fried rice, gyoza, salmon wrapped in bacon, galbi, screaming orgasm and at least 20 other dishes by far makes it the best AYCE sushi in Vegas. It is $21.95 for lunch and $26.95 for dinner and they always have amazing specials. I just tried the Salmon Kama which is a fried half of fish is incredibly good!!!!! I highly recommend you give this place a try it is centrally located and 2 min drive from the strip by car of 7-10 min walking.

sxqrKXCv15-PNibCZBmdgA.text: Great service, great food! All you can eat sushi is very reasonably priced at 21.95 before 3PM, and with over ONE HUNDRED items on the AYCE menu, this place is a steal. Fresh fish, good rice, and everything else you might need to fill your sushi craving!

oZs-vFnx7Zc_HHhjcbtsdg.text: Had dinner here last night with a few friends and it was lovely. The service was a little scattered (we had 3 separate servers take various parts of our AYCE order, ad several others drop off and clear the table, a few dishes and rolls had be be asked for several times and there was a bit of confusion on who ordered what) but every bite of the food was fantastic.  Will 100% be going back again......and soon too!!

6GX-d-lOUQx1zjnkCNB2XQ.text: Coming from Cali this place was fucking awesoooooooome! Highly recommend. So everytime you come to Vegas, this is the spot. All you can eat sushi. Great service, friendly service. Found it on Yelp and we decided to try and believe me well worth it. The price, great prices, compare the all you can eat sushi. Well worth it. You have to stop by and you will see. You won't be disappointed.

7gkMfrbWKe0HJYB4D__9Lw.text: Amazing is an understatement and close by the convention center make this the new best sushi in Las Vegas.  Even if it were not AYCE, I would still come here!  Here's my recommendations:  #1 Salmon Belly nigiri tied with Hamachi nigiri #2 Wasabi Tobiko #3 Super White Tuna with jalapeno (sashimi)  This is the type of place that when it gets really popular (been open for 9 months), you'll have to get here early (6PM).  Their Salmon belly is actually better than any Chu-toro or O-toro at the higher end places and a fraction of the price.  Wonderful!!!

8-rza5TWqyfwv-tHLdYE_Q.text: Chef Specials: Super white tuna sashimi w/ jalapeno - fish was fresh and the mixture of sauce and jalapeno was good. It wasn't salty at all. Wasabi tobiko - I actually liked it. Tasted fresh and different than most things I eat at sushi spots.  Appetizers: Screaming Orgasm - This was ok. The fish was different than say sushimon. Fresh oyster - it was fresh and good Coconut shrimp tempura - I loved it.  It was flavorful :)  Rolls: I love my ass - good Snow White - good Jack Rabbit - good  Nigiri: Salmon Roe - average. Same quality you would find in most restaraunts at their level Garlic Tuna - it was fresh. Didn't really care for the salt or spice they out on top of it. Salmon - kinda tasted like Scottish salmon. It melted in my mouth!  Yellowtail - it was average Fresh scallop - it was average Sweet shrimp - it was average  The tempura ice cream was the same like you would get at most spots.  My son said the honey bread was ok.  Will I come back? Maybe. This is out of the way for me because I live near Mountains Edge. There's other spots around the area that I can eat at.   The service was ok. Felt like they could've done better. I did receive excellent service from Jay. The lady that waited are table first didn't talk too much but she was nice enough to give my baby girl a lollipop to stop her from crying.

aYPVqosm_6pF7qS6r_N9nQ.text: Sushi Way is the place to go not only for AYCE.. Also for Combo Specials (ask server for menu.) Prices are very reasonable! Pick your Combo Special it is served in a Bento Box with Miso Soup & Salad! Very Delicious! Gotta try!

8UqjMEtGr0p4Z3GuryFk8g.text: If I could choose "minus stars," I would.  My customer chose Sushi Way for dinner & I was pretty much horrified by what we were served.  I couldn't eat it.  I was worried about food-born illness.  Their specials were room temperature and tasted bad.  The presentation was sloppy and the sushi nachos difficult to eat.  My tempura shrimp was undercooked.  We ordered at least 10 items and were disappointed with everything.  I left hungry but paid the bill ($30+) for each of us. I was worried I'd never eat sushi again (I typically love it), but was redeemed in South San Francisco with a delicious lunch this week.  I wouldn't let my dog eat @ Sushi Way.  How they get good reviews on Yelp is beyond me.

ZuW06qIFPPVlBwPG9ePwgQ.text: Food was pretty good but the vibe wasn't awesome by any means and it didn't help that the table server was in a very foul mood.  You could feel the unhappy coming off of her; I know what it is like to have a bad day and it's ok to not be super friendly but it not OK to walk around mopey and slow without a care in the world about your job and the customers there. She was not welcoming in any way and took forever to even get us water, then completely forgot my green tea; I didn't bother asking again.   HOWEVER I was bummed at first because the AYCE  lunch didn't include some things on the menu that my other usual AYCE sushi spots do, such as my favorite: screaming orgasm! The sushi chefs behind the bar were great (one was possibly the owner) and made me a screaming O even though it wasn't offered. The chefs were very nice and quick to get us all the sushi we wanted so that made up for the negative energy emitting off of the server.   Over all Sushi Way is not a bad spot; very clean and comfortable. Service and vibe is very important to me so I am not sure if I will go back any time soon but I am not against going back either.

bPdJ2jy3_0GYqZeD4i2ueA.text: This place is amazing . I'm a picky eater and this place blew me away. The sushi is fresh and flavorful. The green muscles are my favorite and the scallops not to mention the bacon wrapped scallops. The service is excellent..

agrXsSLQj6KQxsPRLb-30Q.text: Lunch is only $21.95 and dinner for $26.95. We came here for lunch but you can opt for the dinner menu option with the uni, sweet ebi, galbi and fresh oyster. Our server was Monica and she was super sweet and wonderful!Really enjoyed dining here because of Monica and the food was great for AYCE. The garlic yellowtail was our favorite and Hot & Juicy. Yummmmmsss! I would definitely come here again! :)

JI48nVcVWkppOb0WnM64oQ.text: Awesome!   Everything was extremely fresh.  All the sashimi and nigiri sushi was very tender.  They don't try to fill you up with too much rice when they make the sushi.  We didn't think the oysters were very fresh though.  We especially enjoyed the salmon belly, white tuna w jalapeno, yellow tail, sweet shrimp and coconut shrimp tempura.  The menu has a huge selection.  The ice creams were rich and creamy. I personally really liked the fried banana w vanilla ice cream the best.  The A.Y.C.E. option was definitely worth the price!  We will be back!!

94WtRI5x3ovsEM99aoqciQ.text: Love love love this place. In from dallas, and found this place via yelp. Our waitress Grace lived up to her name with the remarkable service. She recommended two rolls to start. The Oh Jenna and the Sexy Lazy. They launched the all you can eat on it perfected way.  I am indeed a sushi freshness snob, and every bite we had was wonderful. For $26 each, Sushi Way can't be beat. We mainly saw locals here which was a good sign.  We were staying at the Rio and although only 3 miles away, it was a $15 and 20min ride in early evening traffic. But well worth it.
