ejP5Jo9QucdJRdNS8UDHZQ.text: Love this place. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and we were so happy with the freshness of the sushi and the service was amazing. The waitress even secretly connived with me in preparing my boyfriend's bday song and cake. They also have a variety of sushi's not tasting the same unlike the other sushi buffets.

dg8RkMXIfUGW6DsJoi9ogQ.text: There's a new kid in town for all you can eat sushi.   There's a lot of these in Vegas and the quality is all over the place. This one is on point.   Almost everything on the menu is included in the deal. Cool presentation in the little serving plates as well.  Our server Richard was very pleasant and helpful.   Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna sashimi with jalapeño
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped scallops, tuna belly

MAMlnuS-_oSRpP5FtfOgEw.text: All You Can Eat sushi is usually a very good thing. Normally it is a delicious event. This is not the Sushi Way. You have to shove rolls into a napkin so you can throw them away in the bathroom. That is the Sushi Way, way.  Took a minute to be seated. It had a decent amount of people in here. We did beat out a group of 8 ladies that had to wait a while for a table.   $25 for AYCE sushi. A touch north of what I want to pay, but hell, it's a Friday night. I can take the hit.   Cherry Blossom Roll: This was my first roll. This roll was a red flag. It's spicy tuna, crab and green onion inside wrapped in avocado with eel sauce with crunch. I thought it was a joke when it came out. It's comically large. You can't pick it up with chop sticks. It doesn't hold together to take a bite. It all falls apart. Plus, it didn't taste fresh at all. Crunch was just brown sugar which didn't add anything to the roll. It was actually jarring to get a mouth full of brown sugar out of nowhere.   No relief in sight. Screaming Orgasm was also gross. It's just tasted old. The sauce was flat. Just like it had been sitting out all day.   After these two lackluster rolls, we ordered more. And waited. And waited. And waited. Went to the restroom. Noticed there was no soap in the bathroom. Compounded with the fact that I had to FIGHT with the automatic hand towel dispenser to get a scrap of paper towel. With all this in mind, I wondered, "How do they properly wash their hands before touching all these rolls?"  With my appetite diminishing exponentially, I could take in the environment around me. This is when I noticed the head sushi chef looked like he had some frat party to go to after work. He was wearing his hat backwards while plating the sushi. I couldn't stop thinking, "Who even wears hats backwards anymore?" Am I judging a book by its cover? Just ask the people he was about to serve sushi to when he yanked the plate away to fix the presentation of the plate (top of rolls falling off the bottom part). Seemed super professional. He also was just staring at the 8 women who came in after us. Just watching him stare in that direction for most of the night. Sushi weren't the only rolls this guy had his mind on.    Along the professional route, one server also openly was flirting with the other one in front of us. Or something akin to flirting. I have no clue what was going on. After bringing us our rolls, server asked if we wanted anything else. One server playfully hit the other server, then says something to the effect of, "We can beat each other up if you want us too."  Uhhhh. Please. No.  By the way, did I mention we never got our own plates? We had to eat right off the plates the rolls came in. Supes profesh.  The rolls we got were even worse. Salmon belly was whatever, tasted like it had been sitting out on the counter for hours. We had burnt eel. We had old stale rice. We had more unfresh fish. Debated on how to dispose of this food. Almost settled on the "dump it in the plastic tree" move but decided it was too cartoony and rude.  This is where I had to eventually take the rolls into a napkin and dump them in the bathroom trash can. That was the easy part. Hard part was fishing paper towels to dry my hands.  Any redeeming qualities? Sherbet sure was good. Legitimately, the best tasting thing we had there.   I have never had such a strange sushi experience in my life. I'm glad I'm still alive after eating that food. Don't get me wrong, I didn't feel great, but I'm alive.  There are tons of other sushi places that are better (Yama Sushi, Sushi Mon, Japaniero) so don't even waste your time here.

e2z9LrMYlXPfembC5WLk5Q.text: All You Can Eat Sushi. YES.   The quality of all the raw fish was very good and there was a wide variety. Unfortunately no real crab, but the chef's special was included in the deal. I would definitely come here again.

id9FhFUUZ1up4F0b43nLsA.text: Okay, I'm super picky when it comes to sushi but holy shit this place might have the BEST baked salmon roll I've ever had. I'm not from Las Vegas, but I will definitely come here for my sushi cravings whenever I'm in the area. My partner and I ordered: Philadelphia Roll, Kiss of Fire, and the Baked Salmon Roll. We don't eat a lot of sushi so we did a la carte. It doesn't show that they offer than on the menu - but they do.   The ambience is dark and intimate. It's a nice small restaurant and it's not loud. I think people will enjoy coming here for a nice meal after the club or to wind down.   I dont have a favorite sushi restaurant in California (where I am from) but I kind of wish this place was there so I could go every week.  Our server was also really nice and friendly. This was one of the few places I've been where I didn't have a problem with customer service at all. He was there whenever we needed something but was not pushy about drinks or adding more items. The food was brought out so fast too! These chefs have magical hands I swear!  10/10 will return.

2GZlrA4P9WjEZ8qZwZm3UA.text: Wow I dont even know what to say. We have been out of the area for a while. I haven't had sushi in 9 months. The first thing on my list to do when returning home to Vegas was Sushi Way. What happened to this place. The server kept forgetting what we ordered. So much rice on the one roll I ordered and also on the nigiri. The screaming orgasm was two cuts of tuna nigiri thrown over some daikon. The salmon tar tar that used to have a nice presentation was some salmon cut and tossed over a pile of crab salad. It seriously looked like some ones left over picked at appetizer. We used to eat here once a week and thought I would be doing that again. We will not be eating there any more. What a let down for my first sushi in 9 months. Its really just too bad.

X8VPwr0lJJBweA5124uNPw.text: First time eating Sushi Way AND first time ever using EAT24. I know, risk taker ...right!? Well, I'm glad I chanced it.. because not only was the sushi fresh and delishes, it arrived in 30 minutes! Faster than most pizza delivery. I had spicey tuna rolls, Philly rolls with masago added, and hamachi rolls. I keep my sushi basic and traditional... no fancy stuff for me. I made a special request to pack my to-go boxes on ice, it was done so well. The ice didn't even have a chance to melt in the bag it got here so fast. I will definitely order from them again, and visit their restaurant to try the all you can eat. Very impressed, and satisfied.

ubzG9I0_Zb-orCqadv8MFg.text: Favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas - and last nights visit was so good I'm here again for lunch.   Favorite roll is the Big Easy, and the garlic edemame is great!

rKRvIJuGpPyis75rCdanmQ.text: All meal is great! I go for All-you-can-eat so I order almost everything. Sushis are all fresh especially oyster! It's a must! All red menu is worth to try!

cN605APjTznhsiFA1CyDlQ.text: If you want to have a lovely, all you can eat sushi near the Strip in Las Vegas, Sushi Way is the way to go. A year ago, my family and I came to Sushi Way hungry after a long day at CES. This year at CES, we have continued to enjoy the same, good quality sushi that we craved for after dining here a year ago. On top of their fresh sushi, the sushi chefs themselves are all bright and full of energy, ready to serve you delicious food the entire night. Both of the sushi chefs that we had the pleasure of serving us, Jun and Matthew, were quick to pick up on our preferences and serve us both quickly and at appropriate times. My family appreciated their hospitality and definitely will return the next time we are back in Las Vegas!

librXWj4ZkI6sOxTaI3Ozw.text: Great place. Service is good and food comes out fast. We went around 8pm. Surprised how big the sweet shrimp was! It was amazing! Overall, great all you can eat sushi place in Vegas. We'll be back again!

Bs_M6TwNwcZ9R0s-cub7NQ.text: Delicious! Great service. Fat ass roll is really popular. The i love sushi roll and salmon nigiri was also amazing.

VUrPuCxnLGRWpmW2TZOu4Q.text: The wait staff was fantastic! The food was phenomenal, we had the Japanese lasagna and the OMG  both were delicious sorry for the lack of pictures but we were hungry. Fermin was a great help as well very attentive and well mannered. Will definitely recommend and return.

_YlZ5e1XY0PBPxSjwohf5A.text: At any AYCE, your looking for quality vs. price. This place has very good quality food for the modest prices. Everything that i tasted was fresh and tasty. The pace at witch the food comes out is promt. Definitely recommend is you want some fresh sushi and rolls.

1fMSyv_RrIlFsX9UGKBXFQ.text: this place is really good. All foods are delicious and their customer serives was great :)

p0ODccXbE1tyQPcT6oXeYg.text: Delicious food!! Great vegetarian options. Awesome service. I'll be back next time I'm back in vegas. Strongly recommend.

u3gNPL8Ms08s47-hohdBuA.text: Strong with the drink refills, Michael, the waiter explained the menu well, delicious freshly prepared all you can eat off the whole menu.

4XQ8SC-JIcPXrxj18VdS-g.text: Great lunch specials. Great sushi. One of my favorite spots in town. We visit here each time we're in Las Vegas.

U0_XBr2NiXqdCpaZgoy7vw.text: Its salmon and tuna ate so fresh and delicious. Next time I wanna choose "all you can it"

DC03dw6wVRFfUvhRwmwYYQ.text: Just came in town from Los Angeles. Having tried a few all-you-can eat sushi places around Vegas, this deserves the 5 stars. Good food and great service- thanks Monica!

woBX0a3GEUHbBAhC-Wbs-A.text: Our first visit here was amazing, starting from the waitress to the chef and not to mention the food was amazing! When in Vegas this place is a must! For those with kids, this is a kid friendly restaurant! The food is very fresh and tasty. You will not be disappointed, everything was  delicious!

z8Lxl38-TOBn9ur9tr832w.text: Outstanding service and the screaming orgasm was orgasmic.  Japanese lasagna was the bomb too.  We day at the bar and the chefs were awesome...very helpful and attentive

3YZ1RErM3cZwWtkTOeeM7g.text: Great sushi and service! I ordered the crunchy roll and it didn't disappoint. Will come back again for sure.

5fEom_CBspz9zt0sPFy_vQ.text: Great quality! The sushi is really fresh. Off the strip so no need to worry about parking. We are on vacation and will definitely keep coming when in town!

AKK5zGcPi8kMNkYWTBGNKw.text: I'm surprised this place has such high ratings. The service was absolutely horrendous. I walked in with a group of 5 people and right when we walked in we were not greeted by any of the staff. I work at an AYCE sushi restaurant in Southern California and this type of behavior would never fly. Sushi Way is an AYCE restaurant and the server was writing down my tables order on a note pad. With that being said, only half of our items showed up that we ordered. They need to develop a better method for keeping track of the orders. At my restaurant, we have a sheet with all of the AYCE items and the customer can check the items they want, then the server picks up the sheet and inputs it into a POS system. On top of that, the food was not good. The fish was not fresh, and it was very inconsistent. Luckily I was only visiting Vegas for the weekend because I will never have to return to this place again.

XtfZFYN6gR8YzAnv-qtb5w.text: Come by and see the owner June for an amazingly delectable experience. We stopped in for the all you can eat sushi for lunch and told him to surprise us! It was delicious and had some great conversations. Highly recommend fresh fish and great atmosphere.

-JaXTJ1Lq0ZLWfPPzr4kAA.text: Great sushi restaurant off the strip. Prices are reasonable. I will return next time I visit Vegas.

akaNW1M4UTlsIYahDMoe6A.text: I'm not one to make reviews but they have a little posting in the restaurant to write a review...so I will.   When we first got in they sat us right away and took our drink order.   The guy was very friendly and even gave a suggestion on what his favorite roll was.   So...I ordered that roll.   When we got our food that we ordered it was all very tasty.   The sweet shrimp was really good and a good size (according to my friend since I don't eat that).   Throughout our experience my friend kept ordering "hot" tea.   It was not hot.  Not hot at all.  So that was a disappointment.  It wasn't busy at all the entire time we were eating but they hardly checked up on us.  The ambiance was good, lighting was good with good music.  They switch servers in the middle of us eating which wasn't bad but we didn't know who to flag down when we needed to order something so it took longer than we would have liked to order and get our food.  I would say over all they get a 3.5.  I'm hoping the next visit I have will be better service since the food was pretty good.

uGaZ20fKc6lwYbU4Tz1mAQ.text: The owner is very friendly even after it being our second time he recognized us and thanked us for coming back. We went once and loved it the second time was just as wonderful. It's great to see someone so passionate about his place. He also make great sushi :)

_YVBJGdjQl38I8MIsIXWyA.text: Ate here for dinner two nights ago, Not a bad all you can eat sushi place, seriously service was ok... The sushi items was good, the kitchen items hot foods was pretty good aswell... Would come back if I was in the area.

GXnpPtIhZnFXKGhR58uZQw.text: Had a really great meal! Good quality food and my server jane gave me excellent customer service will definately come back again!

OYCW4-aliA7KNRZeFJkeqQ.text: My fellow Yelpers did not steer me wrong! Excellent service and sushi! My first AYCE Sushi experience and this place didn't disappoint! I'm still skeptical of AYCE but would definitely come back here. They can split the sushi rolls if you start to exceed your limit. Ask for the quantity in some of the items if you want a large portion. They serve some things tapas style which I think is genius! They want to limit food waste which I appreciated. I also appreciated the large menu choices! They also are awesome for recommendations and again very friendly staff!

kN7H_BTtrUXtZGQcciHtkg.text: Great sushi. Quick service. All you can eat is good price with quality sushi.  Location is close to strip but off strip so not as busy!

RVtdgc_t1LO3FrYhsE66mA.text: I got off the plane at LAS and IMMEDIATELY headed here for AYCE sushi.  The place was packed on a Friday at 8pm in early January.  We snagged a seat at the bar and I am so glad we did!  The sushi was delicious!  The chef was funny and would slice off perfect pieces of nigri between jokes and slugs of beer.  The white tuna with garlic was a stand out but all the fish was super fresh.  I will definitely be back again.  This is my second fav AYCE in Vegas and that is saying a lot for a city that has so many.

vPOrc0vIT7EenjJ3xXf2fQ.text: All u can eat and sushi are normally two things I would be sketched out combining but this place really nailed it. Their sushi is surprisingly amazing and for 45 bucks a person it doesn't hurt so bad when eating well over double the amount you would pay at a comparable sushi spot. A+

kajETfgF22eRzgGsWwHIzA.text: The service is great and very fast. Hospitality is great and so is the food. The fish is not low grade. Food comes out in a reasonable time and is very delicious

9_kCaFnVyjmGXQzzFzresQ.text: Wonderful service!  The varieties of items one can get for the dinner buffett is amazing.

1GRrI3PqbdRk4hN1uBPetw.text: Seriously one of the best all you can eat sushi restaurants! I definitely recommend it to anyone who loves sushi! I'm not from here, but when I come back down here, I know where I am planning on going everytime!

_SxNJxnKJsegcxNqx4GWVA.text: First of all, they use way too much rice on their nigiris and rolls... They don't play around when trying to get everyone full off the rice so you order less... The rice on the nigiris are the same size as the fish, plus the fish cuts are small, you taste more rice than fish... I also ordered some half rolls and the rice on their rolls was as thick as the rice on the sushi rolls at Smith's... The rolls were sloppy lookin like they didn't care how they came out, and it wasn't even busy... Took forever to get my nigiris, and there was only three tables and two couples at the bar... It took forever to get my last two rolls before last call and by that time there was only one table and one couple at the bar... The service was slow, the sushi chefs were slow... Won't be coming back here again..

RwpDkenocVEsXzWCsysr_Q.text: After going to multiple well known AYCE sushi restaurants in town, I think this is the best out of all of em. The fish is super fresh and the staff is really nice. The only problem is sometimes when I come they'll be understaffed while it's busy and the service is kinda lame. But other than that great place for sushi! I always find myself coming back here.

LoQMDCRGGL0SO0kNHNKKCA.text: Was told last call was at 130 at 120 and not served. Luckily other places inside the complex were open. Unfortunate cause of the really good reviews.

i0wAO1eBJ1wn-W6U3xaBQg.text: I work at a sushi restaurant in California, I was extremely disappointed in the food. I was already expecting it to be pretty bad because it is AYCE, but this was un expectable. The octopus was not fresh or anything near it! When I told them it was bad and I couldn't eat it, they told me it's probably too fresh for me. That is not what it is, I eat sushi every other day because I love sushi and that's why I work in the field. Plus if fish was so fresh why would it be AYCE, it would not. Not to mention there was 3 servers that day with 4 tables and they were so slow, when I asked them about it they said it was super busy earlier. But what about now, we still need things. Over all I recommend going somewhere else for sushi, I felt sick afterwards, all my friends did. Let me save you and your stomach, don't go!

61HIm8Y9xByETJqUtxpLDg.text: Very friendly and great selection! Was not overly busy, the seating was comfortable, and it was not far from the strip. I definitely recommend this place

W3SZzh4wTN894ErvxCMiGA.text: We came to Las Vegas for 4 days, and the sushi was so good here, we ended up having 2 of our dinners here! It was just as good second time around--and sushi chef Ivan even remembered our favorites. If you've never tried an oyster shooter, theirs is excellent. They have a wide variety of sushi, it's fresh and tasty, and the service is friendly and fast.

9oX2r0nVFP7FZ2qJ1Itr0Q.text: Best Sushi spot in Vegas very good staff and great food highly recommend this place the staff is very friendly and help you with any questions. The chefs are very fast and come out really quickly  the best all you can eat in Vegas the owner is very humble and always will deal with any situation that comes which is rare

T_hHlSaVNrU_Ez1MADskOA.text: Another 5 star review because this is hands down the best all you can eat (AYCE) sushi I have ever had.  Incredible.  The sushi maker and waitresses were very friendly and on-point, the food was out of this world.  I decided early in the evening to let the sushi maker pick the rolls for me - because they were so good.  Not one wasn't top notch.  This is a Vegas-off the strip-must go spot.  A+

1Vwas0X-5UHy8SwgBAVnPw.text: Ivan is awesome with the service, very friendly and super accommodating!!! Great food. Great selection of food from the all u can eat. Fresh ingredients. Foods are tasty.  will come back.

dv9zCSmBXWJeFbGf7jaIRw.text: Came here with friends for dinner after a long day walking a lot outside. Honestly so delicious some of the best food in general that I've ever eaten. Wait is really not long around 5-10 min. considering it was dinner time too. Service is very good and the servers can be very funny and easy to talk too. The only real issue that I found was that the sushi can sometimes have too much rice stuffed underneath but only occasionally. Will definitely comeback!

N1wwiHiBtzJZmpAzQ7PFTg.text: Amazing chef with perfect atmosphere and fresh delicious sushi!! Went last week and came back today and both times perfect!! New favorite local spot.

EWIDhyNfQE7jPCGpHq0-6Q.text: Went here with some friends to try out a new AYCE sushi place since we wanted to shake things up a bit. This location is near the strip and is located in a small plaza, so be sure to make the turn at the light because I thought I could just turn directly in, but there is no other entrance.  For lunch they only give you 60 minutes to order your food so make sure you have your whole party with you to maximize the time. I ordered a couple of rolls, but I wasn't really impressed with any of them since I've had much better. The only item I would highly recommend getting is the sushi nachos which is basically a bunch of raw fish stacked on top of a tortilla chip (think of it as a seafood tostada). The rice to fish ratio is alright, but they could cut down on the rice a bit. Also, you can only get one dessert item per person. They are really stingy!  The service was both good and bad. The male waiter is very nice and attentive while the Korean lady really needs to brush up on her customer service. I called her over to just order a seaweed salad and the cucumber salad since I wanted something refreshing with my sushi rolls. The first thing she says is "oh, but you already ordered a lot." First of all, my orders were all half rolls and I was only ordering two light appetizers. Secondly, doesn't she realize that I was doing the AYCE menu? I'd be more understanding if I ordered a bunch of stuff, but I was being rather conservative for the first round. Luckily she took my order, but I've never had that kind of experience before. It just sucks that she is the one to take the orders, while the guy can only clean up or give more water. If the service was better on the lady's end I would have considered giving a higher rating.  Overall, I would not recommend this place. The food is alright, but I would recommend going to Sushi Twister or Sakana. Trust me on  this one lol.

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seaweed salad and crab and cucumber salad

LTQxqWm0eZJHvkKPxXxrDg.text: Great all you can eat menu for a great price. I will definitely come back.  Also, if sake is your thing. This place has a great selection and also sake coolers which are tasty. Lychee was tasty.  This place is a must go if you're in town.

25XawsGFIt1MiD0Gv9RalQ.text: Sushi here is average at best.   So disappointed.  After reading all the great reviews we were expecting better quality sushi.  Servers were fast getting our order and food. But sushi was just average.  It took forever to get our bill. At least 15 minutes after we were completely done and no one had come over..  We kept trying to wave someone down but no one would make eye contact. My daughter raised her hand and waived and my husband stood up and walked to a waiter to ask for the bill. We had to ask one more time.

ADch9RUJsaU_NbaTdf9vhQ.text: The food are pretty good and I think it worth the money we paid. They have ameabi, uni, sashimi amd fresh oysters, but it limited to one order per person. $26.99 for the price of AYCE, I still think the quality is good and I will come back for it!

c7s_i96S5QatXk4REyKU5Q.text: We arrived for dinner and ordered AYCE for $26.95 each. The two servers were fantastic and answered all of our questions.  The AYCE menu has a lot of choices and includes dessert. The items we ordered arrived promptly  and tasted fresh. In fact, we ordered some of the items twice because they were so delicious. We might go back to Sushi Way before we return home....

OMn9b4i0kBp1N7-s382xiA.text: All you can eat Sushi is a staple in Las Vegas. So my wife and I love to search for new spots every time we come and we landed on this hidden gem. We were greeted by the staff right away and got a great seat the sushi bar (Great Choice). One of the head chef I believe (Mike) was excellent. He was friendly and breakdown the whole menu. A hidden gem about this spot is you don't have to order a whole roll. You can mix and match a few rolls so you can get a little bit of everything. Eel rolls are my absolute favorite so I made sure I sampled all of the different rolls they had to offer. They didn't disappoint!  I also ordered several different sides like the screaming organism and the short ribs. All on point.  This spot is definitely competing for my favorite sushi spot in Vegas.

52ezLarn4BoIEq921S_FkA.text: DELICIOUS, creative, affordable sushi rolls! I am so glad I found this place. It was amazing. The service was also great. Very friendly staff...quick service. Everything was just superb. I will definitely come back to visit whenever I'm in LV!  Also I had the Baked Salmon Roll and Big Easy Special :-)

Peiyad0DjKPR0uk41DugaA.text: Literally the best sushi place I've ever been to. I don't understand how they make money here....the fish is so fresh and everything is amazing. I HIGHLY recommend!!! Get the sushi nacho

QVA0Q0nCZRRJaK0jAI3p6A.text: Great food great staff! This place is on my list of places to come to whenever in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qLwqMxc5ihdExEHb3aiayQ.text: With multiple sushi joints popping up in Vegas, how does one stay ahead of the pack? Well, there's a no brainer here! Quality and Service are on top of my list of what I look for.  I didn't stumble onto Sushi Way. It was under "hot and new" so I gave it a shot! I always prefer to be seated at the bar, so I can interact with the chef. It's also very entertaining to watch them prepare my meal. And wow! I was very impressed by the temperature of the sushi and the fish to rice ratio was excellent.  I was even more impressed that the chef kept making items that were off menu! I was game for anything!  I love that this place doesn't use a lot of cream cheese in their sushi as fillers! If I want to eat cream cheese, I have lots in my fridge! LOL  Having an option for sushi half rolls is another reason I consider when dining in and I'm glad this place offers that! Some places only do half rolls on your last order. Then there's the awesome staff at Sushi Way. Where they treat you in an AWESOME way!

XG7FWUP52aZNo1xi1nXQWQ.text: Really great sushi, and variety of rolls. Good price. Probably not the best place for kids. But definitely great sushi. Will definitely visit again without kids.

tiweh6JyS4j1u_C_NDBcjA.text: My friends and I came to eat after one of the VGK games and we had a great time doing all you can eat at the bar. The bacon wrapped scallops are so delish!

E6x1326KRBGcdkMzOcSrVg.text: One of the few spots in Vegas with actually good sushi. With fresh and clean looking food.

qF8igVH6sOeZBizWVnAXCQ.text: This place was awesome!  Great service.  Great friendly people.  Great quality of food.  We didn't know there was an all you can eat option and frankly we were apprehensive of eating here because of that.  But... we don't regret it one bit.  Anything on the menu was included, no exceptions.  Again, amazing quality.

0-PaL3_33CpAc1tygVF2FA.text: Wow, what a great sushi place! We went for lunch on a Wednesday, so it was not too busy. "Ordered" the all you can eat option for $22, which was a great deal. You can order all the rolls from the menu (even half rolls) and they are freshly prepared - at that price!  The service was also great, very friendly, suggesting different rolls to try. Would definitely come back here if I lived close.

Food are not done of cooked specially the   Yellow Tail  kama. It is in my photo here? 3. The gyoza I think I missed spell this and the spicy Dumpling taste horrible and salty!  4. WyQe-xL0ea96tteZk4JXeQ.text: In Vegas and wanted sushi but didn't want to pay outrages prices so we found this place a little ways off the strip. We walked in and it was lonely but tried it any ways. We got seated and looked over the menu. Our waiter was very cool and very knowledgable about the food they served. We decided to go for the all you can eat and that was a great choice.  Sushi was fresh and tasty. We had tuna, halibut, salmon and rolls. I can't remember the rolls we had nor did I take pictures of them but they were very good. The waiter would also do recommendations of what to try and everything was very good. My wife also ordered noodles in this place and she enjoyed them while I tore up the all you can eat sushi. You really can't go wrong. When in Vegas I will definitely be going back to sushi way and hitting up the all you can eat!

tj6FEJQsbdZMLRLN8_uXfg.text: Great selection of rolls. Excellent combinations of flavours.  This place is one of the most creative sushi places I have experienced.  If you need great suggestions ask for Jayna. She took us on an amazing tour of the flavors and combinations of the menu.  If you like creative sushi with a twist try this place.  We enjoyed Sunny Special, I love my a$$, kiss of fire, Red boy, Sushi nacho, rock roll, burning your stomach, and Mochi Ice cream (mango flavoured. All worth the experience.

Ae4tvGoieYX4LiJV4X8tYQ.text: It's a nice inexpensive place. They have "all you can eat" option, which is a great idea for people who like to try everything! It's a nice sized place with enough room between tables.  The service is great, they really look happy to see you. I felt really good as soon as I walked in, great vibe! And they're fast, so be careful not to order too many things at once because you'll have your table full!  They are really good explaining the menu and suggesting so if you're unsure or confused, jus ask them! The food looks and tastes good, I was super excited after reading the reviews here and I sure was not disappointed. The reason why this place is not a 5 star for me is the fact that they ran out of gyoza, which happens to be my favorite item in any Japanese menu; and the fact that their bathroom looks dark and a little messy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t remember the name of this one but it&#39;s delicious!!!!

spbllW1W9A_pH1-4KclP7A.text: Absolutely delicious! Highly recommend going here and getting a bento box.   Came here after a day of shopping at the outlets and it truly hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken bento box

S1irpz3ua36FeQ6uYMOHOQ.text: First time here and I had a very nice dining experience. I ordered 2 rolls. The Big Easy Special & the Sexy Lazy Special. They were both excellent. One had cream cheese. That was the winner for me. I love anything cream cheese. The server recommended I do the "All You Can Eat"  and I'm glad I did. Both my rolls totaled $27 which is .50 more than the AYCE. I was impressed because AYCE included everything on the menu as compared to other AYCE restaurants which limit you to certain items. I was with 2 others and they ordered a few different items plus Edamame. The only con for me was the miso soup wasn't hot.  Other than that, the service was great and the sushi was delicious and very much worth the $26.95 AYCE.

5qRoy_LCJ8BhPABsL9l3IQ.text: I have never left a bad review but y'all need to watch out. The edamame was hard. The teriyaki chicken roll tasted like the chicken was a few days old and microwaved. The "I like my ass" tasted funky and the "golden Philly" roll was awful. It was the kind of taste that made you question if you were going to get sick or not. The service was horrible - except for the younger waitress. This rating isn't for her, she was very nice but everything else sucked.

07Hu516l3i9-EQmNh5Jrew.text: Wow. Hidden gem. Looked on Yelp for "local" sushi joints and Sushi Way came up. Since it was super close to my hotel, figured I'd give it a shot. I was NOT disappointed. Fish was fresh and cold. Rolls where delish and well out together. Beer was also cold. Service was fast and friendly. I am so happy I came here. Totally hit the spot... And "All you can eat" sushi, lunch special of $22 bucks is a steal. Cut rolls, sashimi, hand rolls, appetizers, dessert, can all be included (with only a handful of exceptions). So bomb. Just go, you won't be disappointed. (Also the pineapple sorbet is delish!)

bztNXjY0X9qlt5wP9H-NIQ.text: Gross place. It puzzles me how anyone can give more than a star. Fish looks gross. Rice is hard. Even California Roll wasn't good. This was my first time at all you can eat, and never again.

galusTcjMIP29T8p3mXabQ.text: I love this place! My colleagues and I originally came here back in November 2018 during the SupplySide West trade show and we took the entire team for an amazing sushi experience of all you can eat indulgences.   I decided to come back for a second time this past weekend and it was just as good as the first time!   I went all in on the no rice rolls. They were incredible; especially the volcano roll. I ordered two of them.

This place had the most amount of rice out of multitude of places I've tried. Service is on point, I feel bad to give 2 stars to floor staff who were very helpful. Fish isn't as fresh as other AYCE restaurants & excess rice will hurt the business one day!

5We_ttUp30Za3NBZEiLkLA.text: Decent sushi joint, $26.99 for diner AYCE.  Their sushi quality is fine; not A+ but a solid B.   Friendly staff, chef does not overload the nigiri with rice (see attached pictures) but they need to have the rice at a warmer temperature.  I would come back again.

SAg90MUHzhqpX5FKxKhR-Q.text: This spot was a great place for early dinner after getting out of the convention down the street, I came here because of over 1,000 5 star reviews!! Amazing!!  I'll add one more to that, my buddy and I had a great experience here.  We found it tucked away in the shopping complex, and got seated right away.  We decided on getting a few rolls instead of AYCE, and it was a good call.  2 rolls each, and a few appetizers.  They came to the table SO FAST, like they were already made.  Good quality fish, quick service, cheap rolls all together.  40 bucks for both of us and so much food on the table.  Great place!!

ZprJnuwmSPulYIbmLFFouw.text: We didnt know this place was an AYCE until we got there. It's nice to be able to go to an AYCE like Sushi Way and be able to choose any sushi roll we want. Other AYCE places we've been too only give you a limited selection of sushi rolls and you have to pay extra for specialty rolls. Whenever we try a new place, I'm always afraid the food is going to be bad and my meal will be ruined. The food here is actual good and the dinner buffet is reasonably priced. I enjoyed my meal so much and I left here very happy. We will definitely come here again the next time we come to Las Vegas.

0Uy7kHXIYS8o-sTw__ze7A.text: Great food, nice atmosphere and I recommend the lunch bento box specials.

Lu0J-yywTZTQIx4G6wMI2w.text: I'm a big sushi fan and lately some of my favorite AYCE spots in the valley have fallen off quality wise. I wanted to try somewhere new and stumbled upon this place with my brother.  All the nigiri was well prepared with good rice and good proportions of fish cut perfectly. I tried a little of everything and thought the Halibut, Yellowtail, Albacore, super white tuna, and sweet shrimp were delicious. I tried all the rolls my brother got and those were all good as well. The chefs at the bar were friendly and service was great. For the price, this was the best fish quality I've had in town.  Pro-tip: get the side of fresh wasabi. It makes a huge difference and tastes way better than the paste most places serve. At $1.50 for a side of their house wasabi it was well worth trying.  The one knock some people might have (but not me), is that the sides/appetizers list isn't terribly big. My wife doesn't like seafood and some places have sizeable non-fish options. This is not one of those places.   I look forward to coming here again!

7nWYK4ydl-4Ry1uZMeHVsA.text: Compared to the multitude of other sushi AYCE spots in the Vegas area, Sushi Way is just average. The biggest disappointment were the "soft shell crab" options, which were basically a little fried tempura rolled with imitation crab.  The fish is also average, nothing mind blowing.

VFwfJI3qaXSb-V961zEqTA.text: Visited this location while in Vegas the food was excellent even though it is a buffet you get to select items from the menu and they prepare it fresh for you no complaints great value and great food.

And also items we didn't order showed up to our table as well.  Overall the experience was OK I feel like there are definitely better all you can eat places around town.

Great staff. Great food. Every time. Never too packed. Like a diamond in the rough among all of the sushi spots that scatter Vegas in China town and more expensive areas. Come check it out! You don't regret it.

jD2CxVKnqdYoG0VS2FbK6A.text: Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas. Rice to fish ratio on the nigiri is perfect. Fish is fresh and everything tastes great! Fast service and friendly staff. We go everytime we're in Vegas and have never been disappointed!

kD6TGqPgyj-oVQk9uDmKdA.text: Good sushi and good prices. The staff is friendly and so where the sushi chefs. I would recommend eating here to get off the strip and for good sushi.

O3ZiGWbtBjtTaqsmsBIzQg.text: Went here for dinner and loved it!  All the food were fresh and delicious.  My son says he rated this place a 5 stars.  For three person $88, which was not bad.  Highly recommend this place.

UkoXmNNqSYEa0VkejsshpQ.text: Read all of the great reeviews on Yelp! And my wife and I decided to try this place out. I was celebrating my birthday along with my best friend who joined us as well. We walked into the restaurant and waited 15-20 minutes before a sushi chef greeted us and told us to have a seat at a 4 person table in front of us. As we began to sit, the waitress finally came over and told us that we'd need to wait an additional 10 minutes to be seated. As we all stood there confused as to the service or lack thereof, the guests of the entire restaurant seemed as though they were also very disappointed. We finally decided to just sit ourselves down after 15 more minutes of waiting and nobody caring to acknowledge us. We sat at our table for another 20 minutes and as we sat there, two other small parties came in and were seated. The parties of people that came in after us were brought water and greeted before us. When the waitress finally decided to come and greet us, we brought this to the her attention and she rudely said that they only had two people working and had no sense to respectfully apologize. Had she done that, it would have been different, but the fact that we were treated with disrespect, we got up and left this place that so many others have given 5 stars. So disappointing!!!! Good thing we were in Vegas and had so many other options to choose from! It did set us back and as a result, we were late to a show after finally getting something to eat.

hsTtXzE_w5xo58wTwNEwhQ.text: Loved it!  The All You Can Eat Sushi is well worth it if you enjoy the speciality rolls.  The rolls were fresh and tasted great!  Our waitress had a great and friendly personality.  If I lived here I would definitely come back!

9TS4-k9VHO5R6T2OqqN1EA.text: Horrible service! Paid for all you can eat and the wait staff was never there.   There is a million sushi places in this town, don't waste your time here.

mybCnH5dt6XESgIelodj9w.text: First time here while visiting vegas! Service is so nice and friendly here. The vibe is very chill!!

Nnr2xyMwdkyNWNHV7oecoA.text: I'm not sure why this place has received such good reviews.  Frankly, my experience was underwhelming, to say the least.  The appetizers selection was fairly wide, though the few good items were limited to one order per person (like oysters, and random for a sushi restaurant, galbi).  Nigiri selection was overall decent, though the uni was suspect (had a weird dark mustard color and sure enough, tasted odd).  Overall, fish was OK, though the salmon belly did stand out.   I'd be willing to come back here again, until I realized there are better and more affordable options (read: Goyemon Sushi, despite the always long wait).  Service was probably the deal breaker.  I basically had to stack all the empty plates to the edge of the table for someone to notice and come remove them/take new orders.  For an AYCE sushi place, there seemed to be a lot of resistance to our party ordering more food.  After our first initial order, we wanted more food, but was met with the waitress asking if we're gonna "finish all that food"?  Uh.. YEAH, we just barely started!  Another time we ordered, the waitress warned us that we have to eat all the rice that comes with the nigiri sushi.  She must have spotted the roll of rice that was left on my friend's plate.. the same one that dropped on the table beyond the five-second rule and she decided to not eat.  Thought that comment was unnecessarily passive aggressive.  Lastly, when it came time to dessert, it was only one order per person.  Good thing there were a few of us so we were able to each order different things and share.    Funny "AYCE" place.

kWqaDlc9MOvZtkqhfxo_VA.text: My wife found this place on Yelp and it was pretty new.  There is a lunch and dinner menu for the all you can eat, but highly suggest you pay $5 dollar extra to get the dinner menu.  You get raw oysters, Kalbi beef, salmon, oh shoot I forgot the other ones.  Pretty much lots of sushi selection and the best part is you can order a half roll which is really nice so you can try different ones.  The quality of the sushi is great as it does not have the fishy smell at all. Overall a great value and great food, would recommend.

XSl8HE8shJbQ8lhJH29LNA.text: Amazing service, amazing food, amazing atmosphere!! Love this place every time I'm in Vegas this place is a must!!!

NctPiK-etCRImlFl-6-D1Q.text: Fish was fresh and delicious! Service was super friendly; Richard was my server and he did a great job recommending rolls based on what I liked. Price for the all you can eat is very reasonable! I loved that you can order 1/2 rolls (4 pieces) instead of full rolls (8 pieces) that way you get to try more of the different rolls/flavors. Great place, I will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious yellowtail, salmon belly and salmon!  Also, 1/2 a Sexy Lazy Special and 1/2 a Sex Bomb! SO GOOD!

pv8OXFbSacChVqCP5H5SQQ.text: Good place for all you can eat sushi is great. The sushi nachos are delicious.... Service was great...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nJfnYllwmJLvLV9jojrBZw.text: Delicious sushi and a very friendly staff! My wife says this is possibly the best sushi rolls she has ever had! The Big Easy Special is amazing!  Ok, so I am back for the 5th time in 3 weeks, this place truly is amazing! I have now brought a couple clients, this place is such a hit!   Order the Bacon wrapped scallops!

Ef4a-BEZLYnycpncnI3Q8Q.text: Not a bad place for lunch ayce but not the best.  The highlights were the - super white tuna, garlic tuna, yellowtail, and crispy rice with tuna.   Would've given another star but I had to ask the chef a few times for some of the stuff I ordered since he "forgot." Think he did it on purpose because I complained to my sister about them being out of ginger. Guess that's what you get for sitting by the bar lol .

26ZgKxdNnoRkbp6yc9lxRQ.text: Great sushi, great staff, clean location and good prices. I will come back here for sure! Lots of choices on the menu and the AYCE dinner menu looks even better!

4toG1pMnoA-HEGvPHvE5zA.text: This is my favorite sushi place in Vegas!!! It's all you can eat, but it's super high quality. Typically all you can eat places taste gross or covered in mayo. This place is the opposite, it super high end. I love the specials.

DHCbyoH8kUhMx2w8zBt6DQ.text: This is my #1 favorite all you can eat sushi! Love their fish and the fact that it includes desserts too

qU72qvwTI7LYGa5AzyaToQ.text: Best All U can eat sushi place in Vegas! Really, really delicious!! I look forward to coming back the next time I'm in town. Incredible value for such great quality sushi!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chef&#39;s special creatin was oishi!

Tdnkv6D-kOGf9GEjmASv3g.text: The sushi here is amazing.  They have fresh fish and great service. I mean you can get good sushi anywhere, but I think it's the friendly staff that makes this place great.    The portions are perfect and the presentation is great. Their AYCE price is pretty much the same as everywhere else. Their quality is great. It's not a huge place but it's nice and can accommodate big groups. I personally love the sushi bar. I like being one on one with the Chefs.     Our server was on point and so was Ivan, our sushi chef. He was easy to talk to and very personable.  He made us some amazing rolls. He asked us what we liked and made us some off the menu rolls that were incredible.  Everything tasted great, I highly recommended you stop by andgive it a try.  ****The super white tuna was my favorite. It just melts in your mouth (not in your hands).

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked green mussels

0yo6dhRbPrjbKeCT781F7g.text: Vegas Memorial Day weekend and we had a craving for sushi. After yelping for a good place we found Sushi Way. Winning for sure!   The service- incredible! We got there at opening but were greeted and seated right away and our drinks ordered within minutes. Food and drinks were brought quickly and timely. The servers were personable and chit chatted with us as well and it was very chill. We were there for close to two hours. The prices- great. Lunch AYCE for 21.95 and drinks. We payed little over 100 not including tip for 4 people.   The Food-Spicy Edemame alone was delicious and spicy! We ended ordering about 10 rolls-4 people so don't judge. The baked scallops alone with all the rolls were delicious.  Dessert was the mochi- strawberry and mango. Next time I want sushi here we will come back for sure. We walked out stuffed!

ddTfHoF5Dl8wOWup6fLI0g.text: Not a fan. I am a major sushi lover and have eaten at a lot of places in Vegas. Never have I decided after the first roll to cancel all you can eat and pay for the roll and leave. The food here is to fishy. The yellowtail was hard. I have never had hard yellow tail before. I read the good reviews and that is why we decided to try this place. No thanks, if you like good sushi this place is not for you. On top of that, service is not good. Don't throw down the plates, place them down. Sorry but won't ever be going back to Sushi Way.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eqeX4QS3rSqeLncq9maGzg.text: Excellent! Followed recommendations from Yelp and this place was fantastic! Our waiter was great and very personable! I've been to quite a few AYCE sushi places that take forever to get you your rolls. Not here high quality and fast!

FvfEApQ-3mPy7UmAsKzVnQ.text: This is my first review and I promise I don't give out give stars easy.  This place though, THIS PLACE!! By far the best I've had since moving back from Japan.  Only open for two months!? You would swear these guys have been at it for decades.  The sushi is spot on and fresh.  The menu is full of legit items.  The best part? ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR $26!  I will always come here when ever I'm in town! My tip? Get the all you can eat, sit at the bar, tell them to make whatever they want and watch the magic happen.  You will not be disappointed. I promise!

CA_vIUvwbjJeDDz0-Wrh8w.text: Amazing sushi! Fresh tasting and creative! Spicy Garlic Edamame was bomb!!!  Definitely coming back!

They have a wide variety of sushi rolls and tasty appetizers, however, the service was not great at all and they had a tendency to bring out the wrong food to the wrong tables from time to time. Also, the bathroom floors needed serious  cleaning . They took forever to bring out some of the extra items we ordered.

9GMeg73SDnm6TsoFTo22Mw.text: Don't go here.  It's my secret.  The sushi is always fresh and delicious.  The all-you-can-eat deal is a steal.  Stay away.  I don't want you to come eat it all!  :)

AoZak9FSq0GBjHOOgpP2rg.text: Great AYCE place - Lyle, the new guy who just started this evening killed it and was totally amazing and quick! Definitely a recommendation for a great sushi place off the strip. Great Job!

uGqdqdcAxIU9b7IB21ksRA.text: I love Sushiway! This is one of my newest late night sushi place in Vegas. I have been here 4,5 times. They provide a lot of nigiri and the eel hand roll is my favorites. The nigiri is very fresh also. Only complaint is one server she is really slow and  not really friendly. It took long time to serving our table.

4T56lgN_-BdVCSsL5rAXsw.text: I am reluctant to write this review knowing it will only raise their profile and more people will discover this restaurant... but it was that good, people deserve to know. The sushi and 'all you can eat' menu were just amazing. The server we had was great, helped with recommendations and was very accommodating. The sushi chefs were the fastest I've seen and their presentation was great. The selection was exactly what I was looking for in an 'all you can eat' too. This will be on my to-do list every time I visit! Wish I'd discover this sooner.

ktQ9F2aygacaRYIxw1ky5Q.text: Take it from a guy that has been over 50+ times to Sushi Mon (according to check-ins)  This is the best AYCE sushi place in town right now.  Jun has opened a great place with remarkable service and great tasting food.  Some people have complained about the wait time, He has hired more peeps and the wait time has been cut down considerably.  For the value and the great taste and cuts of fish, you can't beat Sushi Way.  The hamachi Kama is huge and full of meat.  Poke is great.  hand rolls are wonderful and the Negiri sushi is like any other nice sushi place you would go.  His play on tempura shrimp (coconut tempura shrimp) is great also.  For the value and the great food, I highly recommend Sushi Way.  Don't forget the honey bread dessert!

YZNZQB6Qc34bJM12UsQdAg.text: Very good. I would recommend my friends. The atmosphere is nice along with the music.

cw_hnDjelCQF_Wk2S_89pw.text: I've been to 100s of sushi places and Sushi Way is among the best. Clean, friendly and a terrific value.

vFGIcM184lctrSh_sWzr9A.text: Great prices, open late, great service and clean. Came here for a late night sushi craving at 1:30am and I was pleasantly surprised!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California and spicy tuna rolls
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari

wE4-Uzyip14LBTXPRBsywQ.text: This place is awesome. I don't like the mayo or honey sauce and they custom made every roll to leave it off. I'm a pain but they made it work perfectly. Quality spot... intimate and unique. Good for a date. Unless the date is a dog, then there is a Taco Bell across the street.

wo_dOpTtMvpr-2Ypqj4gnQ.text: Amazing!!!!!! Top place in Vegas. Hole in the wall place must go! The chefs are amazing if you need or want anything different on your sushi they will work with you. I don't eat fish which is weird to go to a sushi place but every time I go there they help me make me feel good about that and do anything to make me  satisfied with their food.

Q7DOu8rNJu9Xj3HSnYy_rQ.text: Amazing. Great staff, fast service, clean restaurant, bathroom had no paper but the rest of the experience was wonderful. The food was incredible, better than expected. Will definitely return.

e9M6k-N82dPLkCJWOfAMLw.text: We took our family to this restaurant and it was delicious. We had a lot of fun and the service was really good. The all-you-can-eat sushi was fantastic.

EUS8FHxbNfgWTg66tZ4T8Q.text: Ive been searching good sushi around my work at casino. Then i found it. I know there is kaisen sushi around here. They are not ayce.   but i like all you can eat sushi better. SUSHIWAY IS AYCE.!!! Awesome!!

Yb_GJ9qipgsQqU1dcWZ4cg.text: It's off the strip a little way, but you will not be disappointed! Good food and way cheaper than the big hotels. We used LYFT to get there and back to the strip.

RFs5lCUDo7ojEQ7RQLBduw.text: Jane is by far the best waitress I have ever had. She is very helpful and energetic. I will for sure come back and try the amazing food again.

pwe-H3cIgQ_nJJ67yz4D5A.text: This restaurant was a little hard to find but worth it.  It is located next to a tacos n beer bar.  My husband n I walked into the restaurant around 11p...its a dimly lit small place.  The servers are friendly.  They offer an all u can eat sushi (off the menu) for lunch n dinner.  We ordered ala carte n enjoyed our selections (sorry, writing this review 3 weeks after our visit so kinda forgot what we ordered).  I do know we left full n happy.  We will make it a point to revisit next time in lv

uSs1xZung81bx7ixnTTFjQ.text: Awesome! I love this place and their food! I ordered from their all-u-can-eat sushi and I will definitely return! Jane was my waitress, she says that she is new but by far she was professional, fun and was able to discuss their menu in detail. I would recommend going Wednesday thru Sunday because the 2 Itamae (sushi chef) that prepared my food and conversation do not work Mon or Tues.

C-2amaYZWLNoFYLULTsWNQ.text: I wasn't a sushi lover until we tried sushi way and OMG GOTTA TRY IT! The Mexican roll, the big easy, shrimp tempura are to die for!! Yumm!! This is what I love about Vegas any kind of food you want whenever you want.

vNki-0OQKss_hGVwy3ujhQ.text: Had the all you can eat dinner. Good del @26.95. The seafood is good quality. Would definitely recommend and come again.

Gyort9KH9I5uQJmpIDJaDw.text: ok, second visit....not quite as good as first, but still decent  started off with bacon wrapped scallops of course.....YUM an order of shrimp tempura and vegetable tempura too, good, nothing special, but good Hamachi kama, gotta get these if they have them available....simple grilled collars with a ponzu sauce to dip in....not necessary, good by itself  first round of nigiri, ordered salmon belly, uni, unagi, and Hamachi the owner Jin/Jun (sorry not clear on which) prepared our first round of sushi everything was great, buttery, melt in your mouth good  pause for another round of bacon wrapped scallops! and we snuck in an order of salmon tar tar, really good, layered on top of crab and avocado  second round of sushi, ordered salmon belly again, super white tuna w/jalapeno, tuna, and a spider roll....have to order 1 roll at least right? in any case, his apprentice prepared this order, and you could really tell his knife skills lacked, as the fish did not have the same consistency as our first round some of the slices were uneven and he cut against the grain incorrectly, as the salmon belly was a bit chewy rather than soft and buttery in texture  in any case, that about wrapped up this visit finished with some orange slices and green tea ice cream  I will be sure to visit again, but I will make sure we sit in owners section this time so we can enjoy this place to its fullest!  keep you posted!

-pV5HGmdVNPrRcAyDIf1yA.text: The freshest All You Can Eat sushi in Vegas!  Very fresh and tasty tuna and salmon sushi.  My wife and I are sushi killers!! We loved it here, but we feel guilty because we ate so much!  Tasty appetizers as well.  All around experience was great!

a75rpxCa4pzAttcp-c02lw.text: The feeling you get when you've been craving sushi and stumble on the best place ever, is indescribable in words. My husband and I ended up at Sushi Way based on other yelp reviews. And we were extremely satisfied. Our server, Yuna, she was the best! So polite, funny, friendly and informative. We couldn't have ended our night on a better note! Oh and make sure you order the Viva Las Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viva Las Vegas baby!!!!

0jxaGvFhrDsdl4vPxHJ6Ug.text: Friends and I sat down with no wait. We did the all you can eat sushi for $21.95 which was such a steal! Perfect for sushi and seafood lovers! Everything on the menu is really good, the sashimi was fresh, the rolls came out super fast and our service was enjoyable! Our server was very interactive, we loved her! Favorite rolls has to be the rock and roll but the poke salad was a must. Will definitely visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YgeZEvzOeb0MlkhBA6jvgA.text: Food was decent, the service ruined the meal... Waited 10-15 minutes in between every order that was delivered to the table and each order only had 2-4 pieces... Hubby and I ended up drinking 4+ pots of tea waiting for food to arrive at our table... I think we got full from tea and not the food... One order never showed up to the table at all after waiting a good 20 minutes at the end... We gave up and asked for the check and even that took 15 minutes

uFv2iRpNMDFlh4aSZb-WLg.text: The food was excellent and Jay was great and very attentive! The sushi chefs were excellent and catered to what ever your heart desires!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ad0XEqYIqVXscf7TH40BiQ.text: Our second time here, and it did not disappoint! The chefs are very friendly, they're quick, and the place is hopping! My husband is a sushi connoisseur and loves coming to Sushi way. I like sushi as well and I'm always happy with the roles that I get. They're very tasty! The appetizers are good and the coconut shrimp is cooked to Perfection as well as the tempura calamari. You can't go wrong at this restaurant.

OgSSMajIdNzsDr2sT49OOw.text: For a $21.95 all you can eat lunch, I think you can't beat it.  There's only a few things you can't order on the menu but everything else is fair game and they have a pretty good sized menu.  Had tuna, yellowtail, unagi and octopus sushi, all good and what seemed to be pretty fresh fish.  Also had a few rolls along with some miso soup and edamame, all were good.  We were stuffed when we left and the bill was under $50.  Dinner AYCE is $26.95 if I remember correctly and you do only have one hour but we would have spent probably three times what we did if that was a strip hotel sushi joint. Have to remember this place for when I'm working at the convention center, just down the road (in a strip mall across from the Hughes center, next to the old Firefly location).

HUoDVYZ5BTnjffdXkU54eg.text: This is my first ever Yelp review. I usually just check in but this place was just so great. My boyfriend and I come from Vancouver, Canada so we know what's up when it comes to good, affordable Japanese food. We were really pleasantly surprised. Food is fresh and tasty, and the value - in both quantity and quality - really cannot be beat. Service was super attentive, and the staff very friendly. All around A plus plus :)

bQ6M_OTNdmdaYexwo1yb8w.text: Ahhhmazinggg!! We decided to check to check out Sushi Way because they have great reviews. Wow. They did not disappoint. We were greeted by Alicia and she was absolutely nice  and took care of our drinks. Then Jay came along... boyyyy.. did he take good care of us!! We let him choose everything. We were feeling quite adventurous and we are super glad we did. His selections were amazing!! His attention to detail was simply excellent. I can't stop raving. Kudos to the chefs! Worth the trip off the strip!!

kxi-da3NOXhr3VVeaYdCJQ.text: Best all-you-can-eat deal in town!!  Excellent staff, they give great recommendations and are super knowledgable when asked about the food!!  Sit at the bar so that Ivan can hook you up!!!

YEbdnGwUSnuENeq160pmgw.text: Hands down.the freshest.Best sushi I have ever had. The owner takes.great.pride in his work and it shows!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut shrimp
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped scallop

ADB3TfTCUDmRBStnXoYfbg.text: Service was great but the sushi was hit or miss. The Big Easy was awesome, but the Viva Las Vegas looked much better than it actually tasted

cMw0L_UxF28VbNUaMSiHiw.text: Best place around for sushi, great staff, and even better prices. My favorite place for sushi

Ei8CeBbI8D2wzGR9a8MWBQ.text: Great lunch experience. Found Sushi Way on Yelp and figured an off the strip lunch experience would be better and we were right. This place hit the spot. The miso soup was excellent and the service was efficient and genuine. The rolls were less fusion oriented and we really like the Arizona roll. Solid, light and tasty. Highly recommend.

5F5q59NrUz6UM7SCgQOZEQ.text: We must have come here on a bad night but I was extremely disappointed in this place. We came here on a Friday night and there were only three other tables here so we were seated immediately.  The waitress gave us only a couple minutes before asking if we were ready. This was obviously our first time here so we politely told her we needed a couple more minutes. That didn't stop her for checking in every five minutes until we finally ordered.  My friends and I decided to only order a couple rolls since we weren't super hungry for AYCE. I ordered the TNT roll which was good, but we had problems when it came to my Candy Cane roll. The description stated that it would have spicy soft shell crab, spicy crab, cucumber and tuna and yellowtail ( I think) on the outside. Well, when I got my roll it was super tiny, not even as big as a quarter! I saw the cucumber on the inside but it was surrounded by regular imitation crab! Sushi is my favorite food by the way guys so I know the difference between spicy crab, regular crab, and soft shell crab.   I decided to try one piece just to be sure, but sure enough there was no soft shell crab and there was no spice at all! I politely tell our waitress that I believe the soft shell crab is missing and she takes my plate away to talk to the sushi chef. However, when she returns to the table she asks me, " Do you even know what soft shell crab is?" Then she explains that the chef said that there is soft shell crab in there and I should be able to taste the crunchiness throughout the roll.   I am not an idiot! I should have taken a picture for evidence but it seriously just looked like a California roll with no avocado and tuna/yellowtail on top.  The service is horrible here!

4CKlpAq_BPcCql6ssVfWBw.text: Great food Friendly staff. Try their eel. Salmon crab tartare is phenomenal! Now we're about to get their green tea ice cream  Would definitely come back!

hLeOhn-vnSbbd7o_SAfhvw.text: We've been here quite a few times for both lunch and dinner. There's over 100 items to choose from and this includes their specials! They never disappoint and the included desserts is a nice way to top off your meal. Tempura ice cream?! Yes please!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is our favorite AYCE sushi spot! I especially like the screaming O, D.D., James Bond, and classic Philadelphia roll.

jhHQZa5ZjbE6c3iahdcUwg.text: Still one of my favourite sushi places ever - Always fresh with over 120 items on the menu - probably much more I just have never counted. Even with groups sitting for dinner their service is still quick and rapid fire. They have an a la carte option, but you may as well do the AYCE due to the variety, bring friends to maximize the experience.  Great date place or anniversary/birthday. If you truly love sushi - do yourself a favour and come here - Their roles are very unique and diverse. No res required for groups of 4 or less, except weekends/special holidays, but definitely make them for more than 4 persons, no one likes to wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delish!

kxtITnbBKV6LrKQF5yXFFA.text: starting off with... if there's one thing i hate using yelp for - it's sushi Americans often think of sushi as California rolls and their definition of "good" usually leaves me smdh  i am a self-admitted sushi snob my profile pic is a piece of o-toro from the Tsukiji Fish Market in Tokyo  my favorite is Omakase sushi at the bar, direct from the chef...  so i land in Vegas, around lunchtime, take an uber to some place off the strip... and to my horror - it was All You Can Eat (AYCE)... in any case, i luckily it was closed and i tell my uber driver to take me to the #2 place (as per Yelp)  we get to Sushi Way and I see the "AYCE" sign in the window. At this point I am Stttttaaaaarvvvvinngg!!!  whatever  go in, sit at the bar - they explain to me that for lunch it's $21.95 for 60minutes - no holds barred - anythign and everything on the menu goes  you want edamame? sure you want 10 spicy tuna rolls? sure you want a really complicated roll of your own making? (i think so)  in any case - as i sit there, overwhelmed with this menu - and starving, sushi chef asks if i'm ready... i say while i look, let's start with a spicy tuna roll  [listen - i've had amazing omakase nigiri sushi, but that's not what i'm expecting here - let's be realistic]  it comes pretty quickly - and i'm actually pleasantly surprised  for the next 35 minutes, i order 6 more rolls roll after roll  one from the softshell crab section one from the eel section couple from the shrimp tempura section  the special rolls are massive  and they are all DELICIOUS  i was incredibly nervous of spending my first evening in Vegas explaining to my buddies that i ate a lotta strip mall sushi and was spending the night in my hotel room worshipping the porcelain gods... no such thing!  after 35 minutes i had zero room for dessert or anything else (it was still included - and i still had another 25mins to go)  but all things being equal, for $21.95 - i definitely think i came out a winner one of the best value / best lunches I've had in Vegas... Period!  can't wait to go back, next time I'm in Vegas

WE09DvOOxEeK4fMT7WLwEw.text: Good AYCE menu but the service was even greater. Despite me trying to practice restraint, the proprietress kept asking me if I wanted to order more. I left Sushi Way following a very satisfying lunch.   Came for lunch and opted for the AYCE option which was around $22. It wasn't crowded during my hour or so here which meant I got my orders to me really quickly. Order a whole bunch of things but what stood out included the sashimi salad, the rock n roll cucumber roll, and the seared salmon nigiri. Overall the nigiri and rolls were pretty fresh and generous with the seafood. The sushi tacos were interesting but perhaps a bit too tart.   I think the spread is better at Sakana but the service here is more personable - everyone was absolutely lovely from the mom-like hospitality of the proprietress to the enthusiasm of the young chef behind the counter. Really enjoyed lunch here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything I ate for lunch. And they still checked to see if I wanted more.

fC-eTlMX00R8I1FbC9pymA.text: My overall experience with sushi way was okay.  The fish was good overall, but the way the sushi chef was cutting the fish pieces were inconsistent. He said it was his hobby so it was very iffy. Some pieces were super thick and yummy and some of them were extremely thin and choppy.  The spicy edamame has a kick. When it says spicy, they mean it. I really liked that.  Other than those notes, the overall quality and time was super nice.

gswpn_Y4xBZ2cDj-57CUfA.text: Memorial Weekend Friday dinner.  I myself am not a diehard sushi person, but if you are, then this might be your place.  Don't get me wrong, I was hungry, and I was craving, but I just didn't expect myself to get so full that I almost felt sick.  My goal was to have at least  5 different orders, but by number 4, I was done.    Variety, taste, waiting time, value for your $ - A.  Service - B.  Location - A  So if you're avoiding the craziness, busy-ness and trafficness of the strip, then this little food strip mall is a good choice.   TIP -  if you're gonna do AYCE (because you can also place individual orders) then be VERY hungry and in the mood and you'll be very satisfied.

ZIJbTDjXQiG4y_luQE6iTQ.text: 3.75***  Unfortunately YELP does not allow for 1/2 stars!  Unlike most of the other AYCE Sushi places, this one is not too far from the Strip!  I thoroughly enjoyed the all the nigiri here, they even have Salmon Belly in the AYCE! - Fresh Scallops were very good....one of the best I had at an AYCE - Loved the Sushi Nachos...very creative with tons of flavor. - Bacon Scallop skewer was tiny...gone in a couple of bites... - The Salmon Tar Tare was gone in one bite as well...creative and tasty!  The service is decent. This is where they get docked the .25 Stars...lol There is a Korean lady that is a bit rough around the edges... For dessert I asked her for the Green Tea Tempura...but instead got the regular ice cream...wasn't really interested in making a big deal about it...its fine.  Other that than...Nothing to really complain about...  I will be back.

NuIFNMHFNGFND9kRHwIBTg.text: Service was excellent. Food fresh and delicious.  Free parking, great place for locals.

sJuEM5_5RJfNH6WBZJ8S9w.text: All you can eat sushi is bomb. That's it. That's the review. Jk haha!  Naw but on the real, I'll start off by saying the service is top notch! The staff was super attentive and quick to help and bring the orders at a steady pace. Definitely worth it if you're getting all you can eat. Speaking on that, you SHOULD just get your money's worth and get AYCE, because they have a variety of different cuts, rolls, sashimi, fish, yada yada all that good stuff to try. Literally the WHOLE menu is available when you do AYCE. You could try literally one of everything if you were that hungry.  The location is great, not too far off the strip. If you've got a mean Japanese food and Sushi craving it's definitely a spot to check out. I'm a big Salmon guy, so the cuts on the Salmon Nigiri were premium to me. Probably got like 10 orders of it to be honest. So whether you're a local or you're in town, save some money on the expensive restaurants on the strip and get some premium grub at Sushi Way!

LrJCunrs2TOR3ns2gDkiNA.text: I don't know what funny business is going on here, but don't be fooled by their rating & the number of reviews they have.. (or maybe people can't tell from good and bad fish?) I was excited to try this place after looking through photos but I really should've looked at the reviews too.  We probably waited about 10 minutes for a table of 2 on a Tuesday night and was seated at the bar where we were greeted by what seemed to be not so fresh fish. We decided to order a few dishes to give it a try so that we could just leave after if we didn't like it.  Tried a couple rolls, nigiri and it didn't take us long to both agree to get the check and leave. I would say, spend a couple more bucks for better fish or just stay away completely..   Service was okay, didn't experience any problems, but it wasn't impeccable either.

kL36irZkOmcK0HRU3PCN-g.text: Thank you :)  Johnny Roll  was my fav  !  You can do all you can eat 22$ per person at lunch .. can't beat that price

6wOepOh24BaobPQ073Jizg.text: My fiance and I got brave and decided to venture off and try a new sushi spot that we've never been to. Of course we went here because of the reviews and I would say the sushi here was great! Service was good, we didn't wait long to get seated and our food was always on point. Our favorite nigiri is yellowtail so we become quite critical when it comes to trying new places but Sushi way didn't fail us. We enjoyed their yellowtail and other nigiris and we will definitely be coming back!

t-ryWNSRnAC7RqFpu0JC4w.text: 8/23/19  Our most favorite AYCE Sushi place in Vegas, but this time was embarrassing. My daughter and I use to be able to throw down the sushi but this day it was not to be. Blame it on the hot Vegas weather or the stress from moving her into her new college apartments. We were weighed, we were measured and we were found wanting. Oy! We only lasted 3 rounds, and even with that we couldn't finish what we had ordered. The nice server dude must have sensed our utter defeat and told us we didn't have to force ourselves. Still THE best place in LV for AYCE Sushi. Bring your patience though...the parking sucks here.

4rT-2kauSIXhDsJ7g0GvBw.text: For a sushi place in the middle of the dessert, it makes me wonder where they get their fish and how fresh they could possibly be. I also scratch my head why I somehow crave for it when in Vegas. With all that said, I think Sushi Way is the way when you catch yourself in the same predicament as myself.   You are in Sin City after all so go eat all you can for less than $25 (kids are half price) for lunch. Their menu is extensive from rolls and nigiris to cooked items like shrimp tempura, grilled pork belly, and what-have-you. The fish may not be the freshest but you know they make it fresh before serving. Ha! I had my heart's content with all the salmon, red snapper, and yellowtail sushi without getting food poisoning. That's a plus! The fish to rice ratio won't make you fill up fast allowing you to enjoy some of their rich and hearty rolls. Our party of 12 almost tried everything on the menu while our server happily obliged with every request and additional orders we made. Heck, the bill was paid and we still wanted more mochi ice cream and they gave it to us. Can you complain? No way!

6iF6gvqmAF2P0AoCJOqM6w.text: Totally impressed! Took a risk being tourists and going for 'all you can eat' sushi off the strip - but we read reviews on Yelp and selected this one.  How could 1,149 people be wrong?! We were not disappointed! The fish was super fresh, extremely tasty - great special items - excellent service and interaction with the sushi chef.    We arrived a little after 8 and didn't have to wait to be seated.  The chef took our order quickly and we had sushi in front of us in seconds, lol. Items from the kitchen were quick too, and really good.  A qualifier for me is also of a sushi restaurant has fresh wasabi, they do!   We now have another reason to visit Vegas, we'll be back!

The options are: Sod shell crab rolls No rice rolls Deep fried rolls Fresh rolls Shrimp tempura rolls Baked rolls Sushi nigiri Regular rolls Soups and salads Vegetable rolls Side dishes And desserts (try the mochi)  3pm- close all you can eat $26.95 Lunch 1130-3 pm $21.95  Service: excellent Cleanliness: excellent Menu: fantastic assortment/tons of choices Seating: sushi bar and plenty of tables Price: $ ---- awesome!!!  Swing in and fill up on delicious  sushi any time you're in Vegas. This is the place you want to go.

Amazing service and speed! This is not a bot - just traveling through, usually don't eat sushi when I'm not on the coast but this is amazing! Get the OMG roll and the Sushi Nacho! Wow.   (First yelp review literally just because the sushi was soo bomb)

8tLRxRNrSfRuEncrzw8qww.text: Pretty good for AYCE. These days all the AYCE spots have up to 3 rounds of ordering so I was surprised to see they did not have that system here. I recommend making reservations so you don't have to wait.  Most of the fish tasted fresh except for a couple that I can't recall. I enjoyed the yellow tail, uni, amaebi, other nigiri, etc. The only thing that annoyed me was that our orders were not complete. Some items never came out, some extra came out, and some just came out way too late. Our server had a good attitude and tried his best so it wasn't too bad. To me, this place deserves 4 stars.

2HmQ35dyiE_HJqqcqRUgYA.text: My new favorite AYCE sushi spot! This placed is tucked away in a plaza behind the strip and doesn't offer much seats but it's worth the wait. MELT IN YOUR MOUTH YELLOWTAIL. Their fish is so fresh and the ratio to fish ratio for the nigiri couldn't be more perfect. I've been to many AYCE sushi places where they fail to get the ratio right - most times way too much rice for the sliver of fish. We had the yellowtail, super white, garlic tuna, salmon and salmon belly nigiri that was just so incredibly fresh you would think they caught it themselves.  The downside though, the service was a little on the slow side to the point where we would wait so long for what we ordered that by the time we actually received our food, we completely forgot we ordered it. Also, on our night they charged another parties payment (probably about 11 AYCE dinners) on our card.

Y1s-sSheDhTgK3FH8dJBtA.text: Summary: Usually, all you can eat sushi is a hard sell for me. I feel like when you go to these places you are always sacrificing quality for quantity. However, Sushi Way proved me wrong... I just get how they are still in business selling such good fish at an all you can eat price!    Atmosphere: (4 stars) - This place is definitely a hole in the wall style joint located in a strip mall just off the strip. However with that said, it was well appointed, clean, and just big enough to fit everyone that it needs to.   Food: (5 Stars) - High-quality fish... I know... at an all you can eat place?! I know... but seriously, everything we had was great. I wish I could pinpoint a few of my favs, but we honestly had like 20 rolls. If I had to pick my favorite, it would easily be the Salmon Belly. It was so tender.   Service (4 stars) - Despite being very busy, our order arrived quite fast. The server was super helpful, and the service was exactly what was expected.  Value (5 Stars) - 100% yes.  Would I go back - 100% yes.

cwIGpni7-Tqp_ewHzkpLQg.text: Above average AYCE sushi, especially given the massive selection in Vegas. We stumbled in here thanks to the great Yelp reviews and it was pretty busy for a Thursday afternoon. Their entire menu is available for AYCE, with the exception of a few items listed in red print. The standout for me was the White Fish Tuna. You must order it!! I got 4 orders, it was so good! Other standouts were the Salmon Belly, Boom Boom and the Rock and Roll! The service was great and the restaurant was clean. The mochi ice cream was meh, nothing great. Overall, I'd definitely be back the next time in Vegas!

uEXDGm5yAaAu6P0goe8pNQ.text: , came here with a friend during CES. This is one of the worst experiences of My Life.
