First of all they have their son maybe two or three years old maybe stick in the corner watching his little cell phone while they works. You can definitely tell these parents don't care anything about their child. Anyway on to the main part of the it was. This issue was good and that's only because of sushi chef was great, and he probably wouldn't be working here if you knew his real self worth and you can probably get a better job. After learning Sushi we ask for the bill bill came out to a hundred and someone not changed. Once we got the change we gave $140 so we can have extra money to tip and ask for change. It took half an hour before having to ask for the money back and they said hey you only 20. Oh no I've never been to such a disappointing placed as far as management goes I definitely would not come back here again it's a waste of time you could definitely find better Sushi I would definitely recommend Sushi Mon right down the street

fUuhUf4AN3FC0mm1MMyaPA.text: The best and fresh sushi joint in Las Vegas... The proportion of rice to and seafood was perfect. The service was great. The server was very friendly and nice. HIGHLY recommended.

PXPsu5SgJ1pTNU3piV5bIA.text: Been to three sushi places in Vegas so far as I moved from New York, though non can compete with New York's id have to say, this is the best place I been to so far. Understaffed for lunch, but still had decent service and from the appetizers to the sushi...best I've had yet!

sGcYHclxJ5dYAmG2LIsLaw.text: Great AYCE sushi in a friendly and engaging environment! Daniel is a wonderful chef; you should definitely let him create a surprise dish or two for you.  Prices are reasonable and the location is very convenient to the strip.

h2VRXFXIl3VGu3cqnAPY3A.text: One again, I ordered delivery from this establishment. I have never visited the restaurant in person, and I will limit my review to order accuracy, presentation and food quality.  So, regarding order accuracy: FAIL This is the oddest part of my whole experience. I ordered, among other things, halibut nigiri. Eat24 called me a few minutes after I placed my order and informed me that they were out. I asked them to replace it with an order of yellowtail. What I received, besides my tuna order, which was fine, was 1 order of unagi (which I did order), 1 order of yellowtail (I think), and one order of salmon!!! And I was billed for a yellowtail roll; 2 dollars more than the yellowtail nigiri that I ordered as a replacement! Eat24 did a great job repairing the mistakes, but it's quite clear that Sushi way is not yet prepared to accept delivery orders.  Presentation: D+ Not one effort was made to present an attractive delivery order. Plain standard styro boxes with no adornments; not even that annoying plastic grass! I ordered wasabi and ginger for three and only got a quarter-sized serving of each. They did have the more expensive throw-away chopsticks though; that got 'em from a "d" to a "d+."   Food quality: C My husband loved the tuna; deep red, with very little sinew, and generous fish slices. However, as I've said many times, the heart of sushi isn't fish, it's the rice. And Sushi Way's rice isn't good. No coherence, and if you order some sushi that has a special sauce, like a ponzu instead of the standard soy, they put it directly on the fish before sending it out. Guess what the rice is like when you finally get it! Yep, soggy, no cohesion, very difficult to eat. But again, the quality of the fish was very good.  The bottom line? Clearly, the person who was responsible for contracting with Eat24 didn't consider the ramifications of offering sushi for delivery. I hope the person who is in charge of social media will instruct the staff on proper delivery prep and technique. And yes, presentation. I will order from them again, with prejudice though.

i50tQCPgz1w1nW4EzX8joA.text: Well like most a bit leery of AYCE sushi place, as I too am a sushi snob.  Bottom line the food was REALLY good and the service was just great.  We went at 3:30 and were the only ones in the place.  I could see that  if it were packed the servers and chefs may have a hard time keeping up, so order what you think you can eat at your first ordering.  Eat it all and then sit back and ask yourself ' do I really need that 4th roll'   The menu is mostly rolls, but they were really good.    Enjoy

Qj7SSOtihklwzXloqljShw.text: Service staff were wonderful ! We also had the all you can eat lunch and everything we ordered was done pretty well and tasted quite good. Glad they had a section for sushi with no rice, we tried one with nachos which sounded odd, salsa and fish? But it was our favourite and we had to order another serving of it.

M-7qiYpK2CzaJ3UqN11LWA.text: Today they had an all you can eat special. Everything I tried was prepared to perfection. I had Philadelphia, Rainbow, and a few other special rolls, dumpling, ribs, egg rolls, and even ice cream. The workers operated at a team. I never had to wait or ask, they were on it. Food was prepared quickly. Top top it all off, everything was reasonably priced.

faMxcJ0c7BiIqTYa44b5hg.text: Honestly this place is one of the best sushi places Ive been to. I go back and forth from Vegas a lot and this is like my go to sushi place. Not to mention the staff here are so nice and they check up on you frequently. I came here with my friend and we had the all you can eat sushi and it was great!

eHyFUuvv8FurUe8RMM0x2Q.text: went there for my first dinner during my Vegas trip, all ingredients are so fresh n yummy! AYCE menu is in a such good value! would def recommended it! don't forget to order the salmon belly!!

jW_VhOceRkUNdPG3ved6RQ.text: Best sushi I have had in a LONG time. At first I was skeptical seeing it was all you can eat sushi- those typically only serve you all you can eat California roll or spicy tuna- however, Sushi Way lets you eat ANYTHING OFF THE ENTIRE MENU! Come in with a hungry belly. I ended up eating 6 half rolls (they offered half rolls so I could try more of everything I wanted)! Not to mention also had edamame... And amazing coconut shrimp! Save room for dessert bc their Mochi is some of the best. Everything was delicious. I highly recommend and will definitely be back here next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mix of a few different sushi rolls they offer- the list is about 50+ rolls strong and all so good!

4QykbXsWcTntpeshZ8teRQ.text: The worst service ever. They messed up my order, and forgot my fiances order. The avocado rolls have literally no avocados in them. I'm shocked by all the positive reviews.

7-cXVyJq0M0zqdH3Nn4wKg.text: My new favorite AYCE sushi restaurant! This place is #1 if you wanna enjoy some good sushi in Las Vegas.  Previously, Goyemon sushi was my #1 for a long time, but my experience here today has taken that spot for sure.  I've tried many AYCE sushi places (Kaya, sushimon, doh, sushi twister, umiya, Yama, just to name a few) but this place takes the cake.  Food was excellent. The nigiri, rolls, and appetizers were a much bigger portion than I thought and was a welcome surprise. The textures and flavors were on point, and I've gained a new favorite nigiri, the garlic yellowtail.  There is a good selection on this menu that is tasty and much more different from other AYCE places.  That honeybread is something I've never seen in other AYCE places and tasted great on top of that.  Service was great. The food came out at proper times and the waitresses and chefs were awesome.  Kudos to them for their hard work and dedication!  All in all, one of the best experiences at a sushi restaurant. I gotta thank my buddy for recommending this place to me, otherwise I would've never known abut it.  I can't wait to come back.  Other AYCE sushi restaurants need to step up their game if they want to unseat Sushi Way as my #1 AYCE sushi restaurant.

gOsl_mhqSLY_95t1DVLDzw.text: Sushi was delicious but service was average. I would go back again. You can't beat the price and quality of food. Size of fish compared to rice was generous. All sushi was delicious. Most food came out relatively fast. A great way to try new sushi. Oyster was good for the first order but the next order was luke warm and had murky water in the shell. We told the waitress and she just took it away and probably didn't tell anyone. Kalbi was like warm but flavorful. Baked salmon roll was good. Screaming orgasm was just ok. We didn't think the special orgasm sauce was that unique.   Service- waitresses were very nice but disorganized. Maybe there were new? When we reordered food from the waitress she told us she wasn't our waitress and to wait for ours. However she was the one who took our original order. She said she was just helping the other waitress out since it was busy and then she decided to take our order. Just odd but she was nice about it. We ordered uni for the table right when we arrived. when we were done and trying to figure what we had not received yet, we asked when it was coming and they said they were out. They should have told us that from the get go. So full but hot dessert since it was included. Mango mochi did not have any flavor.   Overall good for sushi and would come back and recommend.

-Q2aeGoLcD41Z8SPoodo-g.text: This place was great for all you can eat sushi! Everything was very delicious and the rolls are huge! Definitely my favorite sushi spot :)  waitress was very friendly! Lots of variety in sushi! Definitely recommend

MPwWwGKsg-9oboV3IZkYFw.text: This was our second time coming to Sushi Way, and I'm honestly surprised why it gets such remarkable ratings.  In my humble opinion, it's average to say the least.  First, I'll say that it's AYCE Sushi, so it's difficult to go below three stars just based upon that fact alone.  $26.95 for the dinner is what we paid for each person.  They have a tremendous selection of rolls along with all the other standard menu items.  Unfortunately, the service is lacking, and I got a sense that the fish and the food wasn't entirely fresh, because the rolls and fish were coming apart in certain areas and there was a slight discoloring.  In terms of the service, we were well into round two before we got the drinks we ordered, and it wasn't very busy on a Tuesday evening.  If you want a sushi fix, I'd say this is a good, economical place, but if you want to take it to the next level, take your ass elsewhere.

C85QIPqBWJtZZROY0wx9bg.text: Worst carry out sushi ever. Rolls were poorly made and tossed into the carry out box. Scallops smelled so bad the box and room were filled with a bad odor. The rolls were filled with fish that was not fresh and not sushi grade. The tuna negiri was not good either. Food was 20 minutes later than pick up. Cashier could not even print a receipt for me. The restaurant front door was open and the entire place stunk even though they were using a machine to pump in air. Would never go back to this horrible spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1P5pu1mAXUuZeb7PpbQIew.text: THIS PLACE ROCKS!! Service is 10/10! We had the AYCE and the sushi is just really high quality! The quantity is moderated so you get to try a wide variety of options, and the fish to rice ratio is really good so you won't end up eating a lot of rice and not much fish.  The waitress was really nice to give us an extra order of mochi too even tho it was one order per person. Must come!!

IbgeYM8iLH0rHx6gZXbLTg.text: Coming from Toronto with a huge Asian population, I figured we know how we do AYCE but after visiting Sushi Way, I don't think I can visit another AYCE sushi venue again that's any less than what Sushi Way offers. The fish was amazingly fresh - you can tell by the taste and the colour of the tuna and salmon. They offer 2 pieces of uni sushi (which is unheard of in Toronto) and 2 oysters as a part of their AYCE menu as well as other specialty items. Service was quick and friendly, location had plentiful parking and everything was clean. Great job :)  I highly recommend the Poke Salad (spelled poki on the menu)

cQM8O_MqKdXqqCWKgcgotA.text: I was really craving sushi the last time I was in Vegas, found this AYCE spot and it was honestly on par with some of the best sushi I've ever had. The sushi tastes fresh which is more than I can say for a lot of AYCE sushi places. There is also a wide variety of food which was awesome. I definitely feel like I got my money's worth from eating here, compared to the other overpriced Vegas restaurants.  The restaurant is really clean and the service is super friendly. My server was Jane and she was really accommodating and incredibly nice! I went with a bunch of friends and she took care of us. I would definitely recommend this place to any friends or family who are ever in Vegas and wants to eat at a good sushi place. It's really close to the Strip too, so if you are ever on a Vegas trip, it would be worth to make a small detour to eat here.

67f1Rd3AEUcLzdE4j9gejQ.text: Went here for lunch.  We choose the all you can eat option.  The sashimi was fresh and the sushi rice was good.  They had Hamachi and Salmon Kama that was included that day and it was fantastic!  Definitely planning to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

X2CrafSOO70_FTOxGrKwjA.text: When my friends and I first walked in, we were kind of turned off because no one was there to greet us and we ended up standing around waiting for about 5-10 minutes. A Korean lady walked in the dining room though and seated us. We thought she was kind of unfriendly at first but she definitely warmed up to us throughout the meal and started joking with us and being really sweet.   Throughout our meal, the service was prompt (both water and food) and the quality of the fish was really, really good. I'm a big nigiri fan and I definitely enjoyed the salmon and scallop the most. There are also many categories of rolls on the back and I liked the Fat Ass (a deep fried roll) even though it's one of those rolls where one piece is too big for your mouth but at least it's appropriately named. A lot of the roll names are laced with sexual innuendo but our waiter would just joke about it and have a good time with us.   Overall, a great meal and definitely worth the $21.95 for lunch and lunch is 'til 4 PM! The menu says there's a 60 minute limit but we were definitely full before the limit since the food would come out quickly. The only thing I didn't love about this sushi joint was that you have to look through the menu and list every verbally for the waiter. I'm accustomed to writing everything down on a piece of paper which I think is more efficient since you don't have to memorize your order.

LjhoRWXX2nG8s5jRHFZ2Zg.text: Was really good sushi and good price for Vegas . Not a crazy crowd but lots of traffic in and out. Had a lot of options and everything we got was amazing.

xeOlJWKgJ-UJ9_147kMl1A.text: Great sushi. On time delivery. Everything was packaged well and tasted fresh even though I picked it up from the front of my hotel from the delivery girl. Ginger, wasabi, chopsticks, and soy sauce included!

pxZlw11mIRo9S6TkTN5alQ.text: Came on the strength of yelpers recommendation & this place was definitely well with its stars. I sat at their bar which was nice.  The wait staff were very courteous & checked in for both drinks & food rounds - always worthy of an extra star in my opinion.   A roll or 2 never came out but the rolls I did ask after came out promptly. I was putting in a constant stream of small orders so honestly I kind of forgot until I was pretty full.  Sashimi is not available (maybe if you're putting in a very special request? And obviously pay more for it) The 2 sushi chefs were quick, nice (I was sitting right in front of them) & kept things moving. I heard them talk with guests & communicate cheerfully with the wait staff so that was well worth a star to me - positive work environment which made me & my meal feel happy, deliciously positive.   They have a good mix of the traditional rolls & their sensually named specialty rolls.  Their rice to roll contents ratio was decent with no extra uneven rice to purposefully fill you up. Their sushi rice was moist & sticky & commoners the fish very well.  They had a good selection of appetizers & cooked rolls which is important for someone in the group whom may be adverse to eating so much raw fish. The menu also states that you can ask the chef to make your own roll if you'd like something slightly different (or modified) from the menu.    Their sweet shrimp nigiri is different in a good way as that I've never had it, it was indeed sweet & delicious but I definitely couldn't have handled a full order.  I lloved that they accomodated my requests for only 1 nigiri (vs the 2 per order) so there is no waste. I love that they seem willing to accommodate guests request for special orders.    That coconut shrimp tempura is amazing.  Light, not too much batter nor coconut overkill.  The one thing i didn't enjoy was the calamari tempura but then I've never found a Japanese place that's done a great calamari...  Definitely will come again when I am down in the area again & bring my appetite. Hopefully the service will still be just as good or even better.

-gbNqJXrd9a-N6XcL0cmtQ.text: Upon entering we were greeted by friendly service and seated right away.  Our server was very attentive and the atmosphere was Amazing!

oxio5Hz2dMHd3ftFikq3UA.text: The sushi was quite good... that's the only reason it didn't get one star.   We sat down and got all you can eat... ordered a bunch of stuff and as it was ready we got our order one at a time... that's just fine with me.... we can eat while we wait.... well that's what I wanted to do.  It was 20 minutes before we got the attention of a waiter to get our second order of food... we placed our order and made it a little more substantial so we wouldn't worry about waiting so much.... I thought!  First: all but one of our half order of rolls came to the table as full rolls.... (we ordered half rolls) filling us up quickly... Second: they started delivering food we didn't order to the table.  Third: we ordered 7 orders of chef's choice "Omakase" after 40 minutes of waiting we finally got our omakase and it was 7 orders of the same thing.. not a variety even the waiter thought it shouldn't of been all one thing....   This was horrible... the service was astoundingly bad.  After whiting this review I can't even give it 2 stars .... it just upset me that much more.... it felt like a scam... trying to fill us up with crap we didn't want and burn our time out with so much waiting.

Rq5wNObXkYPdZnv-VW8r5g.text: First time eating here, and I liked it.  Great quality fish.  I really liked the yellowtail belly.  Good all you can eat sushi place.

If you luckily make it here you must order these following items to experience the "sushi way" of life =] Sweet shrimp Sea urchin (very sweet here. Not all you can eat have it like this) Seard salmon nigiri Tuna Nigiri  Fresh oysters Salmon skin salad  Fresh water eel  Miso soup  Poki Japanese lasagna  They also have 2 things I order that's not on the menu that you should try. Hamachi kama and fresh Wasabi which I put on everything.  And for Desert  Tempura ice cream and HONEY BREAD!  ENJOY!!!

cg9ihfUhVLatrUSrdmcZyw.text: Delicious & can't beat the all you can eat, for the entire menu! Food comes out reasonably fast & the staff is friendly. Some of the rolls have funny names, like I love my ass LOL! Highly recommend!!

PatQZDYbRNbQCFaoR8hvfQ.text: I love sushi, but I hate all you can eat sushi... usually if I walk in and all you can eat is an option I just leave. Typical all you can eat sushi packs the rice and adds slivers of low quality fish. I was really craving sushi and was staying at a hotel next door for work so I chose to stay and am beyond happy that I did.  Sushi Way is an all you can eat like I've never seen. Unique rolls packed with outstanding fish, thick cuts of tuna layering the tops of rolls. To say I was surprised is an understatement.  The fire sauce on the Kiss of fire roll was  perfectly blazing and what ever it is made of is outstandingly tasty.  The sushi chefs are friendly and talkative while even working hard and the owner/manager walked the tables to make sure everything was the way it should be. This place is leaps and bounds above yama sushi. It will not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick layers of tuna
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish to rice ratio unseen and most all you can eat

rZpL1qLihzyfsm9gbfLUWw.text: Delicious all you can eat lunch for $22. Unreal. I ate 70$ worth of salmon. Great salmon. Chefs were cool too, kept telling me what to try next.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked salmon roll

9uwYzda6eNiajAnEsgbSfw.text: Good variety in all you can eat menu Reasonably priced This is good for Las Vegas Plenty of table space and sushi bar space

J-Q_7EbQfjLmpStkIsYTww.text: Came on a Saturday night. Everything was poor quality, fishy ( not a good fishy ) the tempura was hard and overcooked. tasted stale. The only positive was that the servers were nice.  I will never come back here

CnckrqOtNGL3DJKk9GiSFQ.text: I must say, as a sushi snob, this place by farrrrr is my number one sushi spot. Wow. I read a review that they were usually skeptical about ayce sushi places, and I am too, but their ayce sushi here is legit! Wow. Everything is included. Lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $26.95. $50 for dinner sushi-appetizer, sides, rolls, sushi AND dessert. Can't go wrong here. Better try it when you're in Vegas!

5egcj-3t3DuokIJZ8XqJmg.text: We now have our Las Vegas Sushi place. Not too busy on a Thursday night so we had Great service. My wife and I went with the AYCE and everything we had was good with several items becoming instant favorites like "Red Boy", "Oh Jenna", "Sushi Solution" and "Dancing Eel" rolls. We also really liked their "Alaska", "I Love Sushi" rolls. They also have specials that should not be missed if the have it. Specifically the "Salmon Belly" and the not to be missed "Boom Boom Special" (a mouthful of taste explosion followed with a slow burn).  All of the fish appeared to be fresh and was tasty. The staff was helpful and made some great suggestions.  The next time we come back to Vegas we will definitely reserve a time to eat the Sushi Way.

FjFRpxvadOppGysYDsxCoA.text: We went for dinner and ordered off the all you can eat menu. Spider roll probably one of the best I've had. The portion size was perfect. Wasn't too much so that one could still order more rolls. The flavor of the spicy garlic edamame was also better than regular spicy edamame I have had before. I also had the sex bomb roll. It would have been better with less spicy mayo or probs none at all. You definitely get your money's worth here. And service was great; our waiter was attentive and friendly.

vQT7bTvkcVTee6Jc6F1U9g.text: Friendly staff and my favorite part is that they have no rice rolls on their AYCE menu. The Rock & Roll, Spicy Garlic Edamame, garlic yellowtail are all pretty delicious

btHpLCDGQqC1SbUXmYhOFg.text: First time here. Was in the neighborhood and saw this place advertised AYCE. Stopped in for lunch with my son and the host was nothing but nice and catered to me and my son as if we were regulars. He gave the same treatment to everyone in the restaurant. Something you don't get out of most sushi restaurants any more. The only reason this place didn't get 5 stars is because of the decor. That could use some updating. Otherwise, the food was on point and without delay. Will return for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG baked roll

tiZVsTzAHv6iXWVohUNMpA.text: Great place to get Sushi. I come here since it's close to the strip. Server seems okay, mainly trying to get this free soda for posting a review.

Gt5GUPYbF0WhNvAwNxWzuQ.text: Great and fresh sushi! Did the all you can eat!  Conveniently off the strip. Decently priced! Made sushi fresh and special request were welcomed!

F8ILehcehhsbNuK_YLoGqg.text: Found a great new sushi place ... I had been looking for one for awhile, and was told by word of mouth by a friend about this place. I will definitely be coming back to this place to get my sushi fix. The portions are perfect not to big or small like at some other places. Definitely if you haven't tried this place I would give it a chance.

Y_6-4JoNvjVxK1n6EbTnYQ.text: The best sushi place in town. The hidden gem that people don't know about.   So come get your sushi

JXqLJXyKVUd3vb2t23oZKg.text: Found this on Yelp and what a great find! I come to Vegas all the time and the AYCE will definitely be on my every visit list. The oysters were fresh as was everything else. Service excellent, atmosphere fab, casual and relaxed.   Get your butt off the Strip and take a Lyft to this place! It's not far and well worth the trip!

xtTnBwr3b6YSCMDtYIJXVA.text: Food and service was excellent and the prices were well worth the quality of food and service. Best sushi I've had in Vegas.

HPXH8dKbk_J8uukzPWGXyg.text: Ok first of all I go many places to eat sushi and this one just got on the top of my list so far! LET ME TALK ABOUT THEIR SERVICE. My friend and I came an hour before closing so literally 5 mins before last call (I know I'm sorry) so we ordered everything right then and there ... FOOD CAME SO FAST and they were so nice about it !!! The best rolls are the sushi lover's, Johnny, Japanese lasagna- all mindblowing! They have the best super white tuna (you can ask for it without the vinegar thing) and EBI shrimp nigiri ofcourse! For the dessert PLEASE GET THE HONEY BREAD !!! Oh my gosh, everything was amazing especially service !  The sushi chefs just laughed with us and had funny small talk while they were starting to clean the stations :) I made sure we were fast since they were closing and I made sure to tip our server very well! Wish I could've gotten her name because she was amazing!

Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi lover&#39;s ! (Sorry bad quality but it&#39;s one of the BEST!)

MApUOXuS3b4TreG1tHW_IQ.text: I'll be the contrarian and say this place way underwhelmed me, except for the price. After reading the reviews I had high hope, and didn't mind spending $20 for the Lyft round trip.   In an AYCE setting the owner and the customers' objectives are polar opposites. The owner wants to limit his/her damage without being too obvious. As I get older quality takes precedence over quantity, but I keep forgetting that.  The good: Sea urchin is fresh, the salmon has a rich taste. The waitress is nice. Unfortunately the list ends here.   The less than ideal: Sea urchin, sweet shrimp, tuna sashimi and oyster are only one per dinner order. But for the price they are charging I can understand that. For the sweet shrimp they were supposed to serve the head tempura style. There were only two waitresses so they were overwhelmed in an AYCE setting where the customers made repeat orders.   The bad: All other fishes are not as fresh (likely previously hard frozen) and are almost tasteless. It is also half the thickness I am used to (granted the rice is also on the small side). Hence the nigiri lacks balance. The salmon roe and smelt roe are way too salty. Oyster is not fresh, which is kind of hard. Oysters on half shelf are either fresh or spoiled so it puzzled me why the taste was off yet not spoiled. The wasabi has no kick at all - something really hard to screw up. All rolls had faked crab legs basked in mayonnaise in the center, and more creamy sauce on top. Two of those one can call it a night.  To add insult to injury I felt sick and threw up afterwards.

Rnr-iOfDAjx84_QyKU4xZQ.text: Upon arrival, this place seems very chill and low key. It's nice to get off the strip away from all the noise. Didn't know it was an all you can eat place which was a pleasant surprise. Decided to go that route for dinner before we headed home. All you can eat include the entire menu front and back. Includes all sides & dessert!  Our server was Brian, was very friendly. He kept us entertained throughout our meal. The sushi was great! Overall, I would come back to this place when we visit Vegas again. Oh and in my opinion the music was amazing! Whoever made the playlist is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back side of menu

-_jgmY2Asdpw6QvrP_OfeA.text: Yes, I did see that this place was on some local "dirty dining" expose recently, but I assumed that meant that they are probably working in overdrive to turn that around, so decided to try it out. So glad I came in! The selection for lunch is not cut short from the dinner menu. Everything that a person can get at dinner, they can get at lunch. The options include lots of appetizers as well as deserts with the dozens of sushi roll options. I really enjoyed the couple of riceless rolls I tried, especially the Johnny roll-would HIGHLY recommend it! The roll has a perfect mix inside and the "orgasm sauce" is to die for! The egg roll was great-and is vegetarian friendly. I also really enjoyed the Hot & Juicy roll-it is an explosion of flavors in your mouth, and not too spicy, but still provides a great little kick! The rainbow roll was also delicious and had great filling and the topping is thick! I had a few other rolls, but those were the ones that stood out most. I finished with one mango and one strawberry mochi, which were a great palette cleanser. The service was quick and friendly. I look forward to coming back here any time I come to Vegas!

SHQO5750kZhDbR7EhJAhYA.text: We're in Vegas for the week and got lucky we found this place..It's all you can eat sushi is amazing. Truly fresh sushi and they don't over stuff the fish with rice; unlike so many other places. We liked it so much we had it 3 days in a row!! The atmosphere inside was very nice and the lady taking care of us made us feel at home. She recommended different speciality roles for us to try, it all tasted great!!

iB3FLldRa1qwddLOkZK8yQ.text: Got to Vegas with a couple friends late that night and was starving. So as soon as we checked in, we went straight to sushi way.  Pros:  - Sweet Shrimp nigiri (probably the best thing we had that evening) - nigiri section overall...just the right fish and rice ratio - baked green mussels   Cons:  - kamikaze dynamite...too greasy and salty - salmon killer...the baked spicy salmon on the inside was a tad bit on the dry side  Other than those two, this place is definitely worthwhile

zGv_YOAJ0VKtNvb27Ia-ww.text: It is a small place so come early for a table.  The place is packed by 12:30 pm.  Lunch took about 2 hrs to eat.  There are 2-3 waitress and they are running around to get to everyone.  For a party of 6 or more there is automatic service charged included on the bill.  It is clear on the bill, unlike some restaurants that does not point this out.  The variety of selection from cooked food, sushi and sashimi are great.  The desserts were good too:  Michu ice cream, friend banana & ice cream and tempura ice cream. There is also a frequent award cards to get you a free email after the 10 one.

j6ufTUiGGJ0R6qCLy4NVYg.text: Wow sitting here for 55 minutes and had one round of sushi. Folks seated next to us at the same time are on their 4th. Quality seemed ok but service is horrible.

19X9BPB_XJyegzAzS4zc-A.text: Amazing all you can eat sushi. I live in LA and the sushi is amazing to say the least. This spot is my new Vegas go to. Amazingly fresh fish and the rolls were very well put together and the choices are endless. If you like GOOD sushi , this is for sure the spot to try when your gambling show seeing is finished. Highly recommended!!

y7m-ml1iazs4ADo18PUKsQ.text: Really good "all you can eat" sushi place! You won't be able to eat " all sashimi" you could eat but the ones you can order are delicious!! Special attention for the " screaming orgasm !! It's a sashimi with a spice sauce really great! There is lots of options and everything We tried was pretty good and fresh! It's a great option for non expensive Japanese food in Vegas!

7N25fyGi9CeC29MGdQghOw.text: Great service. Our waitress was super sweet and recommended some great rolls. Loved every roll!  So so good. My son got the all you can eat and they were super sweet and brought him 1/2 portions so he could try a bunch. Favorites were the killer salmon and the Big Easy special.  Great find! Thanks Yelp!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jyELwPoLji9aonF70Ug4Ug.text: The sushi was delicious and on point. The waiter was very good to us also. I will definitely be back here soon. It's so amazing for any sushi lovers!

gUVGejfdSHWCUnnB-vbCbg.text: I. Don't. Do. AYCE. But, I do here! This isn't just any AYCE sushi place - it's an a la carte sushi place that offers the full menu at an AYCE price Good sake too!!!

9anSDfYtlIZCKihBFOPc5w.text: FAN. TAS. TIC! My reviews are probably 80% sushi, and those probably don't cover the OTHER 80% of times I flat out forget to check in. Also mostly for sushi. I'm a G.D. sushi fiend..... across 7 states probably 30 major cities I've had a couple metric F tons of sushi in my life. If I didn't already live in Vegas I'd move here for this restaurant. If I ever leave, I will regrettably become an out of towner who comes here 3-4 times a year just to take in the restaurant and gaming scene. It will be for this restaurant alone. Let's start with the basics- apps, The dynamite was incredible. Note, it is smaller than a lot of places sell dynamites. Big things come in small packages. Cucumber w/ crab salad, very very light on the sauce (vinegar) over the cucumber and it was very refreshing! Jalapeno Popper, I will say this one was a tad underwhelming, but I honestly can't put my finger on why. The Jalapeno was fried nicely, good amount of cream cheese not overpowering, the batter was crisp, and the sweet sauce they had on it was amazing, but the sum of it's parts somehow missed the mark. More research is needed =p Nigiri- I liked how fast they came and the quality of them were out of this world. Had to order a dragon roll, pretty basic, what most sushi places should be judged on. It was phenomenal. Again, very fresh, but more than that, it just tasted light and refreshing. It has to be a great balance with how much (little) rice-vinegar there was. A lot of places will be a tad heavy handed with it causing the rice to gum up ever so slightly making it sit harder on your stomach. This place didn't do that and it made a world of difference. I ordered the Go rebel roll, the Sunny Special, and the Chicago Fire. Once again I have to hammer home just how fresh all the fish was, and with the variety they had going on for these rolls I would have suspected one or two pieces to bring something down but nothing ever did. The staff were great, all smiles and helpful. The chefs were superb. Nitpicking (HATE THAT WORD!!) at a few things here and there if you really want to, but I truly don't have any single thing that turned the experience bad. I have to move on from my old sushi joint. Gotta go down Sushi Way!

iAxTBevJCVgbe93k8HHjZQ.text: Hidden is a little strip mall off of Paradise and Flamingo, the food is quite good, cooked fresh upon arrival.  They even know how to make teriyaki chicken correctly.  Their sashimi was just so so, but the tempura was very good.  Service is fast and friendly.

FtwxNXy4-ceyNn3B2KG2tw.text: Review #095 - 2017  We showed up on Monday night, May 1st, around 11 PM and asked for a table for five, three adults and two babies.  The place was pretty much empty except for one other table who were getting ready to finish up and leave.  We had the whole place to ourselves so our food was made pretty quickly.  We started off with a few different rolls and nigiris.  I'm more of the sashimi eater, but my friends were more into the specialty rolls so it made it a little difficult to share with them so we ended up ordering a bunch of separate items.  I think my personal favorite would have to be the super white.  It was very tasty, plus the fact that there's no rice was a bonus.  I ordered 3 orders which consisted of 3 pieces per order.  I think I ate 2 orders to myself.  The bacon scallop skewers were also tasty.  Even my 1-year old daughter had a bite and didn't spit it out.  She also enjoyed a few strands of noodles from the udon noodle soup, which I thought the broth was kind of salty.  The screaming orgasm did not live up to its name at all.  I think they must have misnamed it because I was not feeling the orgasm.  Sorry, TMI!  Glad they limited it to just one order per person because I would've been greedy & ordered more just because of the name.  Haha  The salmon skin hand roll was really dry so I took quite a while to finish it, but everything else that I ordered was good.  The food is probably a 3.5 at best, but I bumped it up to a 4.5 because our waitress was the best that I'd ever encountered.  She was super friendly and accommodating.  I don't think I've ever met anyone who's so good at doing their job.  Sadly, I didn't get her name.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friends said they were very fresh
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fish

YRuJnfH5U70Qhc1XRLxcow.text: Very nice rice to fish ratio if you like nigiri. Also very good selection of appetizers and rolls. The sushi chefs were very attentive. Of course at around 5pm on a Wednesday is when I entered the restaurant. Believe it or not I was the only one in the whole restaurant sitting at the sushi bar.   Tho the sushi chefs were attentive to my needs the waitress for appetizers orders were not as attentive in my opinion. It started out as very attentive then shift changed the the new waitresses was not as attentive as the previous one. Otherwise it would have been a perfect 5 stars.   I wanted to try all their nigiri to test out their freshness, it was a hit and miss. They had salmon belly for the special black board special and it was delicious and unlike some places they didn't limit you which was nice. The fish to rice ratio to me was right on very little rice.    My favorite nigiri's that I tried 1. Squid 2. Octopus 3. Eel 4. Tomago 5. Plain tuna  6. Halibut 7. Albacore 8. Yellow tail   I also tried their gyoza, kalbi and pork belly all very delicious.   I also tried few half rolls cow boy roll was ok, big easy special roll was delicious. I was by myself so it was hard to try many rolls but they did offer half rolls and it wasn't packed with rice but very tightly packed small amount of rice in the rolls. The rolls were very skinny compared to most places in Vegas .  I honestly would rate this place one of the top 5 best all you can eat sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  If your not familiar with the area or just visiting it's very hard to miss the turn into park. The lot was spacious and you must turn into the "the park 3900" plaza on corporate st.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu of rolls

IsQjEnsHinOY0J43FTwi_A.text: Super convenient to have our food delivered to our hotel room. My sushi was delicious. The only downside was the hour long wait time and the hard, inedible avocado that was on the top of sushi. It seemed almost fake.

e0tRiR2D9LCr3LeuiMwXgA.text: Excelent and fresh fish, super nice service, not expensive at all. We forgot our credit card and they were super effective when giving it back.  I loved the dinner all together a lot!

fOdnVRYLCYRWr_HHJRtOSg.text: I have to say the menu items were delicious and all three stars to the food and chefs. The service however sucked. Waiting 15-20 minutes from ordering an item when the place is semi full is ridiculous. Not to mention , how many times do I have to ask for tea or water before actually getting just that. How about 20 minutes and 4 times I asked. If they hire more people it would be better I would hope

-VMRxFOddkoV3WDZDLyRAQ.text: The worst service ever! Took 10 just to get a drink order. Never had menus we had to grab them ourselves. One waitress at peak lunch time. Orders weren't right. I'm always down to give a second chance to a place.

Sn6uTf3TwnCm5edY2roE9A.text: Delivery was on time and correct. The volcano roll is to die for it was still warm when delivered. Overall great experience!

7UNmHcYAiPeq7g1PrhjNRQ.text: We came here immediately after getting off the plane, starving and craving sushi, and we weren't disappointed. It's a nice, clean little place and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Each roll we had was delicious and they didn't skimp on the fish. I would highly recommend this little place!

gRwx5W_GXzGsE0cU3AMz6w.text: I was amazed by how fresh and delicious this AYCE was! The fish was amazing, the rolls tasty and there were plenty of no-rice dishes for people counting carbs. I highly recommend our server Richard and the Rock n Roll and Screaming Orgasm!

Sf_oNhjIUmz-KAkHhf0Amw.text: Very accommodating that we were in a hurry. Food came out super fast and it was all very fresh and delicious! Highly recommended.

HhlxQchsrYEhd4DTjmmG8w.text: Upset, came in at 1:20am and the waitress said we were to late, last call was at 1:30am. So we walked over to the steak house across the street. No problem with saying it's to late, lying is where I got upset.

EhO3_auAfgoHkfGqhjkCxA.text: Best sushi I've had in Las Vegas, hands down. Make sure to get the crispy rice w/ spicy tuna (ask for no eel sauce) and the Sweet 16 roll. Ask for Sune Oak (Monica) as your server. She's amazing. MAKE IT HAPPEN PEOPLE.

0S5SD34lUJlQy7esOFZ2pg.text: Fantastic AYCE sushi.  Much better than the now defunct Todai which I used to frequent when in town.  Fish quality is on par with most standard sushi joints and thereby much better than the average AYCE place.  Nice staff and excellent service!  I will be here every vegas trip.

DPU0L65DLDwzTQ3jzWOPBQ.text: All you can eat sushi was about $26. Service was a bit slow, but they were extremely busy so it was understandable. They also only allow 1 dessert per person and it came in a really small portion so did not quite finish my meal with an exclamation mark. Would definitely recommend this place in the future.

D9XdTBPP7d7WvNITZTC_BQ.text: This is my third time at Sushi Way and each visit has kept me coming back again. The service is great, the chef is friendly, and the sushi is fresh. Not sure what else you could ask for from AYCE sushi.

mcZUmP8qFi15WXh7nkfTSg.text: Not too much rice. Fresh seafood. Super soft and tasty. Great service. Decent price. Best local all you can eat sushi spot!

aS-2Hw2N9AIPtJnF3ghVuw.text: First time ever here. I think it is the best AYCE sushi place I've been to. Uni is delicious, a great selection and fair price.

M0-1mkpvrUIkdSY63dm9kw.text: Simply best sushi place in Vegas, every time we come here with Fam we come here and they never disappoint highly recommend this place if your looking to get some good sushi

P_BJj4kVCbNk4s8jd4EhWw.text: This place is my shit, I stop here when I'm travelling for work. Good priced sushi and it's always dankly fresh. The sushi chefs are chill and they totally have hamachi kama if you are in the in

S0Ard6IMR94wiQKVe-SQrg.text: Service was absolutely terrific and presentation on Sushi was second to none. Definately try the Whos Your Daddy roll!!

c9OL9R10fi7A5USXYRz5dg.text: I only go for he nigiri! It is definitely amazing and not stale at all. My favorite is their salmon and garlic tuna. The waitress that was attending us throughout the night was very attentive.

oNlxNd4czrYMRrGS-FbzIw.text: The food was above my expectations for all you can eat. The staff was also very kind asking what I wanted next. I am writing this review because they treated me wonderful for being a late night random visit.

zP_H8j_ESXrdnN-n0jbKoQ.text: This is a rock and ROLLing sushi joint. Great tunes and service... What more could you want?

rO0AU9XgEPLcoBWtKmKGFQ.text: Went here for AYCE sushi. Food are fresh and delicious. Just need $5 more for more variety of choices for example sea urchin and oysters! Limit one order per person. Service is good and you will get a free drink if you leave review on Yelp :)

YbNMa9kLE4sdZdB8vO-rGw.text: Best AYCE sushi in Vegas. That's a big claim, but I think it's spot on. Small place so hard to get a table on a Friday or Saturday for a big group, but worth the wait. All the rolls are delicious. You get oysters, mussels and galbi beef option, too! You can even order mini udon, shrimp tempura, etc. Goyemon and Sushi Mon are good, too, but everything is sitting on top of a California roll. This one actually has great rolls filled with all different things. Soft shell crab, tuna, etc. Also, the one thing I love is they have kids prices. $14.95 for kids! I'll pay that price as opposed to the other places where you have to pay full price for kids. And if you have a kid that doesn't want sushi, you can pay a la carte. Yeah!!! Love it here!

dQqlXVq6pZ_N0OrS_2OEFg.text: This place has really good service, and good quality food. They really deserve 5 stars. Ivan is pretty clutch too

BPSHulsZoEWgIc_5w3NfrQ.text: Great Ayce sushi place with fresh fish and close to the strip. Great customer service. Great food options.

g82973IPsKyGjn9JsqrLNg.text: Sushi was very good and made very fast. When you here all you can eat sushi you might get worried. I can tell you this is not a problem here. It was all fresh made. I ate a ton.

9JVfG9HbFomR6XvWcbOYnA.text: This is a cool new place in town! The fish was fresh and full of flavors! The salmon is not a very big cut but the rice portion is small so it's balance! It's not busy for a saturday noon so the service was fast! Our waitress was really nice! She went back and forth to ask us if we need anything and she didn't forget our order! Definitely come back here soon

N6PiAukqDo8FVxPBOzk2dQ.text: Gotta try Sex Bomb and I Love Sushi rolls.....delicious!  June the owner is the man!!!! Menu is filled with great items.

CctfeMcpiX7NhFK4mJ3gTg.text: Just got into Vegas and made a quick stop for sushi. Reviews were right. I don't usually like all you can eat sushi but this was good!  Definitely coming back next time we are in town.

je_cgEQOTy5UDdRDMD81Sg.text: Friendly staff and the owner is so sweet and such an awesome personality! The sushi was good and at a reasonable price. Got the All You Can Eat. We were the only customers in on a Sunday night. Food came out pretty fast. If you search this place on iPhone maps it does not have the correct directions. Must search using like google maps.

gapX02jhd8Mz8AQx1kkHWQ.text: Came here because we were in the area and they had really good reviews. We are glad we did! Nice cozy place, great people here, and the food is great!!! Would definitely recommend this sushi restaurant. The poki tuna salad is the best!! Has a little spice to it.

kenmU4kTQVegW4oZBeTSEQ.text: The BEST Sushi we have ever had! Every roll was amazing. Wish we lived here as we would come back every week! You do not want to pass this place up!

GUCOeXGU5UKl1A5AerUp-Q.text: The selection is huge and reasonably priced for sure. I was surprised that the sushi was so fresh and very tasty.  Ambience is plain but clean. The server that helped us was super fun and helpful. Definitely great tip for them and will be back.

7rscU_Rp00-YnRonMOcJQA.text: We do all you can eat and waiting for long time to get our second round sushi. Also, we did order the Eel sushi, but we waiting for a long time, we double check with the guy who took our order, he said yes, we have it, need to wait for a little bit and said its busy. We had been waiting for this order more than half hour. After we double check with somebody else. We found out he did not put this order in. At the first time we double check with him he should do double check not just yes, it's busy.

dLixc1RwOnhiGToekbxktA.text: Sooo delicious! They're all you can eat is the best I've had in Vegas! You have to try the coconut shrimp tempura & the sexy lazy roll.. the staff is great, super friendly :)

w78671RE2YAhasHR34OkIw.text: Saw the reviews and decided to try this place out. Right when we walked in we were greeted and seated within seconds. Richard served us and he is awesome! He definitely made our first time a great time!   The menu for AYCE is nicely organized so it made ordering food easy. The names for some of the rolls are pretty funny. Richard tries to catch you off guard so you can say "I love my ass" (name of a roll) haha. Look out for him, he's awesome!   The presentation for the rolls were absolutely stunning especially the "cherry blossom" roll (beware this roll is loaded with avocado). They didn't drench the rolls with sauces and the fish tasted pretty fresh. All the rolls we ordered were delicious. The chicken teriyaki bento was worth it! So definitely try that too!   This is gonna be added to our list of sushi spots. Don't forget to ask for a stamp card so you can get an AYCE for free.

84bCpTEyfbi-fBz0g3x0Yg.text: This restaurant feels good from the moment you walk in. The staff is wonderful, fast and friendly. The food is very well prepared and reasonably priced. The whole restaurant is immaculately clean and inviting. I highly recommend...

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most awesome and friendly staff the food is even better!

f5G92e5yx0Y3fF1eMW4abg.text: Very good AYCE sushi. Went here for lunch in early Sept and service was great, sat at the bar and go to order quickly and didn't have to wait at all for orders.  The place was not busy at the time we went.  The fish was fresh but for nigiri it was a bit limited for lunch, no uni, ama ebi.  We enjoyed this place and will return when we go back to Vegas.

XFCgixvD6elbuJbPBRSWdQ.text: We read all the reviews and they are spot on. Great sushi! Try the cherry blossom or the carrot top roll!! Everything was outstanding. The staff was incredibly and genuinely friendly. PS I also suggest adding masago to your rolls.

gu8xLo5rZ82bpURgRLcu0A.text: Excellent service, great quality food! The staff was friendly and the chefs prepare the food rather quickly but to quality standards. Sizeable menu which includes sashimi with the all you can eat, so they are not trying to fill you up with rice. Make sure you try the honey bread for dessert. Definitely recommending to local friends and anyone visiting that wants great quality sushi at a great price!

P0HPMeSheYOaT9DtlHaCww.text: Good service, get the fried ice cream. I ordered the salmon killer roll and the I love sushi roll and did not like either of them.

fijSyIjYE7LPe7U0ifD6_g.text: Sushi way wasn't bad but it wasn't mind blowing, either. It was so-so.   I wish they had a half star. I think three stars is too low but four stars rating is a bit high. I give them 3.5 stars.   The sushi nigiris were okay. I think, the best one would be the super white. However, the consistency in making it isn't constant. My first nigiri had just a bit of spicy drizzle on top. My second nigiri was soaking in sauce. :/  In terms of freshness... the fish on the sushi nigiris did taste like they kinda had been on ice for a few hours. For ex. the salmon nigiri was kinda dull in complexion, it wasn't shiny. It tasted a bit milky but wasn't as milky as the other ones I've tried in other Ayce.   The tuna in the tuna salad had a weird consistency. Unlike chopped tuna I've tried before... their tuna was kinda gelatin in consistency. It didn't taste bad but the consistency was throwing me off.  I also tried their sushi nachos. I think that's my favorite out of everything I've tried. However, they soaked it too much with sauce. :/ They should just have a side sauce for the sushi nachos.   Because of reviews online... I ended up wanting to try their honey bread. OMG. It was super sweet. They shouldn't have drizzled it with honey and then chocolate syrup. The bread itself was already sweet. I should have just ordered a scoop of green tea ice cream. Sigh.   Service was fast, which I was happy about. However, they weren't that busy that day.

Pdyil6oqwOq8Z-Gwsjj4kw.text: Went here for dinner on a Monday night and got seated right away. Great service and quality of fish! Everything was perfect!

kh9Mq4XTW9ilDiosEyN9Qw.text: Came here on Saturday on my very last night in Vegas. My girlfriend and I enjoyed the food they provided for us. Our food did take awhile to get to us but we were compensated with a bottle of sake and halibut. Would definitely come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viva Las Vegas roll
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only 2 oysters but was worth it

dIXnhBTHnJ_R33u-E7jeIA.text: This place is great!  Food: no complaints, we didn't order the all you can eat, we did all sushi and rolls and everything was great. The Super White Tuna with Jalapenos was amazing, as was the Dancing Eel roll.  Ambience: This is your standard sushi restaurant.   Service: Ask for Richard, he is an amazing waiter, make sure you ask for the Korean Saki!  Tip: Order the Honey Bread for desert you will not be disappointed.

FLCM3-u_kNsoZcW_pWw7lw.text: This restaurant is amazing !! I strongly recommend for an all you can eat. They serve fresh sashimi and delicious sushi

cz5wCQVhD0ZnLqXybdq4MQ.text: Lisa hand roll was Excellent!  Great service. AYCE on a Saturday at 1130.   Highly recommended. Fish quality was excellent

vEcwA4NW5KxOZnuo-v25Gg.text: My husband and I had AYCE option and the food wasn't bad nor good. The Food was kinda bland to me, especially those with garlic or ponzu sauce has no flavors. It needs a little kick to it. They do have big portions of fish on the nigiri though and cooked items are not bad either.  On the other hand, the service wasn't quite there, they need more uplifting spirited ppl working there. Waiters was kinda ehhh....its not good for a start up business and the layout or lighting was not welcoming, it felt cold but hope all is well for this business . Oh lastly , they said fresh oysters on the menu wasn't fresh at all... It smelled like rotten seafood that my husband couldn't eat it so I had to eat it all and the consequences wasn't good.... :(  will I return? Maybe in the future to see if any improvements on food and place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy yellowtail hand roll w/ avocado
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy rice w/spicy tuna
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño poppers

7jN47XvKhnnuEumyqwMjPA.text: This is my second night in a row at Sushi Way.  Really friendly, great service and excellent food.  I recommend the Chicago Fire Roll and the spicy garlic edamame.  Added bonuses- they play great music, have an awesome atmosphere, and a big screen TV behind the sushi bar.

KSfSiyEKoLlIjtrNDcOkeg.text: Excellent AYCE sushi spot, they offer half rolls. Great service. Parking can get crazy on the weekends.

6e4wEFa0P1bNLG-z-wPpbA.text: Definitely better than expected.  Super fast service and food is not bad.  The kids got a kick out of the of the sushi.

mr6gyz6h4F4PpmHWMK-k9g.text: Out in Vegas for business and my boyfriend and I had only 1 thing in our agenda... AYCE SUSHI! I did a quick yelp search of what was closest to our hotel and found this spot with 5 stars .   To say the least, we were really blown away by the top-notch service, unique flavors and fresh selection at Sushi Way. The salmon tartar, poke and sashimi were all solid. In addition our waiter was so kind to offer all the best recommendation. Some of the unique things we tried were the Sexy Lady (topped with coconut) and the Carrot top ( topped with fried carrots). I was really impressed to see some of these dishes that have never been done before.    This will likely be my new "go to" spot when I make the trip out again. Hats off to the staff for a job well done!

wr4r0_qXDthotIDpfRQomw.text: The 4 stars are because the food was good but they need more staff, the service was very slow... Yes I will come back and hope that they did better

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey bread delicious

Ny6uOTw8XUsmmuX9KkZPMw.text: Unbelievable menu.... $26 and I am stuffed!!  Plus I received a free Diet Coke for posting.  I will be back!

Hczpd7u_PmyEvN0QABRzDQ.text: This restaurant is so warm and the staffs are friendly too. The food is awesome. I probably will come back !!!

nBl78c4AhUQ17VlQ6FjyXQ.text: We came here with our friends who came her once before. It's off the strip so not a well known place but has excellent reviews and we found them on yelp. Well the reviews don't lie. The food is amazing. But the service.... well it's impeccable. Sun was our waitress and while we were not the easiest because my husband has a shellfish allergy we needed some serious accommodations, she made it happen. She allocated a single chef to us to make his food so that it would not be mixed with shellfish. Even though this was not an easy task she made sure to get it done. We greatly appreciate it. There was  also a bus girl and i didn't catch her name but she was super friendly and on top off things. Oh and did I mention this place has all you can eat for $26. No joke. You can have as many things as you want off the menu.  It was a really good meal for an amazing price with excellent service. We will be back!!!

CZpwdAExZO_l9j4sfeOB3g.text: I really really wanted to give them a 4 star rating but the food is the star and it wasn't even close to that so like 3.3 rating I guess. I'm basically rating this a 3 because of a couple things. AYCE sushi is one of my favorite things to eat and I always order the same things I would get at other establishments and compare them to each other. I feel like everything here is covered in eel sauce or yum yum or ponzu here. it's not a bad thing but it's also not a good thing. I really like those flavors but when every dish seem to taste the same it gets boring. rice doesn't stay together on the nigiri and that's a big no no. the fish quality was ok it wasn't the best. I also think that the people that are working here need to be a little more educated on sushi we asked the waitress if she knew what deep fried shrimp heads were and she acted like we were crazy to mention it like what is that? Lol kinda funny but I think they have the location to get the people in but I think there are many other sushi places that are way better than this place. oh I will say my favorite thing here was the salmon skin handroll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my fave salmon skin handrolls
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this was good too
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cucumber roll

02rhxDuydrKSznBdp7dc0A.text: In Vegas for a basketball tournament and ate at this sushi joint near our hotel. This place was bomb. If ever around this part of Vegas check it out. Damian and his brother (both chefs) took care of ordering for me. His two other brothers also having dinner there were cool as hell as well.

ZF2OFTBrZTP-8gd9_fHA2Q.text: Amazing! Best sushi in Las Vegas. All you can eat, very helpful and fun staff. Highly recommended.

AOrMZd9nX5z1PDAzAz-4Lg.text: Went here for my 10th time.  Had Damien as my Sushi Chef, who worked at Jjanga before.  Ordered various Nigiri pieces, and one roll:  Spider.  Had the Hamachi Kama that was added on the chalkboard and worth the $26.95 dinner price by itself.  Also had vegetable tempura, coconut shrimp, calamari, and miso soup that were par excellance as usual.  The Baked Mussels now have bacon added to the spicy mayo topping, didn't expect that but plesantly surprised, amd the oyster shooters were okay, but were at least cleaned and shucked.  They offer fresh wasabi upon request, a huge plus!  I had Damien put the Uni over Salmon roe on two Nigiri pieces and it was dee-lish!  Hint to future customers:  tip your sushi chef directly in cash, they'll show you how appreciative they are for it.  Sadly, I heard Choo Choo left to start his own restaurant, but Jun (the Owner) has his cool AYCE sushi joint adequately staffed.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mussel with bacon in the spicy mayo.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Kama (Yellowtail Collar)
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Shrimp

eXSqqV0J5yw59HYRVv6YDQ.text: I've been to many sushi places in Vegas ranging from cheap to the VERY expensive and Sushi Way is still very the best sushi in Vegas! Better quality food and great friendly staff. I bring everyone to Sushi Way. *the super white tuna is the best!!

8F8GtNCy1QzMPHmnCM-ksA.text: Not the greatest ayce sushi, just average.  Had a lot better everywhere else.  The service was good and attentive, but the food was ok.  The coconut shrimp was probably the best dish I had there.  The plus was that it is close to the strip.

bS1jQDktB56xXxUE8FD-Qg.text: A great place to have an All-You-Can-Eat sushi dinner! Very friendly and fast service, fresh and great tasting sushi selections, nice ambience, ... The list goes on. I love sushi and consider myself an above average sushi expert, and this place delivers!  Very fresh fish, good rice preparation, good balance of fish portion vs rice.  Sushi pieces are a bit on the small size, but for an AYCE, this works to  It is not a big place and can get crowded quickly, and so go a little early in the evening if possible.  Coconut shrimp and raw oysters safe wonderful side dishes, too. Galbi is also a great addition, though it is a sushi restaurant. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

17-hZ1Y_yrfAVhcQFMwo7Q.text: Nice small sushi bar great staff, standard all you can eat prices I've been there for lunch and dinner, fish are fresh. The all you can eat menu is pretty big and has a nice variety of things to try. The food I give 4 stars to but the staff I would give 5 stars very friendly

r9dSJzOYxgI3DZ56RESWXg.text: I have developed a True appreciation for well-done sushi, & this place does not disappoint.   The problem that I have with  restaurants (provided, of course, that their food is well-done- fresh, good proportions, variety of ingredients, decent-sized pieces, & preferrably at least a couple of rolls that set them apart from their competitors) is that I tend to find 1 or 2 rolls that I particularly like, but I don't want to have to travel from 1 place to the next to get a full meal. Plus, I prefer AYCE- takes the stress off.   This place is my current favorite- living up to my requirements, plus having several interesting rolls.    The only suggestion I would make is to add a dessert roll. Preferably something with bananas   Professional but fun staff. Even when they are painfully understaffed, tgewy manage to be pleasant & friendly (I've only seen this happen once). Sit at the bar for a more personal experience

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tQD8884_Ip04lSQQGOHcPw.text: Great sushi for a great price. Second time here and will continue coming back. "Snow White" is a must!!

NKmLT1T0s3XwB7iEw9kBWw.text: Our favorite place in Vegas! Excellent selection! So happy we chose this place for dinner. We ordered sweet 16 roll, eel roll, volcano roll, sushi pizza, many other sushimi specials which were amazing. Don't forget to order dessert at the end too. The green tea ice cream was very tasty. Definitely got our money's worth. Not far from the strip and easy parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bYDPSAmgxvVLVVOmL1HftQ.text: Many choices of rolls with interesting combinations of flavors.  Nice lunch all you can eat with a bunch of choices to choose from. Affordable price  I highly recommend it.

lVmTXyxbSBcD2sQiyEPe0A.text: 100% excellent Sushi and great price. A+ I was not expecting it to be so amazing in flavor.

p9Zu6v1v0JHiSc8J7vMZow.text: This place is silly! One of the best AYCE places I've ever eaten. Can't wait to go back next month. They don't overload the rice which is great! Not far from the strip, but we had a rental car. Price is reasonable. Rolls are awesome.

xyH4JUhMp4RcLfDgRictIg.text: Was craving some sushi so we looking around and found this awesome place. The service was excellent and food was awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone.

NRIspkze3dZUnsL0cRQw2Q.text: Came in after drais! Nice place!! WILL BE BACK! LOVE some good sushi!! Visiting vegas from Cali

1ovk0OzfqYXG0MuvuGoIjQ.text: Sushi and service were great!  Nice honey hole tucked away in a strip mall. Fresh ingredients and cold beer

Xyn_VkhRWJlsKzned5-UPw.text: First time here, came with the family because we saw the good reviews on yelp. First thing, if you can EAT please do get all you can eat because the rolls are pretty small. I ordered the Kiss of Fire roll, it was amazing and spicy which I loved but I wish the roll was bigger. Kids had California rolls and they liked it.  My son is a pretty good eater and he didn't get full. He's 10. Husband ordered the Hawaii roll and was unhappy because the fish wasn't fresh and the roll was too small so he was disappointed. Don't think we'll be back.

33NWKiFjMDXoxKAxKgVuNQ.text: This experience went 100-0 real quick.  When we got there the place wasn't crazy busy. We got seated right away and the servers were genuinely super nice and on top of things!  The rolls were decent, we tried the following:  Rolls-  Tiger Shrimp Lover Freaky Friday Baked Salmon Spider Hot and Juicy Lisa Hand Roll  Appetizers-  Cucumber Crab Salad Seaweed Salad Screaming Orgasm Sweet and Spicy Potstickers Tempura Calamari  Dessert-  Strawberry Mochi duh  Like I said the rolls were decent but I'm sad to say we will not be returning due to the horrendous wait time to receive rolls.  There was a time we waited 28 minutes for a roll.   I get they only had two sushi chefs but there were times when we saw rolls waiting for ten plus minutes to be picked up and taken to tables. It's unfair to blame the chefs when they're doing their job.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa Hand Roll, Shrimp Lover Roll, Spider Roll, and a Tiger Roll
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming Orgasm and cucumber crab salad

6-0i3wsrt4T89fU52FBuFA.text: Best all you can eat sushi in all of Las Vegas.   I'm from San Jose ca.  And every time we come to Vegas sushi way is one of our must stop.  Their sushi is so flavorful I don't need soy sauce and wasabi just to make it taste better.   This restaurant will not skimp on their fish as well.  More fish than rice.   So worth it.   Highly recommended.

lTYj4Ml7DODeo4dYuWqE-w.text: We tried this place a few years ago, the food was good, but the service was so SLOW. They told us that one of their sushi cutters had called in sick. We were there for over 3 hours altogether, waiting 15 plus minutes between each roll!  We decided to try it again last week, just in case that one time was a fluke. BAD IDEA. After sitting for over 20 minutes and only getting a hand roll and some tempura shrimp, my husband couldn't take it anymore. We paid for what we had eaten and told the girl we were leaving. She told us AGAIN that their sushi cutter had called in sick. Ridiculous.  We left and went to Sakana and had amazing service and sushi. There are so many great AYCE sushi places in Vegas, but this is not one of them.

Y67M1qKsO_EG4xr2Q8H63w.text: The sushi is delicious, the waitress are polite. This is the second time that my wife and I have dinner here.

lTZiOVvKJe_B-oDXLwcuPA.text: Quality of the sushi is one of top quality I have eaten. Portion size is fairly small which can be a good or bad thing depending on your preference.   The reason I knocked off one star is because of two things:  (1) with the small portion of the sushi, there's considerable amount of rice. I'm very picky with the fish to rice ratio. (ONLY applies to nigiri, not rolls) (2) it's quite dark inside. Most of lamps have those yellow halogen bulbs which makes everything look yellow and dim. Also, the bathroom toilet light bulb was out and it was hard to see the toilet paper.   Servers were very nice.

OeN9J1LAmAGXiYsDRGRe4Q.text: All. You. Can. Eat. Need I say more. And more over it's super extra delish. Everything we ordered was extra fresh and tasted great.  Go here. Eat here.

1t2HemMmd916ORKIJcJTeQ.text: some of the best ayce sushi we have ever had. fast friendly, pretty awesome. everything was fresh, tasty, and prepared quickly. just what we needed after a long day of walking.

3LPcfFOj2dpWBiTApNRVCQ.text: Definitely recommend this place fresh fish great dishes really clean and friendly staff ..... Alaska roll is a must for me ..... Please visit sushi way and enjoy their sushi

a8ZHvNjKbpNSGxRaPTBcrw.text: Love this off the strip Sushi joint. We ate off the all you can eat menu and the food was amazing. Service was very friendly and prompt throughout the entire meal. Unlike many all you can eat menus, the choices were very creative and delicious. Definitely will come here again during my next trip into town.  Try the Honey Bun for desert. You won't be disappointed.

Y_ssv3SoSHNNRIq4P8mgtg.text: My girlfriends & I yelped this place since we're from outta town & were craving some sushi. The food was amazing & the service was good too. The owner (a young woman I think?) even gave us ice cream. The only thing is when my friend & I ordered our bento boxes we didn't get the miso soup & when I asked about it the male server said I had to request it, & also my bento came with no salad. I thought that was a little odd since the menu said it came with it, but no biggie, then fish was fresh & rolls were amazing anyways! :)

O7c2Jzt6Pjo_cmERDrWVdg.text: First time eating here fish was so fresh and cold!!! Not one thing I ordered wasn't the best I ever had!! The owner/chef was so nice and on top of everything will tell everyone about this spot

UaOjWGADyRhmb5JAgun3pg.text: quite good food.  the waitress was funny and very attentive.  try the Japanese lasagna it was very tasty and I have never seen it before at a sushi restaurant.

f4ngPtePpXg0_iE9mhOw3Q.text: Best AYCE place in Vegas! Better than Yama, Kaya, Doh, sushi twister, sakana, goyemon, sushi mon, etc. My server is always this tall dark and handsome guy too, nice plus.

NuX4iHSMoQEubs4n0FH_ow.text: I'm from Southern California and Sushi seemingly is available on every corner, so when my friend and I decided we wanted Sushi for lunch we spotted this a block from our hotel and took a chance. Let me tell you, it smokes every place I've been to in Cali! We had multiple different items, and ALL of it is super fresh and delish! Specifically the Ono and Halibut sushi! Don't pass this place up, price is right, atmosphere is perfect and the service was perfect! Everyone was very friendly as well, we will DEFINITELY be back!

SWk10HsLeRphHTsVuerNTw.text: My taste buds are off right now so have to disclose that first. I had yellowtail tuna first and it was amazing. I just didn't like much after that with the exception of the coconut shrimp tempura. Since my taste buds are off, I didn't take off for that. A couple of things to note that I didn't read anywhere. On the menu it said no leftovers. I thought it meant you could not take leftovers on AYCE. Makes sense. I found out that it meant you have to eat all the plate to get other things. Different than other AYCE I had gone to. You can share with anyone in your group getting AYCE too. Alas, I was traveling alone so I didn't have that advantage. The waitress was a bit rude about it but let me do leave some. So you must know you are going to like it before you order. I did half orders which helped but I don't know how I would know if I would have liked something new without tasting it. Wish it would have been explained better when I sat down espically since they get lots of tourists. With that said, I really liked the food and would go back now that I understand the rules better. The yellowtail tuna was like butter. I had like 8 pieces and it was hard to stop. Could not get enough.

f2IFBfIdbIde3JpBujntjg.text: I went here a couple of weeks ago, and I enjoyed it. The food was great, the staff was nice, I'm going again tonight, but so far I have to say, GOOD FOOD!

HXJ73g6QMyhBRQ6ucaN4NQ.text: Everywhere I travel,  I find a sushi joint. I chose this one for the number of positive reviews compared to other places. (And I always take any negative ones with a grain of salt)  I am glad I came here, it couldn't have been much better. The sushi was very fresh and the chef has some unique twists I never had before (like searing several rolls right in front of you).   The owner was our chef. He was super friendly and fun. Whenever I come back to Vegas, this will be a mandatory stop every time!!

0n4WCxzPkXElyMpgoRKfJA.text: I'm pretty picky when I eat out but this place really hits the spot. They just opened not long ago and their food and service is very good. I'm definitely coming back! Thanks chef! Thanks sushi way!

rs5pU3w6HeU1zs2LWHGcKQ.text: Great ayce sushi! Be sure to have Jay as your server, his suggestions were spot on.  The menu had so many great items and rolls, so go with a group so you can try different ones, but be sure to get the screaming orgasm app. You'll wish you could get multiples.

0o41HU5Pvg_IpSWuxAThgg.text: Ivan wow this man made the best sushi experience for my wife and I. We had such a blast!!! The sushi is awesome and this chef Ivan knows how to deliver an amazing sushi experience. Thank you we will be back!!

Sac1cY43qyYmZj4hIPNLJA.text: Service was so attentive, quick, courteous (Jane). Price to value ratio great. I thought the tap water was kind of off, but my husband thought it was fine.

uiX1bOyIwCqBgkNPWIQxRw.text: In Las Vegas on a business trip and wanted GOOD sushi at a fair price. After my coworkers and I talked about it, we decided to try Sushi Way. In a nutshell, we weren't dissapointed. The sushi was made to order and the selection was broad. If you had something you wanted that wasn't on the menu, they will make it for you. Also included was a nice selection of hot items like tempura. All you can eat for $27 or the price of 2 rolls. Enjoy!

GTJ6LciS3fO_qSslFNrp-A.text: Excellent food and reasonable prices a little off the strip  Sushi is fresh with a lot of flavor.  Combo dinners had a typical bento appearance with a nice variety of different items.  Salad, Potato salad, gyoza   Would highly recommend. Came back again.

1MomW4evXE2MfAzSvYZ52A.text: Fantastic place! The fish is first rate. Particularly enjoyed the amebi, hamachi, and the albacore. Nigiri is nicely made with just the right amount of rice, ie, not too much. The ability to order half rolls is perfect for being able to try different combinations without filling up too quickly. Will definitely return here on my next trip to LV!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The 2 @ss rolls: the &#34;fat @ss&#34; and &#34;I love my @ss&#34;. The names are ridiculous but the taste is phenomenal.
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White tuna and hamachi with jalapeños.

kbGcdZuvjnRZcBu_FrkBlg.text: The sushi was so good and fresh I couldn't believe it was only 25 a person. Could've had more attentive service but overall awesome staff. Go try!

N-1SwdWsz2WVlu8VgWBJYw.text: Came to Vegas for meeting, wanted Japanese food without paying an-arm-and-a-leg. Saw other good reviews decided to give it a try. It was a good decision. IPjJxCHPc9W8w-1B1HJJ5w.text: Best AYCE sushi I've had in Vegas.  Great selection and the AYCE menu includes a variety of plates, including non-sushi ones (nigiri, side dishes, etc.)

IyBu-u2KjJiukiF7YUO4Bg.text: This is a great AYCE sushi restaurant I'm surprised I haven't tried this place sooner!! We ordered a wide variety of nigiri sushi and they were all very fresh! They even have oysters on the half shell.. most AYCE places do not offer that. The salmon belly, Cajun albacore and seared tuna were simply amazing and are must haves.   Our server Ploy was fantastic. She took our orders quickly and the food also came quickly. She was attentive and was also very nice. Our whole party ate a lot and definitely had a good time.   I'd certainly come back in the future and I'd recommend this place to everyone.

nR0YNz_YvmLvmdILmDlt0w.text: Me & my boyfriend always come here since we moved up here (: we love it here!! Servers are always great & sushi is always fresh!  Reasonable price.   After 10th AYCE you can get one free with the stamp card.

gA3OpYfhAq5hsEmn64fCJA.text: Came here last night (Wednesday) for the All You Can Eat (AYCE) offering. It was $26.99/person.   Service was very good. They were attentive and took my order quickly. There were minor mistakes (salmon hand roll wasn't placed the first time and they split up the check wrong but both were corrected quickly).   The oysters, galbi, seared tuna slices, uni nigiri, and sweet shrimp nigiri are only allowed 1 order per person which was ok due to price.  Oysters were decent (fresh enough, flavor good) but considering place and price, I'll say it's very good when it comes to bang for buck.   Uni and sweet shrimp was excellent in freshness and flavor.   Galbi was a lil over cooked (I like my beef bloody) for my taste but still very good.   The seared tuna slices was called Mouth Orgasm. I find it ok. Flavor was fair. Found the sear good enough.   Nigiri: Salmon roe wasn't good. The roe was a bit dehydrated. The yellowtail was good. Garlic yellowtail was delicious. Perfect balance of garlic and fish. Seared salmon was good but not mind blowing. The eel was excellent. Perfect sauce, eel, and rice balance. Halibut was ok. It was a lil tough for nigiri. Surf clam was very good, fresh and not tough. The fresh scallop was good. The mackerel itself was very good but unfortunately drenched in way too much vinegar that made it too sour and the rice was about to fall apart.   Rolls: I didn't have the one roll but I had a piece of the soft shell crab roll. That one was very good.   Handroll: Salmon skin was good but not my thing. I'm used to a lightly floured and fried savory salmon skin, really crispy in a handroll. This one was only slightly crispy drenched in some sweet, soy based sauce. The flavor was ok but I didn't like the sauce completely drenching the seaweed, making it soggy. If they didn't put so much sauce, I think I'd like it so much more and I'd highly recommend.   Seaweed salad: Would've been very good if the vinegar base sauce wasn't so sour. Need to not put so much sauce on things!  Tempura ice cream: I really enjoyed it as the fried batter was decently light. The ice cream was average. Overall, was too sweet for my taste but I still loved it.   Overall, I took away a star due to them putting way too much sauce on vinegar based pieces that made it hard to eat. From a bang for buck perspective, this place is definitely a 5 Star. Most things were fresh and for a AYCE, the fish quality was really good. It's expected that they don't use Japanese sushi rice with mirin. I've gone to numerous AYCE Japanese buffets in Hong Kong and US. This one has pretty good bang for buck ratio.
