VD1yXEWfjRmnnKTOZ4-yeA.text: Amazing food, great service. I really don't know how they do it for $26 all u could eat. 4NUxqtx1o64MNAScFOw2GA.text: Stopped by before heading back to Cali.... small cute place, it wasn't packed when we arrived for lunch so I was very surprised it took forever to get our food.  The rolls were ok, average size. We tried a good selection from the menu for the AYCE but nothing "wow" that stood out. The fried FAT ASS rolls were too fried, hard as a rock.  The only thing I didn't like was the service was s-l-o-w.... like unbelievably slow, the servers were nice but can't understand why it took so long for our rolls to be made. We waited over 10mins for the sushi nigiri.  When we come back to Vegas again, we'll probably find another sushi place to check out.

RgJfom_KLoi3OwH9akm2YQ.text: Cool laid back environment, really chill music. The sushi masters are friendly and nice! The food!!!! Omg the fish is fresh and delicious, I ordered a sexy lazy roll and it was like the best that ever touched my lips. The nigiri is delicious and the sushi nacho was so unique and married sweet and spicy flavors really well.    Our server was attentive and funny and she gave good suggestions. I normally go to kaya because I get off at work at midnight and it's hard to find late night sushi places. I'm so happy we tried this place out, we're definitely coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honey bread super yummy
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi nacho, comes it 2 pieces

7847D36kV7PVuZ_9oTXtog.text: OH SNAP!!   I am not going to lie, my favorite food is sushi and I have gone to so many sushi bars including non-ayce AND ayce and this place has to be the BEST AYCE SUSHI I have ever had in 20+ years of my life. This is my REAL and HONEST review. It is so unfortunate that I cant express and write everything on here on Yelp. JUST COME AND TRY IT YOURSELF.  Warning though, I think this restaurant is pretty new. You know what that means? The waiters and waitresses are soooooooo new and they are DEFINITELY not fully trained YET so they are freaking slowwwww. I mean REAL slow and even if you are trying to get their attention, they are caught up with whatever they are doing so wont give all their time to you, which is a bit upsetting.  But, let me talk about sushi now, after all, this place is AYCE sushi restaurant. OHEMGEE, the freshest fish ever!! Every piece I had at the day of my visit, had AWESOME flavor, cut and presentation. I was very very impressed. One thing that I really admired about this sushi bar was that they cut the fish after they get your order. Why is that surprising? Well, many of AYCE places have cut their fish in advance so that they can make sushi a lot faster to serve a big mass of people. I guess it is convenient for them but its not necessarily good for us. Fish can get dry and the taste will definitely be different. I dont know if that played a big role but my sushi tasted GREAT! I loved it and I ate so much.  Their hamachi was seriously the best I have ever had at any AYCE places. To top that hamachi, their AMAEBI WAS BOMB. I seriously have NEVER seen this AMAEBI QUALITY ANYWHERE (AYCE) before. Period. It was HUGE, MEATY and SWEET! I dont remember every one of them but everything I tried was so good. Their special for the night included Salmon Belly and DEAR, it was fatty and it just melted in my mouth. I love SALMON and it was just PERFECT.  Now shifting to the appetizers, I only tried one, Coconut shrimp tempura and I am soooo glad I ordered that because it was amazingly good. The sushi chef actually recommended it and I absolutely devoured it. In fact, I ordered twice!! I really like that they come out warm and super crispy, fresh out of the fryer. Again, not many places do this. They usually have a lot of them fried, and just kind of give it to us, semi-warm and it is never crispy. Batter was ultra thin and shrimp was large. There were just the right amount of coconut on the outside batter, and it was just sooooo good!  They have honey bread as one of the options in the desserts, which is very rare to find elsewhere. It was pretty good but please order it without the ice cream, whip cream and chocolate drizzle. I only like to eat the honey bread. It was crusty and tasted good. It would have been a lot better if I knew it was coming out like that with all the extra that I dont care about.  To make things short, you will never find this quality at any other AYCE restaurants. They are at their best right now especially since they just opened. I hope they keep it the same and never downgrade. I will definitely come back whenever I am coming back to Vegas! You locals are lucky to have AYCE places like Sushi Way

QZAXjTsWlteIKesjkEsRXw.text: The bar, my spot. Love the sushi chefs they are funny and make some delicious specials!!! Like you don't know what you getting but always never disappoint!!! Must try!!! I'm a regular!!! Get a stamp card!!!! And get your free all you can eat!!!

gic31GwVni8oRVBlc2p21w.text: OK, I'm writing this review as I'm eating so I can remember what I'm ordering. Hope it will be helpful as I'm rating each dish on a 5 scale. Starting off the meal with all their one order only specials including a screaming orgasm-5 , oysters -3, Galbi -4, and sweet shrimp -4.5.   Round two I'm trying a  fat ass -5-different,  something wrong 69 -4.5-orgasm sauce is awesomeness ,  Oh! Jenna -5-like the sweetness of the eel sauce, Sexy lazy Special -5,  DD -2.5-bland, and  sushi burrito -3.  Ok, so I can eat a lot. You can also order half rolls so you can try more AND I have a friend helping out. Here's some more.  Spicy tuna tar tare -3 not very spicy Salmon killer -4 Jose special -3.5 Volcano roll -4odd combo OMG -5 Garlic yellowtail -4 Candy Cane -4basic   Dessert time. Liked the honey bread but the pineapple sorbet was the perfect end to the meal.   Service is good for a place like this. Nice, accommodating waitress. A couple orders seemed to get lost. Not a big deal. The bathroom could use a lock. Luckily nobody walked in on me.  Overall you won't be disappointed here. Many of the rolls are very clever. Good A.Y.C.E. sushi for a very reasonable price and we had no wait on a Sunday night.

zELjtaMiQ-ncsdxXAeFPmw.text: I'm visiting here from Hawaii and my family and I  were dying for some sushi. We decided to come here since it's conveniently close to the strip and our hotel.   The all you can eat is well worth the price you pay.  They also have dinner specials that is served with 8 piece California roll, tempura (shrimp and vegetable), fried gyoza, house salad, potato salad, and the main course varies depending on what set you chose (I chose the salmon teriyaki.   The wait wasn't long and it was a Saturday night. Great service and environment to eat with friends or family! I will definitely would come back.

uEIP9Ob-zq4D7BDxjbgNlw.text: Las Vegas, sushi ,right, it's  off the coast of Nevada.   I was advised to find a good Japanese  restaurant  with raw fish, Me entiendes? Well after a bit of research and people asking while hiking, this was my choice for my only real meal this trip to Vegas. Heard there were lots of shitty sushi places on the strip and this was a Vegas local favorite, just a short distance where tourists don't go. Well I have never been steered wrong with this advise.  Wow, in all honesty some of the best poke I have had that was not in  the south Pacific. Really really good quality tuna . The seared salmon app was pretty good as well.  Short ribs were decent. Salad, miso were pretty standard. Yellow tail was good, the escolar was good, I forget what it was called as I did not order it, but is was good.  I wish I could have eaten more, but man I'm  not so much the fat boy anymore.  In my raw fish experience this was really,really good. In Vegas,LA. or where ever, you blow a ton of cash for raw fish, but I'm not so sure it's worth it.  Let's  just use a bit of logic, in the USA where are you getting same day fish, cut real time?  So if you want good   fish at this price point, I'm pretty sure you can not do much better in a land locked desert paradise of sin, than what we experienced, and I know my raw fish.

__g4MScE3yBJFJI-Guir_w.text: We were looking for a Sushi place that was reasonable.  We were not disappointed.  Service was quick and the Sushi was amazing.  We had the D.D., the Hawaiian, James Bond and a Spider Roll, along with a couple of Kirin. Would go back again.

8y6O0VHAhJL3IFEW5UcLNg.text: Not far off the strip and very reasonably priced. Food was delicious! Service was also great.

Zr497AVYJlZQdzGXQP4vzg.text: Very nice overall experience.  Good price, it is all-you-can-eat lunch and dinner, but food quality is far beyond my expectation. Their sweet shrimp tasted very fresh, Uni has no good presentation but also fresh. Other foods we ordered are good too. I didn't really find anything bad. The only thing is they might need more waiters , as not in the peak time their place is still almost full of customers.  Worthy to go their again.

do7MCqDKSPZF1NEtVr_bMQ.text: Our first visit  OK so in a nutshell 100% give  Them A 10 Excellent service, excellent food, very prompt, no rushing  Us even though they were extremely busy

TDbZinca6a2o0tziSAHn9Q.text: All you can eat! Whaaaaaaaat?!!!! Lol great prices, loved this little strip mall sushi spot.  It's not too far off the strip.  I cant remember the fun names of the sushi, but we ate it all.

n3WJTwZ9K3Fk3AxTQnQiWw.text: This is a hidden GEM! We found it several years back and now EVERY time I come to Vegas I eat here! You can order individual items or all you can eat is $26.99. I highly suggest the Baked Salmon roll, Volcano roll and the Sex Bomb. It's a small venue so during peak times there may be a wait but I think its worth it!.

yHx26ToU104PGRDTW1EfqQ.text: Hands down the best overall sushi restaurant I've been to. I say overall because this is not the best sushi I've ever had, but it is pretty damn close and for a fraction of the price!   Food:  Fish was super fresh! I was in such shock since we are in the middle of a desert eating super fresh seafood. The rolls were well made. The sides were just as good. Must orders: Tempura, sweet shrimp, uni, salmon kama, salmon belly and scallop roll.   Service:  Super friendly staff who dropped by every few minutes to check up on us.   Environment:  This is set away from the strip. The place can fit 50 - 75 patrons. Plentiful parking and easy to get to.   Price: $28 for AYCE!! This is top notch quality sushi...I don't quite understand how they can charge $28 for all this.   I will be back! Perhaps everytime I'm in Vegas....  Food: 5 Service: 5 Environment: 4 Price: 5

vo0RLNKNuoeGU3J--9c4Uw.text: I had high expectations for an ayce sushi restaurant with ratings as high as Sushi Way. Unfortunately, the service was extremely slow during our visit which was disappointing.   Objectively speaking, the food was great! The fish was really fresh and they carried a lot of unique options I haven't had at other places (like garlic hamachi). The uni/amaebi (one serving per customer) are a must!   Our experience was sub par due to the service that we experienced during dinner. The management should try to staff the restaurant accordingly every night. For a Friday night, you would expect more than 2 sushi chefs to accommodate customers, but the lack of staff resulted in a 40-45 minute wait for our first order of food. The server was courteous enough to provide 2 complimentary bottles of sake, but it wasn't enough to make up for the lack of service. Shout-out to the staff for working hard to make up for their inadequate management.   Food Quality: 4/5  Atmosphere: 4/5  Service: 1/5 (Will give the benefit of the doubt that it's not always like this, but for our particular experience, the service was terrible.)  Overall: 2/5

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assortment of rolls

hs_1e6QaNl9VeXotcX8QNg.text: I was originally going to give this place 3 stars. I wanted to talk about the quality of the sushi and how good it is, and how the way they make their rice is amazing.  But, that changed this morning when my boyfriend texted me, telling me he had food poisoning. And I myself had been fighting an unpleasantness last night as well.   However, I want it to be clear that we wouldn't have come back anyways, even if we didn't get sick. The ambiance of this place is very dead, it's slightly depressing. There is no joy in the staff, with the exception of one server. It didn't start to get upbeat in the restaurant till a group of guys came in.   We thought that their nigiri tasted good, the sushi is of good quality, but we didn't like their rolls at all. The only thing you can taste in all the rolls is the unagi sauce, and it overpowers everything else. Their other sauces have no flavor, and the sushi is lost. I also want to add that their appetizers are mediocre. We had the Veggie tempura that we weren't impressed by, the Screaming Orgasm which has the same problem with no flavor and my boyfriends miso soup never arrived.   But once again, none of this matters anymore since my boyfriend woke up super sick, and my stomach has been upset as well.  I'm sorry Sakana for betraying you. Even though your rice isn't good sushi rice and you're always busy... you always treat us well, your staff is welcoming, and we always leave satisfied and never with food poisoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of their plates are cracked or burned in some way. It&#39;s extremely unappealing

m2_ubmjK-mX7m3S3Pr2VqQ.text: Great all you can eat sushi at an unbeatable price. The quality and quantity are both there, and it's in a great location. Highly recommend for anyone!

IeoB6TCx-dF3wjNoNC5vIA.text: Zero stars if I could, for the amazingly poor service we received for our party of 16. Why bother accommodating a large party if you can't serve them? We came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. Mind you, there were only 2 other parties of 2 who dined in throughout our reservation. So the restaurant was not all that busy.   Initially we had two servers who took orders from us in three sections (left, middle, right) and it was very unfortunate that somehow the middle section of our party got our first round of food about an hour after ordering. At the same time we got our first round, the other two sections were already being served their third round of orders-- note that our middle section only had 4 of us while the left and right section had 6 each. On top of that, the celebrant was sitting in the middle section where we barely ate. They used the excuse that the chef's had probably combined the nigiris on some plates and were given to other sections. If that was the case, what was the point in ordering by sections? That, I would say, was careless on their part. Had they served the orders to the sections who ordered them, we would have not been waiting for our food for so long. We (the middle section) were the only section to order eel and sea urchin, which honestly did not come out to any other section, but ours- a few minutes after reminding our server what our first order was. I was literally picking at the other section's food while waiting for our order. I cant stress you enough on how long that wait felt.  Just when you thought it couldn't get any worse, at the end of the night, we ended up with only one server; one of them had disappeared making it a lot more difficult to get our orders in. We came in paying for AYCE + the 18% gratuity, but ate as if we did ala carte along with half-ass service, it was truly upsetting and frustrating.  The food itself? Mediocre. Miso soup was anything but. Pork belly was pretty good, but not sure if it just tasted good cause I was starving during that wait. They got one thing right though, and that was getting the right drinks to us in a timely matter.  I could only hope that this restaurant would improve on their customer service and be more prepared when taking large parties. I will most likely not be back here, as there are tons of other sushi joints in vegas I'd rather spend my time and money on. But good luck if you decide to dine in!  I think, for once, maybe it wouldn't have been a bad idea looking at this business' 141 not recommended reviews that also warn about their horrible service.

BXPDl3LLOWYBsdHL_dx8fA.text: Ok, hands down one of the best All u Can Eat places. Great variety, nice portions. Brandon took care if us tonight and he was so personable in conversation.  We really enjoyed ourselves tojight.

qFnNNE6et9FwvxoGqv882w.text: I want to love this place. The AYCE price is $21.95. You can order almost everything on the menu. You can get a lot of sushi creations for one price.  However, the execution of the sushi was lackluster. The rice was toothy and slightly too vinegary. The fish items tasted less that perfectly fresh. They lacked the creamy mouthfeel of higher grade sushi.  My favorite dishes was the salmon tartare app, which had salmon that was admittedly sliced improperly for tartare. It sat atop crab salad, diced red onions, and avocado. The dish was good in a grocery store sushi way: decent flavor combo, but ingredients tasted as if they had sat out a bit too long. Not unsafe food practices, just not fastidiously prepared.  The salmon roe tasted fresh and was tasty.   None of the dishes blew me away. It was just an OK meal. The service was prompt and cordial but not particularly caring or friendly despite how close I was to the sushi chefs.  I wouldn't recommend this place. Their reviews are high because the price is attractive for an AYCE near the vegas strip. Thr execution was poor.

fJgS_2XW5XI7R_qPpiVLCA.text: VERY DELICIOUS! It was hard to believe that I could get great quality sushi for the all you can eat price (21).  The yellowtail and salmon nigiri are by far my favorite. It's very soft and buttery. I also like how they don't put too much rice for the nigiri, allowing the fish to be the center of attention and not losing its nice taste. Food also comes out quite fast and consistently. In total my family paid $93 for a dinner of sushi witch would have cost $130 without buffet. I don't think I will find any other sushi buffet as good as this.

gcJo3RXNFWrSfVxDkohAhw.text: Service-5 stars, food-2 stars... some of the fish was not fresh and tasted off.. We got some of the most recommended dishes and they all pretty much failed :( Plus almost everything we got was super spicy!

XaI4VQM72ecB8VwakvCR6Q.text: It was True. All you can eat and the sashimi, sushi, Nefrologist, everything was delicious and far as I could tell very fresh. Tasty, not over sauces, crunchy not greasy. Our chefs were fantastic. Get on over there it's really True.

xTIzdUDRgLi8305-47qM8w.text: Soooooo good! Very attentive staff, delicious food, knowledgeable and suggested their favorites. Ate way too much . Was able to order half rolls with ayce. Favorite rolls of ours, Dragon and Somethings Wrong 69

SfI2uZJaejDfddoXv2Qt5w.text: Absolutely loved the sushi buffet.  Many great items and it was impossible to try all the ones that sounded good.  Some of the best sushi I have ever had.  Great value for the money and worth the short drive off the strip.

4ZfjHAdVA0zw3-f0iEjeBg.text: I have been to numerous AYCE sushi. But hands down this place was the best. The quality of the sushi and the different intricate flavor of the rolls was awesome!  The sushi melts in your mouth! Def would highly recommend anyone to give it a try. Staff were super friendly.

kk0fizS0x4Kzkg_uZG7a0g.text: Amazing customer service and great food at a perfect price! Parking lot gets busy but there's extra parking in the back lot for free! Overly satisfied with the rolls and the all you can eat menu! The veggie tempura is my favorite!

LgDu9GJHZJPAymHGR6-7BQ.text: All the pics of sushi are old.  The nigiri is really poor quality.  Rolls would be good if the fish was better.  But their crispy rice spicy tuna is really really good and it's bite sized.  And they put way too much ponzu sauce

fElc2K2Rp52aHaMVijgsmg.text: Our first time here and the food is absolutely so freaking delicious !! I recommend the Viva Las Vegas  and Jack Rabbit!! The garlic & spicy edamame is also bomb.

q3YjoLTLe-693dnH4tV3_Q.text: I'm very pleased with this restaurant. I'm having the all you can eat meal and I'm being extravagant. Oysters started my meal. Then I moved onto the screaming Orgasm and the Kiss of Fire. You better believe my mouth is on fire now. Holy cow! Fantastic.   I'm pausing for a moment for shrimp tempura and bacon scallops to cool down my tongue. The flavors here aren't just spicy. They're complex. You can tell the sushi chefs truly have a passion for creativity.   Service is prompt and attentive. Looking up and giving a smile will beckon your server. The environment is light and festive. There are plenty of smiles and people seem to truly be enjoying themselves.   The restaurant has wood tables and benches. There is a darkness with red hues in the lighting. It makes for interesting dining for sure. I absolutely will be back.

guoUnFgOnpFMyOIvFwgRTg.text: All you can eat sushi for under $25.  Includes over 50 options from deep-fried, to tempura, to fresh fish.  They have basic crab rolls and also fancier, more exciting rolls which are filling and look great.  Cuts, rolls, and basic maki.  Gyoza, dessert, salads...all included.  Sushi Way is your typical AYCE sushi spot that has many options but most are more or less the same ingredients.  Tasty and for the price well worth it if you're looking to stuff yourself on rice and fish.  I usually prefer to spend more on higher quality sushi, but Sushi Way is very solid nonetheless.  They also offer a la carte if you just want some sushi east of the strip at a cheaper price.  And, don't forget the awesome names of some of the rolls.  Might be worth a stop in here just for the fantastic comedic menu creations.

xmHWJMTTGJhyYHYW5EO1Kw.text: I've already been here a few times and have yet to make a review. So I have been to many sushi spots here in Vegas. Sakana, Umiya, Kaya, Yama, Twister, Goymon, and a few others I can't think of right now, but let me tell you that this is one of the best sushi spots. Great Nigiri the quality of the fish is exceptional. Many amazing rolls and appetizers to choose from. Highly recommend getting the Yellowtail belly and Salmon belly if your into Nigiri. Amazing will keep coming, found a serious gem!

gOhwkztxgkwi37QdWQovYw.text: Great local all you can eat open until 2AM. Friendly and quick staff and a pretty good sushi for the price! Highly recommend.

DLEq9c2jZ4ENEGWmBm6zbw.text: Vegas has some of the best all you can eat Sushi spots.  After seeing awesome reviews for Sushi way I decided to check it out!  The waitor was very friendly and suggested popular items from the menu which was very helpful.  I chose to have the all you can eat special that costs $26.95 @ night which was pretty resonable.  I came around 7:30pm and was seated immediately.  20 minutes later the entire restaurant was filled!  The sushi rolls were pretty good.  I had the Big Easy Special, Salmon Killer, and I love My Ass. Of those the Big Easy Special was my favorite. They made a mistake on my Unagi and gave me a Unagi roll instead of Nigiri.  The Flavor of the unagi was good but it was slightly burnt and crispy.  Not really how Unagi is supposed to be cooked.  For Nigiri I had the Salmon, Garlic Yellow Tail, Ikura, Unagi.  My biggest drawback to this spot was that it was extremely slow during 8pm (Peak Time) So I wouldnt reccomend coming here during this time.  I would assume 10pm might be better.  It would be less crowded and you wouldnt have to wait a long time for your food.  On average I waited 20 minutes between orders.  All in all they've got decent sushi here and good service however, it wont be my go to spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Rolls!

GwdzN5ZmEiSwJ0bUc6zXMg.text: Came in and had an issue that was worthy of one star. I put an updated review here and received a response within an hour from management. They asked me to give them another chance and so I did. They were accommodating and treated us as we should have been on our previous attempt to eat here. Back to 5 stars.  Thanks to management for making things right. Must have been a bad day.

pCMm0jdfO6wJVkZpuQIB4w.text: We ended up here thanks to a strangers recommendation and it did not disappoint. The Big Easy Special roll and the Viva Las Vegas roll was the best. The spicy garlic edamame the best part of the meal.  We will definitely be back next time we are in town!

JEHcZJnY92GS_PyhG18-fQ.text: I went here with some co-workers for lunch around 3pm and we were the only ones there. We assumed the service would be quick since the place was empty but oh were we wrong.  First off, my friend ordered a roll without the rice and the waitress said that would be totally fine. They deliver the roll and it has rice in it so we told them we ordered it without rice and then the sushi chef said oh no we can't make that roll or any roll without rice....which I know isn't True because I've been to sushi places before where they just roll it in the seaweed. The waitress even explained it to him and he said it would be fine, but then told us he couldn't do it.   We waited an extremely long amount of time for our food, especially my bento box. By the time I got it, my friends had finished eating. The chef (same one that said he couldn't make the roll without rice) didn't know what went in the bento box apparently, and just didn't make it based upon the conversation I overheard with him and the waitress. I don't understand why he wouldn't have just asked what went in it instead of not making it at all.   The waitress was extremely nice and friendly, but was nowhere to be found most of the time. We had to get up and find someone to order more food and to ask for our check. She did give us a complimentary green tea ice cream for making us wait so long for my bento box, which was very nice of her.   There are so many sushi places in Vegas and Henderson that are a million times better than this place. Needless to say, I won't be coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea ice cream
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi and Shrimp tempura bento box

Bm_-GEONCILJzqqHtytv5g.text: Three stars for me = good. Very average sushi-- I'm not sure why folks give four and five stars here. I had the AYCE sushi and discovered it was a matter of quantity over quality. My two rolls were sauced excessively--a sure sign the resto is hiding the flavor and texture of the fish it sells. My unagi roll was very average. The rice in all the rolls & nigiri I ordered did not taste really fresh and firm as it should. The seaweed salad and miso soup were fine and should never be an issue.  I stopped in here b/c I was staying in the 'hood--it was close and convenient. If I'm back in the area and craving sushi, I will continue my search elsewhere. Oh, waitstaff was attentive and friendly--no issues here.

DlWCmsRARKabjM7h5L_SYQ.text: Sushi Way is on the higher end of average for AYCE sushi in Vegas- service was great and most fish was decently fresh, but the rice was oddly wet and dense, which significantly detracted from my enjoyment. From reading other reviews, I was expecting more riceless options here, and though they weren't clearly marked, the few I found were good.  APPS: the poke is decent with seaweed, ahi, and a lot of onion in a sweet-spicy sauce, BF really enjoyed the coconut shrimp tempura, the tartare was interesting, screaming orgasm was quite small compared to others' orders? NIGIRI: aside from the aforementioned rice issue, most fish seemed pretty fresh but some pieces were bland. Specials were pretty basic (fishy-tasting yellowtail with jalapeno, yuzu tobiko), salmon is my preferred fish but I didn't even request a second order because it didn't have much flavor... almost tasted like it had been frozen? ROLLS: This area of the menu seems to be their forte, the "Sushi Nachos" would probably be more appropriately placed in the apps category but was my favorite. Lisa hand roll could use a sauce to perk it up but was one of the healthier options. The DD and Candy Cane rolls recommended in other reviews were typical, the YOLO seemed unique and yet flavor was lacking and fried onions were old and hard.   I always recommend sitting at the bar, the chefs and server were super friendly. I don't know if it's their location or if they're just really popular, but they got crazy busy- recommend arriving early, as they were empty at 6PM and started a wait list around 7PM.

3Pb4e4D93DciIHd06-0eWA.text: Wholly Molly!!  Selection is amazing,  service friendly and fast... but the food.. absolutely awesome! Must try baked green mussels.. cheesy, hot and absolutely delish, bacon scallop skewer,  amazing,  crunchy and soft... this place def rocks! Our new sushi spot.. not new to sushi lovers here... straight outta...so cal

iDAORPXgv3YW743R__XnzA.text: This place offers a great deal! All you can eat for $26.95!   The other night I paid $20.00 for really subpar Indian food in the Fashion Show Mall, and I feel like... this place is a treasure chest in comparison.   I ordered uni, sweet shrimp with the heads fried, soft shell crab spider roll...mini udon noodles.... fresh oysters... the quality of the sushi is also very good.   Highly recommend this spot!

I5C1z9JmBI-NuiuTtQxyOg.text: Came here for all you can eat lunch for $21.95 per person. Great variety! They also have daily specials on a blackboard that you don't want to miss.

SZNA5fT_XnY-ihElKhnvxQ.text: You gotta try their sushi nachos, so bomb! Their pork belly was surprisingly good too, tasted like Filipino adobo with tons of fat on it

uBjI31KeOo6fFmNYI0bQng.text: Unbelievable how good this place is!! Sit at the bar where the chefs can serve you directly. Prices for AYCE beyond worth it!  The menu is wide open for you to order from . Super friendly staff, fun atmosphere. You will not find better rolls or sushi anywhere in Vegas. Your order is filled with incredible speed and accuracy. Drinks here basic stuff, but priced right. This is Vegas number one hidden gem IMO. I love this place and its only a $9 uber away from many Vegas strip casinos!!

Mc9gRLNQkdyNOkh-VByoVQ.text: Was in Vegas to meet up with my mom and sister and we were all craving sushi, but being on a budget could not begin to fathom the prices at any of the options on the strip.  So I put a search out to good old Yelp, and this place came up with good reviews and the price was right at $26 for AYCE dinner. I called up Sushi Way to see if I needed to make a reservation.. since it was a Friday night, but was told there was no need. Fantastic!  This place is right off the Las Vegas Strip (only about a 20 in walk from Planet Hollywood Hotel). So we were on our way!  Let me tell you, I was a little nervous for it being in a small strip mall, but do not let that deter you!!.. This place is amazing, with really fresh seafood.  The menu is the perfect size with lots of options for every taste preference. The best part is that they offer 1/2 rolls so you can try more options! I love this option, wish more places offered this!!  Don't know what you want... the staff is great at providing suggestions!  My faves of the night: the Big Easy, Volcano, DD, Green Monster,  Gyoza (pot stickers),  Jalapeno poppers, Bacon Scallop Skewers (so yummy!!)  As for the desert, only had space for a few spoonfuls of the Yuzu Sorbet, this was so refresing, wished I had saved more room to finish this.  So when in Vegas and wanting sushi at a reasonable price, this is the place to go!!

goux8SQ32YfY-zZ0lTNsEw.text: This restaurant is super awesome! They have a great ambience and the sushi was spectacular. The all you can eat is amazing and I ate my weight in sushi!

aXfNmaCce7_hc1ehASvdSQ.text: I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this place! The sushi was fresh and SO good! The service was amazing and their "all-you-can-eat" includes EVERYTHING from their menu for only $26! Definitely recommend!

lm8dJlANA5fXCJhIWgoM4Q.text: Sushi Way is very good (and I'm from NYC). Great service and soundtrack too. Pricing is very fair for the quality. Recommend the Burning Your Stomach and Rock and Roll.

LM7mBwIhv7LmRx4XepTgTw.text: This place is sooo good. Touched down from the Bay Area and this is always our first stop.

Htf15RiT2Uhj382Wle0AjA.text: Came here again after not coming for a while and noticed that they have installed booths into their restaurant. The booths looks super nice and since the dividers are high it can give you a little bit of privacy from the other tables that you wouldn't get before so it's super great.  As always the food is super great and Jun is behind the sushi bar again after being a server for almost a month so it was great to have his sushi again ^^ 10/10 will always come back

sqvHURY4C4dh-9CNphvtnA.text: sushi and service were both good. I took care of the bill for our group. I left a 20% tip on top of the bill. once I got home I realized they had already added 18% service charge to the bill. it is standard for a server to inform the guest when when a service charge has already been added, they did not. the server also picked up the bill and added cash tip long before we left and knew exactly what happened, but said nothing. shady business!

kJv_TTDnKxuB2t99JwvbtA.text: Phenomenal service! Our server, Yuna was so attentive! Our group of 12 came in probably around prime dinner time (sorry, ) and she did her very best to accommodate our insane sushi orders. She never failed to keep our cups filled, and kept our plates coming! Great quality fish! Definitely would come back again! Kudos to the chefs and keeping up with our appetites! Wish we could've bought a round for you all! Thank you!!

-Si9gXKCQg0NvvMCgZjW5Q.text: SO WORTH IT. The food's so fresh and the service is fantastic. Would definitely recommend this place. It's honesty with no doubt one of the best sushi places I've been to.

67JuSw86oTc4Lp7Ebv_bmw.text: Great Sushi! We were in town and stumbled upon this amazing AYCA SUSHI JOINT.  We could probably eat here 4 times and never order the same roll. HUGE menu.  Andy was our server and provided excellent service.  We will be back!!

rcWxTRHWcZ7KnYauBGlN3w.text: Fantastic all-you-can-eat sushi! I love being able to ask the chef to "surprise me!" The creativity and flavors you get to experience is fantastic! My world-traveling Father-in-law was with us and Taka, Ethan and Damien Marley took the best care of us!! This isn't for everyone, but for you fellow coconut lovers out there - you will be in LOVE with the selection of rolls that incorporate coconut in more ways than one!! Eat here!

hbtjs8iSX2rZDzyVTbLSvA.text: Amazing AYCE right off the strip. Surprisingly large menu for an AYCE sushi place which also includes sides like dumplings, coconut shrimp tempura, and tuna sashimi (which was amazing). The quality of the sushi was excellent, wait staff was very responsive and friendly, and food came out quickly (sit at the bar if you can). For dessert try the Mochi ice cream and the Honey Bread. So good. Definitely worth a stop if you have a craving for affordable AYCE sushi near Vegas!

rRMNtgKv6IIlgvg4y4Vclw.text: I am such a sushi snob and when I saw the all you can eat sign thinking there was no way it could meet my standards. Boy was I wrong! WE ATE SO MUCH!! Great food, great service, the tap water is even really good!  So happy we stuck around!!

fW4NH-Hzm6ifTFa_bZRJzw.text: Killer lunch specials, great service. Totally worth the walk from the strip. Try the Sexy Lazy, you won't be disappointed.

Rg9KuxzSoNu1dNS2ASSViw.text: Awesome place with good and friendly service. All of the rolls and sashimi were very fresh and came out fast. I am definitely gonna try and stop here whenever I am in town.

p4OUTaQCqmEzLCBcUP_xUg.text: Kudos to chefs! The baked mussels,bacon wrapped scallops,Who's yo daddy roll,Viva Las Vegas roll and sexy Richard was on point like always. Don't forget the warm sake

rbMzNUOe6h_FAZIdFVT1vQ.text: The sushi is great and the service is awesome. Definitely a spot I'll come to all the time!

TLAX1FEXL8AhH9vGh2-HhA.text: I love this place! I come for the all you can eat its so worth it. The best appetizers is the coconut shrimp and  bacon scallops.  Ethan is always so nice and does a great job!!!

5qQbDValPmbi__W_g27ETw.text: I've never been so full in my life.. from sushi atleast lol The all you can eat is something everyone who loves sushi should take advantage of. It's $26.95 and each plate of sushi was absolutely delish.  Definitely recommend this place.   Plus the atmosphere of the restaurant is great for a date and the employees are very nice and helpful!

RNuV9nqUHQ9QgW90c8ihHw.text: By far one of the worst service experiences ive had, twice now....I eat more than my fair share of sushi and both times I've been here I've waited 15 mins to have my water filled, constantly having to ask to place another order. I honestly wish I could give this place 0/5 stars but the food was mediocre, def not as good as other reviews state. I wish I would have learned my less n the first time and not have returned for a second visit. The table behind us is having the same problem. Ah, please don't come here, go to Kaya

tNIyKVdVD_zlBAKkQwACbA.text: This place was fantastic! Fulfilled my sushi appetite with rolls, sushi ngiri, oyster shooters, white fish with jalapeno and then some! We were greeted and sat by this beautiful and set girl who explained their all you can eat dinner for $26.95 and that pretty much everything on the menu was included.  We started out with rolls (Sushi Solution, Chicago Fire, Rainbow Roll and I Love Sushi)...all delicious!  We topped it off with sides of Golbi, white fish with jalapenos, salmon ngiri..Before we could think of something else to get,  our server Jay just started bringing out extras for us to try including coconut shrimp, oyster shooters (interesting and not as horrible as I expected, although I didn't chew husband did and he thought it was great).   Albeit, there were no the guests,  but being that they are open till 2am, we went during the old people's hour and the place gets hopping later on in the night.  Haha. ..either way,  definitely coming back during this visit!

3us9F-7jgFHkizLppiI3Rg.text: Sushi way is a small place, but thats the only complaint. This is the best place to go for all you can eat. I like it better than kaya, yama, sakana, etc. The price is 27$ for dinner and 22$ for lunch. Pricer than the other places but def worth it. The quality of the fish is the best ive tasted in vegas and i love that they have unlimited orders of salmon belly. The service is A1 and it never seems to be crowded. This has been my new go to spot and i will be recommending it to all my friends. Two thumbs up!

V29YcLIydr9UMjNcZ-N4lA.text: Place is solid- sushi is of a high quality for AYCE. Lunch price is 21.95 very reasonable. Service is fast and courteous. Go with the oh! Jenna roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

whqy_-_eWDfFYiZTrtihJA.text: The chef was nice and chatted with me. Made me his specialties off menu based on what was fresh and what I liked. You can tell this is a place where they care about the quality of their food and it's fun to taste the chefs experiments into mixing traditional sushi with Vegas flavors. I don't think they should offer all you can eat, but they manage to keep quality up so I can't complain!

3ftn87BrFvZRgWQ_vaSVZw.text: Been to this place 3 times now, and love it each time I come back. Food is great, lots of variety, and they allow you to do half rolls so you can try all kinds of different rolls! Great sushi spot off the stip.

kIcHWgtczww2pO1rluWW1w.text: Every time I go to Vegas I eat essentially only sushi. I'm really glad I found this place. This sushi is amazing! They make it right in front of you and everything I had on the menu was amazing!  From spicy tuna to the dragon roll. I will definitely be back here the next time I'm in Vegas!

lIPnzIAfYx-9Jd15_96_Iw.text: Absolutely amazing place. We actually originally showed up to a neighboring Japanese restaurant but left due to the odd smell and unfriendly guests and employees. We wandered into Sushi Way randomlly and man were we impressed. The fish quality was fantastic! Thick slices of fish. GREAT price with the all you can eat. Me and my girlfriend must have sat there and ate for 6 people. The host/Server was very nice and our sushi bar man Juno was so nice. Gave us his full attention, recommending dishes, making them promptly. We had some great food and will be coming back next time we're in town.

wftwLBjJQR4Pmf33oRBG7A.text: Amazing place. I came here for my late night bday dinner and loved it! Great customer service, good environment, DELICIOUS rolls; Tiger roll was sooo good. The waitress, Kini, was very friendly and very attentive. She recommended the Honey bread and it's a MUST for dessert! I came from LA and I'm a sushi lover. Sushi Way is one of the best!

f4iNJEUysL73VhmCEMBVag.text: The sushi place to go to. Close to the strip. $26.95 for all you can eat sushi. What is not to love? Will definitely be coming back every time I come to Vegas.

Z_zdEwGnyMg-MtAkyuHidw.text: We came on a Saturday night so of course it was gonna be busy.. however once we walked in the door another party was already waiting and no one greeted us. Then we were finally greeted by the chef, not the hostess to have a seat at the sushi bar. Then, we looked at the menus while we waited to order. Everything had a description and looked pretty good. We tried a few rolls, the have the Sex Bomb, Crunch and Lasagna which are my favorites at Kaya. This is the same price as Kaya ($27) and I felt like it included more. I ordered the oysters which were dabbed with Siracha. They were so good! The rolls themselves were good but the part lacking is seriously customer service. We waited for water, to take our plates away.. There's no hostess here and the phones were ringing off the hook. I liked coming here but the customer service even made a party of 3 decide to leave after not being seated. Overall, I think I would come back.

imXv6lTNOs5gIO9E30hjKg.text: Great food! We had Jane as our waitress and she was wonderful. Worth the taxi ride off the strip.

3GYfvz0EGDtxyZuC69KCOA.text: I'm from the Midwest, so we don't do much in the way of sushi, let alone all you can eat.  This place does it right.  It tastes fresh and delicious.  Price is more than reasonable for all of that.  The staff here is also very friendly.  If you like sushi and saving some $$$, get of the strip and try this place out.  You won't regret it!

zQpL9OjDrOrE_y9kDwB6AA.text: The all you can eat is excellent. Do not let 'all you can eat' scare you. The quality and service are wonderful. The Sweet 16 & Kiss of Fire rolls are unreal and the fish is incredibly fresh. Highly recommend the yellow tail as well.

Ghf1uTEkRzo_zSkNKGCVvw.text: Amazing food and service!! Perfect place for a snack during spring break! The spicy tuna roll was amazing!!

rPeMm7E3bgW9g3swFQxCIQ.text: I started getting my sushi fix over here after Sin City Sushi closed down about 6 months ago. Sin City has since reopened, but I guess my heart is big enough for two sushi joints! Jun the owner is a friendly young guy who has been in here every time I've come in. The quality of fish is usually excellent and their servers are very friendly and on top of things. I recommend the white tuna topped with jalapeno and the Rock and Roll roll. The nigiri here is usually of excellent quality, though the last time I came in (my 4th or 5th visit) a few things felt like they were a little past their prime unfortunately. That was on a Sunday, so maybe it was right before their new order came in or something. Every other time it's been fantastic and the service is so good, I say keep them at 5 stars!

vhEpAriO5SR6EdySad1SFQ.text: From Cali, but visiting Vegas for my birthday....Awesome food! Awesone service! Will return!

r5sfpbFxTyCxcsnxKENdJA.text: A staff member told me about this place. At first I was a bit skeptical try but glad we did. Service was great. Very friendly staff. Food came out super fast and the taste did not disappoint us.  Nigiri came with good size fish. The rolls were well made with very tasty sauce. Love this place. And they have STAMP CARD...Hehehe. Lol. Definitely coming back here again even though it's a bit far for us.

C0QNQ9N4c3UC0aadHRZymg.text: Love the sushi baked salmon roll you must try!!!! One roll is practically as much as ayce!!! So do ayce!!!

D5nP1WlLw7wvzbF4TQ4itA.text: Thanks ploy and Michael for an amazing experience. The fish literally melts in your mouth. If you haven't tried this place then you're missing out !

pRzNV0K1AMLPeUv4QJlk5w.text: By far the best sushi I have ever had. I've always been skeptical to try a new sushi place because I'm scared I won't enjoy the food. This place had the freshest food I have ever had. Ever order was delicious. The service was amazing. If there was 6 stars I would give 6 stars. Definitely will come back and I might replace my favorite sushi spot

9twWODb4Bd_ehw5sSgvPrg.text: This place was amazing! The staff was very polite. For a Monday this place was really busy but the staff doesn't rush you witch is relaxing. I sat at the bar and the chef was really nice. The servers had their hands full but table touched every so often making sure we were ok. The food was amazing just as good as it looks. I tend to go to a lot of ayce places and this is by far one of the best ones.

8_TU9Fok8CzCA8pHd2Ea6w.text: Worse service ever! No system in waiting tables, waiters bouncing table to table. Honestly, if I wanted to, I could've walked out without paying because the waiters weren't paying attention. Never again

CqOPqfD6Ufza_kzBsg69Aw.text: I wasn't happy. we got AYCE, and the older waitress wasn't very nice, she was always rushing us, and she wasn't understanding the order. the sushi was OK.... tempura calamari just disgusting..., the rolls weren't flavorful at all.. lack of sauces... I am not going back

Q7R9sWQqlWJl-Z9ZjJsXVg.text: Out of towners and never eat at AYCE places. But the reviews pushed me in. Great service. Good quality sushi for a ridiculously low price. We eat sushi at least once a week (and no alcohol) at home and do not leave for less than $85 - 2 rolls and a chicken teriyaki. So, overall pleased with this place.

7brM3V_h1i-0oHWSuojQOA.text: The busser was Awesome!  The food was just ok. The server was THE WORST I have ever had! I've worked in the industry for 17 years. I ALWAYS over tip. I understand a person can have a bad day. She was SO rude I didn't leave her a dime. I'll never go back!

38Xm5qQi8PE3qpIuxAi4yQ.text: Very good sushi the hostess was awesome! Eat here! AAA grade fish! Super awesome pricing I had the the eel and yellow tail 2 roll special it was delicious.

Xaw0XZQeIYaAeo9LVVfVLg.text: we were craving sushi and  it was our last day in Vegas so we checked it out. The reviews are more than accurate! It was Delicious fast and we had the best service by Monica! I'm now craving for more of their sushi and dessert! Amazing team work by both servers and chefs. I'm looking forward to return to Vegas so we can come back to sushi way.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4emnX2uiXAJrMUTQ-wNCTg.text: Good ayce, great variery and quality, they dont overdo them with tons of rice as other places. Highly recommended.

zCsbCrSKVxRSUj1Bkajq_g.text: All I can eat sushi for $27! Whole menu, nothing off limits! Very good food and great price. Will be back on my next Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Snow White and Golden Philly were to kill for

6QhXUa-2mZDFFM0BqlJebw.text: Great food and nicely presented. Very friendly staff. Cool local spot. 10 minute walk from the hard rock hotel. Did the all you can eat. Very fair price. Totally worth it. Highly recommend.

HQMV7k4vkSxwPz2XLWxPwg.text: All you can eat is great, go hungry.  Plenty of rolls to choose from.  It includes anything on the menu.  Service is good they kept the food coming also not too bad a wait for the next thing.

eYvVpbr1QPlkwv8dPf504A.text: My wife and I stopped in here & enjoyed one of the best Sushi meals we have ever had.  We were a bit skeptical at first as we had not heard good things about the All you can Eat Sushi places, but our fears were quickly dispersed as soon as we sat down & watched them operate.  The Sushi was some of the best we have ever had, certainly some of the freshest and by far the quickest and best service we have ever experienced.  We will most certainly be going back every time we are in Vegas.  This place ROCKS!!

3mZwPmzaOsrawq9mNRyRjw.text: Stopped by for lunch on a Friday afternoon with some friends. I wasn't coming in to try their AYCE that day but once we were seated there was no lunch menu to be found. Make sure to specifically ask for it. The rest of my friends tried the AYCE.   I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento ($9). It comes with: chicken teriyaki, 4 California rolls, 2 gyozas, 4 pieces of vegetable tempura, a very small portion of potato salad, salad and miso soup. Although it was a good amount of food, nothing stood out to me.   One big thing that bothered us was the service. The busser was very friendly however our waitress...not so much. After my friend placed his first round of orders in, he called her back because he forgot to order some side dishes. She commented that "you already ordered a lot." I understand that most places want to make sure you only order what you can eat but this was the wrong way of going about it. You can also only order 1 dessert item :(  I'm going to have to come back here and try the AYCE menu. Especially the coconut shrimp and sushi nachos, the two stand out items my friends mentioned.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki- lunch menu

eXhF94L9oq-o1FG_-IS0vg.text: I had al a carte while I was here but I really wanted to touch upon the service with this place. Absolutely unparalleled. Our server was timely with each order, had a very useful system for getting orders from all you can eat guests, and he was always there to answer our questions about the menu.   Aside from that is the style of the sushi bar itself. Dim with casual lighting. Very sensual and I really like the fact that they play rnb and 90's 2000's hi hop!!   Would recommend this place for any sushi eating fiend that enjoys a vast menu . I had very basic items, but my friends ordered a lot from their all you can eat side of the menu. GET THE SEXY LAZY SPECIAL!!  Overall awesome experience! Thank you!

-te6GszHAE5nmVWmQjBhWg.text: So we just got off the plane grabbed our bags and headed here to Sushi Way. Yes this is the 3rd time I'm here and man it's great. Again I got the all you can eat option and I stuffed my face with some awesome sushi. I really have nothing more to say besides I will be back every time.

hgZ51d3nDeH7lLOl4iMYmQ.text: This place is so good!!! For a $26.95 all you can eat sushi that is so worth it; the hotel offered $26 per roll which is a total rip compared to here. Ivan was our sushi making person and he was friendly, funny, and made it right in front of us! He made it very quickly and didn't forget our order. Great service and good quality fish!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

tQA9D43aTV7roh-EE6Sc0A.text: Just because I'm "white" doesn't mean I don't enjoy flavorful spices. Please don't skimp out on the sauces. I know what I'm ordering.  Also, I was kind of offended that my chopsticks were wrapped with cheaters and no one else's were.

zV3lOy0XemcoekbHUtTjSg.text: Ate here twice while in Vegas and will definitely visit again on the next trip. The all you can eat is well worth it. The sushi was fresh and fast

uLZZ6Ed-nDcPrnDhIqKuJw.text: We come here every time we come to Vegas for a show. The food is good, and the service is great- Jane is the best!   Can be packed, make a reservation if you don't want to wait.

uBjLLmp_hEGlJeK-96-UkA.text: This place is my favorite AYCE place!! Everything just taste so fresh! I've been to many many AUCE sushi places in Vegas, and this place blew my mind. I love Yama sushi and Umiya sushi, but this place stood out! Do yourself a favor, and try this place. So good

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uuGlK5xT5wY_tLg-eRz-_g.text: Where to begin! Delicious. Best sushi I've had in years. We did the all you can eat out of indecision, and when our eyes were bigger than our stomachs the server was kind enough to punch the items in al la carte which was cheaper.   Great quality fish. No imitation crab. Try the honey bread for dessert! So good!   The service was very friendly and warm. The sushi was delicious. The facility could use some fresh paint, but that doesn't matter to me - just the food and service.   Great find. Not over-run with tourists, which is great for any restaurant in Vegas.

LjIgdF9EvsiVdnB28H7kBg.text: I have been using yelp for many years but this is the first restaurant that I want to provide a great review. I visited Vegas with my fiance and since we are big fan of sushi and hotel sushi is crap (overpriced), we checked this place out. The quality of sushi is very fresh (better than hotels), and the price is perfect! The sushiman was great!! He recommend many amazing sushi we can try. He was friendly, making conversations while working diligently (perhaps because we sat at the bar top in front of him, but still hadn't had this kind of experience at other sushi restaurants!) The service they provided was phenomenal. I usually tip reasonably but I didn't mind tipping 20%+ for the overall experience. Whenever I visit Vegas again, this is definitely my go-to place. This restaurant has my highest recommendation for sushi lovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only the first few things we tried...rest of the night got real real fast.

CN1TV_FyL8Mk7w_HWzMrNg.text: Hidden gem , fresh and tasty. especially there nigiri I have ate a lot of AYCE and they always gave lots of rice but here they gave just the right amount and the fish were big such good deal

puaPr6dXf9ZFrV7IjuV1jQ.text: We enjoyed the AYCE lunch menu for 21.95 each. Salmon Nigiri was especially fresh and very high quality. Also very good the Salmon Avocado roll. Try also the deep fried ice cream. Authentic and very friendly staff. This restaurant is definitely worth the extra trip off the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Nigiri and Salmon Avocado Roll
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried ice cream

erqgDJ16IAuSfaQ2jGnZcw.text: This was phenomenal!  We were worried about "all you can eat" sushi, but this was just unbelievably good. You can order almost anything off the menu including appetizers and deserts. The sushi nachos were one of my favorite dishes, great flavor, loaded with fresh tuna and a tangy sauce.  The fried coconut shrimp were also to die for, you almost don't even need the sauce to go with it. Very light and just a hint of sweetness.  The rolls were um... Amazing so good and so filling, we were committed to not over eating but this place made that a challenge.   The only thing we didn't like was the mochi ice cream, the texture was just not the way it should be.  If your in the mood for sushi swing on by.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry blossom
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi Tacos!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Ass

S76SgrSVPMdLMTAUO26rnQ.text: We enjoyed everything we ate. The sushi was excellent, service was fast and staff was friendly. We had the all you can eat deal and it was definitely worth it. I would recommend this place to any sushi lover out there and will be sure to stop by next time we visit Vegas.

P2n3wLAFFktKAy5XtwFr2A.text: Absolutely amaziiing!!!  The service was a little slow, for it was a little crowded (came at the end of lunch hour), but they recognized and accommodated.  Ordered all you can eat, and it was SO worth it.  Definitely recommend.

UqqHG8phNUlwNyLacD2n7Q.text: Great sushi and good service. The food came out fast and we really enjoyed the all you can eat. The all you can eat allowed us to try different rolls.

-AsaZegaLJ7IFxRnNjslJA.text: The best AYCE Sushi I have ever had :) ! Such a great customer service and of course, the dishes were definitely high quality.

bX_7kjhLnSFvThZnx41kyg.text: It was good overall. I got ALL YOU CAN EAT, and usually just eat sashimi. The sashimi was pretty plain but I liked how they don't overload it with rice (like most places) which was nice. The sushi place I usually go to as a variety of sauces for each type of fish and this place didn't really have that. Almost everything on the menu is all you can eat (including the desert:)). And if you want to get rolls you can always ask for a half roll (usually has a total of 4 instead of the usual 8 pieces) so you don't get full on just one roll. Other than that the service was awesome and were very attentive.

Hd3R7cSgWJlhiZvGfV8VKg.text: Some of the best AYCE sushi I've had.  I normally go to Yama or Kaya and both are great,  but I wanted to try a new place.  I do believe this place tops them both!  Fast, friendly service and very fresh fish. This will be my new go to place for my occasional  Sushi fix.

kX0aYCueO02WVoWf3kgD7Q.text: Great food! Excellent service! Wonderful experience!  The ALL YOU CAN EAT is a must!  If you are looking for warm, exciting, and cozy this is your destination.

_isfNQfvgCp3zOf-e2zZtw.text: OK so first of all, the sushi here is delicious! I had the sexy lazy special and my boyfriend had the Chicago fire roll (I think that's what it was called). I would definitely recommend those rolls. The customer service however was bad! Our waitress looked unhappy the entire time we were there. She didn't bother to refill our cups. The sushi chefs also seemed unprofessional by flirting with customers. I would return but I hope management takes a look at their staff.

7wLFbnWqQHkM3Te75_pndA.text: Wish I found this place sooner than later. Great staff and service. Let's not forget about the food. There was a party in my tummy and it was a good party!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth it.

wD-ZxaX_a0ZQwkRYcJTnAA.text: Awesome experience. Great fish to rice ratio. Almost everything is available on the lunch menu, and they made a rice miso soup just for my baby. Stellar service!

gF9BovcK03W5YjnyZXF2dw.text: 5 stars rating for customer service. Very friendly and attentive. Love it!  4 stars for food. Some of the items are not as fresh as I would like, such as sea urchin and sweet shrimp. Other than that, I love most of the foods I got. The grilled hamachi collar is superb! I ate every morsel. Love seaweed salad and the poki salad.

Ylhgt8QV83KLsr04W87PJw.text: This is one of my favorite sushi place in Vegas. The servers are down to earth cool. The food! Omg.. their sushi is the bomb. My sushi spirit would be the Sexy Lazy Special. If you've tasted it then you've tasted me.

0I4RtuqgMaOuDoVvqXgAhQ.text: Found this place on Yelp and saw the great ratings so I had to try it. Steven was sweet and helpful, the service was fast, and the sushi was delicious. I'm from Southern California and will definitely stop by the next time I visit Vegas :)

kHKlLQl0zE3XecDX-fa2MQ.text: I'm always skeptical about AYCE Japanese restaurants but this amazing new kid on the block DOES NOT disappoint! In fact it will blow away all the joints out of the water. Literally...Sushi the WAY it's suppose to be! Made to order, light, refreshing and the sushi rice is perfect! Not too much and not to little. But be patient.. the chefs are working overtime and the freshness is just as though the fish came out of the sea this morning! I'm not sure how they do it but coming from LA/OC, I'm serious when I say this place sets a new standard. Service is excellent and friendly!! We will definitely come back!! P.S. Kids 9 and under are 1/2 price. Here are the kids reviews - Chloe gave it a thousand stars and Lukey gave it a million hundred thousand stars...Chloe said if she was rich she would give them 1lb of gold for a tip! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poki Tuna Salad! Even the kids wanted seconds! Savory and spicy!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmmm!! Spicy scallops with their yum sauce!!
Photo of Sushi Way - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh lightly battered and crisp shrimp tempura! 10 orders later and still craving more!!

42_04myymg5rkP_7CAjXGg.text: Just called this place to ask a few menu questions and was instantly hung up on.   Well fuck you too sir! I'll take my party elsewhere!

cyxL_gBmGV5u2CoqBkXPMw.text: We came in because of the reviews and discovered all you can eat sushi.  It's not like an all you eat place with only three items to choose from. This place was fantastic!  Uni, Sweet Shrimp and all of my favorites.. really good food and great atmosphere.

-gibTwjwRirrm_r0RRDhug.text: Amazing food and hospitality.  Had the all you can eat sushi and what an experience.  Top notch in every aspect.  This is our go to sushi bar whenever we make a trip to Vegas!!!

EmGy-UQwBUZsEMGK3Y0ciw.text: I really LOVE this place!! I usually go to Yama (I've been loyal to Yama for 11 years) but that place has seriously outgrown that spot (waiting for a seat at lunch at 2pm on a Monday ....just me....seriously?). As a result I decided to give SUSHI WAY a shot. It's only been open a couple weeks but I work nearby and fellow coworkers have said positive things....   I went by myself and tried a few things, not a single 'meh' it was all delicious! I went back again the other day and tried more rolls- I LOVE that they incorporate coconut into their tempura and rolls-YUM! I tried the bacon wrapped scallops -bite size and perfect. Coconut shrimp tempura-yum! Screaming orgasm-creamy and delish! Seared white tuna, garlic tuna- yum yum! Snow White roll-perfectly savory! And I tried 3 other half rolls (two had sexy in the name) but I don't remember the other (no matter what, you just can't go wrong).   The service was AWESOME, they didn't miss a beat. Food was on point. It's close to my work. I don't believe it gets any better.... Oh wait, it does! They have stamp cards for A.y.c.e.  Yes indeedy, I'm one happy lady!

3NfPMxEHfuGg1bKkRx8aRg.text: Good sushi!..Good service. Sexy lazy is fire!! Will come back again. All you can eat sushi for $22 from 1130-4

FBGbX0MavRPNe_BmsgGwhA.text: I would give ZERO stars if I could, We went there on a Wednesday night, by Friday morning everyone who went all had the stomach "flu" virus, which isn't a flu at all, but is cause by bacteria found in contaminated foods. We were all sick, throwing up and all had diarrhea, I am never going back here again! Either Someone in the kitchen is not washing their hands, or they are not prepping their foods properly!!  STAY AWAY!

PIQnxKUFBxRh0PzCgy4BCQ.text: Service was meh. Server got a lot of things wrong every time we ordered. I can understand that he was busy though   The fish was great though. All the rolls and fish worked out well
